properties.name: HackTool - EfsPotato Named Pipe Creation
properties.description: Detects the pattern of a pipe name as used by the hack tool EfsPotato
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Koh Default Named Pipe
properties.description: Detects creation of default named pipes used by the Koh tool
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PsExec Tool Execution From Suspicious Locations - PipeName
properties.description: Detects PsExec default pipe creation where the image executed is located in a suspicious location. Which could indicate that the tool is being used in an attack
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - PAExec Default Named Pipe
properties.description: Detects PAExec default named pipe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Credential Dumping Tools Named Pipe Created
properties.description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via specific named pipe creation
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Alternate PowerShell Hosts Pipe
properties.description: Detects alternate PowerShell hosts potentially bypassing detections looking for powershell.exe
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Tim Shelton

properties.name: HackTool - DiagTrackEoP Default Named Pipe
properties.description: Detects creation of default named pipe used by the DiagTrackEoP POC, a tool that abuses "SeImpersonate" privilege.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - RemCom Default Named Pipe
properties.description: Detects default RemCom pipe creation
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CobaltStrike Named Pipe Pattern Regex
properties.description: Detects the creation of a named pipe matching a pattern used by CobaltStrike Malleable C2 profiles
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New PowerShell Instance Created
properties.description: Detects the execution of PowerShell via the creation of a named pipe starting with PSHost
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: CobaltStrike Named Pipe Patterns
properties.description: Detects the creation of a named pipe with a pattern found in CobaltStrike malleable C2 profiles
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CobaltStrike Named Pipe
properties.description: Detects the creation of a named pipe as used by CobaltStrike
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Wojciech Lesicki

properties.name: PUA - CSExec Default Named Pipe
properties.description: Detects default CSExec pipe creation
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WMI Event Consumer Created Named Pipe
properties.description: Detects the WMI Event Consumer service scrcons.exe creating a named pipe
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - CoercedPotato Named Pipe Creation
properties.description: Detects the pattern of a pipe name as used by the hack tool CoercedPotato
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Malicious Named Pipe Created
properties.description: Detects the creation of a named pipe seen used by known APTs or malware.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), blueteam0ps, elhoim

properties.name: ADFS Database Named Pipe Connection By Uncommon Tool
properties.description:
Detects suspicious local connections via a named pipe to the AD FS configuration database (Windows Internal Database).
Used to access information such as the AD FS configuration settings which contains sensitive information used to sign SAML tokens.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Potential Process Hollowing Activity
properties.description: Detects when a memory process image does not match the disk image, indicative of process hollowing.
properties.author: Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE '@scythe_io', Sittikorn S

properties.name: Suspicious Appended Extension
properties.description: Detects file renames where the target filename uses an uncommon double extension. Could indicate potential ransomware activity renaming files and adding a custom extension to the encrypted files, such as ".jpg.crypted", ".docx.locky", etc.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Self Extraction Directive File Created
properties.description:
Detects the creation of a binary file with the ".sed" extension. The ".sed" extension stand for Self Extraction Directive files.
These files are used by the "iexpress.exe" utility in order to create self extracting packages.
Attackers were seen abusing this utility and creating PE files with embedded ".sed" entries.
Usually ".sed" files are simple ini files and not PE binaries.
properties.author: Joseliyo Sanchez, @Joseliyo_Jstnk

properties.name: Suspicious File Created Via OneNote Application
properties.description: Detects suspicious files created via the OneNote application. This could indicate a potential malicious ".one"/".onepkg" file was executed as seen being used in malware activity in the wild
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Created Files by Microsoft Sync Center
properties.description: This rule detects suspicious files created by Microsoft Sync Center (mobsync)
properties.author: elhoim

properties.name: Visual Studio Code Tunnel Remote File Creation
properties.description: Detects the creation of file by the "node.exe" process in the ".vscode-server" directory. Could be a sign of remote file creation via VsCode tunnel feature
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Writing Local Admin Share
properties.description:
Aversaries may use to interact with a remote network share using Server Message Block (SMB).
This technique is used by post-exploitation frameworks.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious MSExchangeMailboxReplication ASPX Write
properties.description: Detects suspicious activity in which the MSExchangeMailboxReplication process writes .asp and .apsx files to disk, which could be a sign of ProxyShell exploitation
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Creation Activity From Fake Recycle.Bin Folder
properties.description: Detects file write event from/to a fake recycle bin folder that is often used as a staging directory for malware
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - File
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Attempt Via ErrorHandler.Cmd
properties.description:
Detects creation of a file named "ErrorHandler.cmd" in the "C:\WINDOWS\Setup\Scripts\" directory which could be used as a method of persistence
The content of C:\WINDOWS\Setup\Scripts\ErrorHandler.cmd is read whenever some tools under C:\WINDOWS\System32\oobe\ (e.g. Setup.exe) fail to run for any reason.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Target File
properties.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr file creation that stores a file to a suspicious location or contains a file with a suspicious extension
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Write to System32 Tasks
properties.description: Detects the creation of tasks from processes executed from suspicious locations
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Process Monitor Driver Creation By Non-Sysinternals Binary
properties.description: Detects creation of the Process Monitor driver by processes other than Process Monitor (procmon) itself.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential RipZip Attack on Startup Folder
properties.description:
Detects a phishing attack which expands a ZIP file containing a malicious shortcut.
If the victim expands the ZIP file via the explorer process, then the explorer process expands the malicious ZIP file and drops a malicious shortcut redirected to a backdoor into the Startup folder.
Additionally, the file name of the malicious shortcut in Startup folder contains {0AFACED1-E828-11D1-9187-B532F1E9575D} meaning the folder shortcut operation.
properties.author: Greg (rule)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using IEInstal - File
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using IEInstal.exe (UACMe 64)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PSEXEC Remote Execution File Artefact
properties.description: Detects creation of the PSEXEC key file. Which is created anytime a PsExec command is executed. It gets written to the file system and will be recorded in the USN Journal on the target system
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: LiveKD Kernel Memory Dump File Created
properties.description: Detects the creation of a file that has the same name as the default LiveKD kernel memory dump.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Files With System DLL Name In Unsuspected Locations
properties.description:
Detects the creation of a file with the ".dll" extension that has the name of a System DLL in uncommon or unsuspected locations. (Outisde of "System32", "SysWOW64", etc.).
It is highly recommended to perform an initial baseline before using this rule in production.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using EventVwr
properties.description: Detects the pattern of a UAC bypass using Windows Event Viewer
properties.author: Antonio Cocomazzi (idea), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: EVTX Created In Uncommon Location
properties.description:
Detects the creation of new files with the ".evtx" extension in non-common or non-standard location.
This could indicate tampering with default EVTX locations in order to evade security controls or simply exfiltration of event log to search for sensitive information within.
Note that backup software and legitimate administrator might perform similar actions during troubleshooting.
properties.author: D3F7A5105

properties.name: LSASS Process Dump Artefact In CrashDumps Folder
properties.description: Detects the presence of an LSASS dump file in the "CrashDumps" folder. This could be a sign of LSASS credential dumping. Techniques such as the LSASS Shtinkering have been seen abusing the Windows Error Reporting to dump said process.
properties.author: @pbssubhash

properties.name: Windows Terminal Profile Settings Modification By Uncommon Process
properties.description: Detects the creation or modification of the Windows Terminal Profile settings file "settings.json" by an uncommon process.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Homoglyph Attack Using Lookalike Characters in Filename
properties.description:
Detects the presence of unicode characters which are homoglyphs, or identical in appearance, to ASCII letter characters.
This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques. Only "perfect" homoglyphs are included; these are characters that
are indistinguishable from ASCII characters and thus may make excellent candidates for homoglyph attack characters.
properties.author: Micah Babinski, @micahbabinski

properties.name: Potential Webshell Creation On Static Website
properties.description: Detects the creation of files with certain extensions on a static web site. This can be indicative of potential uploads of a web shell.
properties.author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, Thurein Oo

properties.name: Suspicious Deno File Written from Remote Source
properties.description:
Detects Deno writing a file from a direct HTTP(s) call and writing to the appdata folder or bringing it's own malicious DLL.
This behavior may indicate an attempt to execute remotely hosted, potentially malicious files through deno.
properties.author: Josh Nickels, Michael Taggart

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Notepad++ Plugins
properties.description: Detects creation of new ".dll" files inside the plugins directory of a notepad++ installation by a process other than "gup.exe". Which could indicates possible persistence
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Legitimate Application Dropped Executable
properties.description: Detects programs on a Windows system that should not write executables to disk
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Binaries and Scripts in Public Folder
properties.description: Detects the creation of a file with a suspicious extension in the public folder, which could indicate potential malicious activity.
properties.author: The DFIR Report

properties.name: Suspicious PROCEXP152.sys File Created In TMP
properties.description:
Detects the creation of the PROCEXP152.sys file in the application-data local temporary folder.
This driver is used by Sysinternals Process Explorer but also by KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU) or Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU.
properties.author: xknow (@xknow_infosec), xorxes (@xor_xes)

properties.name: Rclone Config File Creation
properties.description: Detects Rclone config files being created
properties.author: Aaron Greetham (@beardofbinary) - NCC Group

properties.name: Suspicious Startup Folder Persistence
properties.description:
Detects the creation of potentially malicious script and executable files in Windows startup folders, which is a common persistence technique used by threat actors.
These files (.ps1, .vbs, .js, .bat, etc.) are automatically executed when a user logs in, making the Startup folder an attractive target for attackers.
This technique is frequently observed in malvertising campaigns and malware distribution where attackers attempt to maintain long-term access to compromised systems.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon File Created In Office Startup Folder
properties.description: Detects the creation of a file with an uncommon extension in an Office application startup folder
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Powerup Write Hijack DLL
properties.description:
Powerup tool's Write Hijack DLL exploits DLL hijacking for privilege escalation.
In it's default mode, it builds a self deleting .bat file which executes malicious command.
The detection rule relies on creation of the malicious bat file (debug.bat by default).
properties.author: Subhash Popuri (@pbssubhash)

properties.name: File With Uncommon Extension Created By An Office Application
properties.description: Detects the creation of files with an executable or script extension by an Office application.
properties.author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: LSASS Process Memory Dump Creation Via Taskmgr.EXE
properties.description: Detects the creation of an "lsass.dmp" file by the taskmgr process. This indicates a manual dumping of the LSASS.exe process memory using Windows Task Manager.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Potential DCOM InternetExplorer.Application DLL Hijack
properties.description: Detects potential DLL hijack of "iertutil.dll" found in the DCOM InternetExplorer.Application Class over the network
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR), wagga

properties.name: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
properties.description: Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WinSxS Executable File Creation By Non-System Process
properties.description: Detects the creation of binaries in the WinSxS folder by non-system processes
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Cred Dump Tools Dropped Files
properties.description: Files with well-known filenames (parts of credential dump software or files produced by them) creation
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Legitimate Application Dropped Archive
properties.description: Detects programs on a Windows system that should not write an archive to disk
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth

properties.name: Suspicious Binary Writes Via AnyDesk
properties.description:
Detects AnyDesk writing binary files to disk other than "gcapi.dll".
According to RedCanary research it is highly abnormal for AnyDesk to write executable files to disk besides gcapi.dll,
which is a legitimate DLL that is part of the Google Chrome web browser used to interact with the Google Cloud API. (See reference section for more details)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Executable File Creation
properties.description:
Detect creation of suspicious executable file names.
Some strings look for suspicious file extensions, others look for filenames that exploit unquoted service paths.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Creation of a Diagcab
properties.description: Detects the creation of diagcab file, which could be caused by some legitimate installer or is a sign of exploitation (review the filename and its location)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using .NET Code Profiler on MMC
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using .NET Code Profiler and mmc.exe DLL hijacking (UACMe 39)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Creation In Uncommon AppData Folder
properties.description: Detects the creation of suspicious files and folders inside the user's AppData folder but not inside any of the common and well known directories (Local, Romaing, LocalLow). This method could be used as a method to bypass detection who exclude the AppData folder in fear of FPs
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: NTDS Exfiltration Filename Patterns
properties.description: Detects creation of files with specific name patterns seen used in various tools that export the NTDS.DIT for exfiltration.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Dynamic CSharp Compile Artefact
properties.description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer File Write
properties.description: Detects file writes of WMI script event consumer
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious DMP/HDMP File Creation
properties.description: Detects the creation of a file with the ".dmp"/".hdmp" extension by a shell or scripting application such as "cmd", "powershell", etc. Often created by software during a crash. Memory dumps can sometimes contain sensitive information such as credentials. It's best to determine the source of the crash.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - NPPSpy Hacktool Usage
properties.description: Detects the use of NPPSpy hacktool that stores cleartext passwords of users that logged in to a local file
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ADSI-Cache File Creation By Uncommon Tool
properties.description: Detects the creation of an "Active Directory Schema Cache File" (.sch) file by an uncommon tool.
properties.author: xknow @xknow_infosec, Tim Shelton

properties.name: Malicious PowerShell Scripts - FileCreation
properties.description: Detects the creation of known offensive powershell scripts used for exploitation
properties.author: Markus Neis, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Mustafa Kaan Demir, Georg Lauenstein

properties.name: Office Macro File Download
properties.description:
Detects the creation of a new office macro files on the system via an application (browser, mail client).
This can help identify potential malicious activity, such as the download of macro-enabled documents that could be used for exploitation.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ISO File Created Within Temp Folders
properties.description: Detects the creation of a ISO file in the Outlook temp folder or in the Appdata temp folder. Typical of Qakbot TTP from end-July 2022.
properties.author: @sam0x90

properties.name: ScreenConnect Temporary Installation Artefact
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Legitimate Application Dropped Script
properties.description: Detects programs on a Windows system that should not write scripts to disk
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Microsoft Office Add-In
properties.description: Detects potential persistence activity via startup add-ins that load when Microsoft Office starts (.wll/.xll are simply .dll fit for Word or Excel).
properties.author: NVISO

properties.name: Malicious DLL File Dropped in the Teams or OneDrive Folder
properties.description:
Detects creation of a malicious DLL file in the location where the OneDrive or Team applications
Upon execution of the Teams or OneDrive application, the dropped malicious DLL file ("iphlpapi.dll") is sideloaded
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: New Custom Shim Database Created
properties.description:
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims.
The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PDF File Created By RegEdit.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the creation of a file with the ".pdf" extension by the "RegEdit.exe" process.
This indicates that a user is trying to print/save a registry key as a PDF in order to potentially extract sensitive information and bypass defenses.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ADExplorer Writing Complete AD Snapshot Into .dat File
properties.description: Detects the dual use tool ADExplorer writing a complete AD snapshot into a .dat file. This can be used by attackers to extract data for Bloodhound, usernames for password spraying or use the meta data for social engineering. The snapshot doesn't contain password hashes but there have been cases, where administrators put passwords in the comment field.
properties.author: Arnim Rupp (Nextron Systems), Thomas Patzke

properties.name: Creation Exe for Service with Unquoted Path
properties.description:
Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking vulnerable file path references.
Adversaries can take advantage of paths that lack surrounding quotations by placing an executable in a higher level directory within the path, so that Windows will choose the adversary's executable to launch.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - QuarksPwDump Dump File
properties.description: Detects a dump file written by QuarksPwDump password dumper
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Privilege Escalation Attempt Via .Exe.Local Technique
properties.description: Detects potential privilege escalation attempt via the creation of the "*.Exe.Local" folder inside the "System32" directory in order to sideload "comctl32.dll"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Subhash P (@pbssubhash)

properties.name: PowerShell Module File Created By Non-PowerShell Process
properties.description: Detects the creation of a new PowerShell module ".psm1", ".psd1", ".dll", ".ps1", etc. by a non-PowerShell process
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ISO or Image Mount Indicator in Recent Files
properties.description:
Detects the creation of recent element file that points to an .ISO, .IMG, .VHD or .VHDX file as often used in phishing attacks.
This can be a false positive on server systems but on workstations users should rarely mount .iso or .img files.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Double Extension Files
properties.description: Detects dropped files with double extensions, which is often used by malware as a method to abuse the fact that Windows hide default extensions by default.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Script Dropped Via PowerShell.EXE
properties.description: Detects PowerShell creating a PowerShell file (.ps1). While often times this behavior is benign, sometimes it can be a sign of a dropper script trying to achieve persistence.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Microsoft Office Startup Folder
properties.description: Detects creation of Microsoft Office files inside of one of the default startup folders in order to achieve persistence.
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious LNK Double Extension File Created
properties.description: Detects the creation of files with an "LNK" as a second extension. This is sometimes used by malware as a method to abuse the fact that Windows hides the "LNK" extension by default.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: TeamViewer Remote Session
properties.description: Detects the creation of log files during a TeamViewer remote session
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using Consent and Comctl32 - File
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using consent.exe and comctl32.dll (UACMe 22)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious ASPX File Drop by Exchange
properties.description: Detects suspicious file type dropped by an Exchange component in IIS into a suspicious folder
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), MSTI (query, idea)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using NTFS Reparse Point - File
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using NTFS reparse point and wusa.exe DLL hijacking (UACMe 36)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Typical HiveNightmare SAM File Export
properties.description: Detects files written by the different tools that exploit HiveNightmare
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Hidden Directory Creation Via NTFS INDEX_ALLOCATION Stream
properties.description: Detects the creation of hidden file/folder with the "::$index_allocation" stream. Which can be used as a technique to prevent access to folder and files from tooling such as "explorer.exe" and "powershell.exe"
properties.author: Scoubi (@ScoubiMtl)

properties.name: Suspicious Files in Default GPO Folder
properties.description: Detects the creation of copy of suspicious files (EXE/DLL) to the default GPO storage folder
properties.author: elhoim

properties.name: Self Extraction Directive File Created In Potentially Suspicious Location
properties.description:
Detects the creation of Self Extraction Directive files (.sed) in a potentially suspicious location.
These files are used by the "iexpress.exe" utility in order to create self extracting packages.
Attackers were seen abusing this utility and creating PE files with embedded ".sed" entries.
properties.author: Joseliyo Sanchez, @Joseliyo_Jstnk

properties.name: NTDS.DIT Creation By Uncommon Process
properties.description: Detects creation of a file named "ntds.dit" (Active Directory Database) by an uncommon process or a process located in a suspicious directory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential SAM Database Dump
properties.description: Detects the creation of files that look like exports of the local SAM (Security Account Manager)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: VsCode Powershell Profile Modification
properties.description: Detects the creation or modification of a vscode related powershell profile which could indicate suspicious activity as the profile can be used as a mean of persistence
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Office Macro File Creation From Suspicious Process
properties.description: Detects the creation of a office macro file from a a suspicious process
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Startup Folder File Write
properties.description: A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: LSASS Process Memory Dump Files
properties.description: Detects creation of files with names used by different memory dumping tools to create a memory dump of the LSASS process memory, which contains user credentials.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Winnti Dropper Activity
properties.description: Detects files dropped by Winnti as described in RedMimicry Winnti playbook
properties.author: Alexander Rausch

properties.name: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - File
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Inveigh Execution Artefacts
properties.description: Detects the presence and execution of Inveigh via dropped artefacts
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Assembly DLL Creation Via AspNetCompiler
properties.description: Detects the creation of new DLL assembly files by "aspnet_compiler.exe", which could be a sign of "aspnet_compiler" abuse to proxy execution through a build provider.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - RemoteKrbRelay SMB Relay Secrets Dump Module Indicators
properties.description: Detects the creation of file with specific names used by RemoteKrbRelay SMB Relay attack module.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Created in Outlook Temporary Directory
properties.description:
Detects the creation of files with suspicious file extensions in the temporary directory that Outlook uses when opening attachments.
This can be used to detect spear-phishing campaigns that use suspicious files as attachments, which may contain malicious code.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Files With System Process Name In Unsuspected Locations
properties.description:
Detects the creation of an executable with a system process name in folders other than the system ones (System32, SysWOW64, etc.).
It is highly recommended to perform an initial baseline before using this rule in production.
properties.author: Sander Wiebing, Tim Shelton, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Write to SharePoint Layouts Directory
properties.description:
Detects suspicious file writes to SharePoint layouts directory which could indicate webshell activity or post-exploitation.
This behavior has been observed in the exploitation of SharePoint vulnerabilities such as CVE-2025-49704, CVE-2025-49706 or CVE-2025-53770.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Advanced IP Scanner - File Event
properties.description: Detects the use of Advanced IP Scanner. Seems to be a popular tool for ransomware groups.
properties.author: @ROxPinTeddy

properties.name: Octopus Scanner Malware
properties.description: Detects Octopus Scanner Malware.
properties.author: NVISO

properties.name: LiveKD Driver Creation By Uncommon Process
properties.description: Detects the creation of the LiveKD driver by a process image other than "livekd.exe".
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Creation Of Non-Existent System DLL
properties.description:
Detects the creation of system DLLs that are usually not present on the system (or at least not in system directories).
Usually this technique is used to achieve DLL hijacking.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), fornotes

properties.name: UEFI Persistence Via Wpbbin - FileCreation
properties.description: Detects creation of a file named "wpbbin" in the "%systemroot%\system32\" directory. Which could be indicative of UEFI based persistence method
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: OneNote Attachment File Dropped In Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects creation of files with the ".one"/".onepkg" extension in suspicious or uncommon locations. This could be a sign of attackers abusing OneNote attachments
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Suspicious PowerShell Module File Created
properties.description: Detects the creation of a new PowerShell module in the first folder of the module directory structure "\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\malware\malware.psm1". This is somewhat an uncommon practice as legitimate modules often includes a version folder.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: NTDS.DIT Created
properties.description: Detects creation of a file named "ntds.dit" (Active Directory Database)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Temporary File
properties.description:
Detects the creation of files in a specific location by ScreenConnect RMM.
ScreenConnect has feature to remotely execute binaries on a target machine. These binaries will be dropped to ":\Users\<username>\Documents\ConnectWiseControl\Temp\" before execution.
properties.author: Ali Alwashali

properties.name: Suspicious Creation with Colorcpl
properties.description: Once executed, colorcpl.exe will copy the arbitrary file to c:\windows\system32\spool\drivers\color\
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: CSExec Service File Creation
properties.description: Detects default CSExec service filename which indicates CSExec service installation and execution
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Interactive PowerShell as SYSTEM
properties.description: Detects the creation of files that indicator an interactive use of PowerShell in the SYSTEM user context
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: GoToAssist Temporary Installation Artefact
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using IDiagnostic Profile - File
properties.description: Detects the creation of a file by "dllhost.exe" in System32 directory part of "IDiagnosticProfileUAC" UAC bypass technique
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Hijack Legit RDP Session to Move Laterally
properties.description: Detects the usage of tsclient share to place a backdoor on the RDP source machine's startup folder
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: PCRE.NET Package Temp Files
properties.description: Detects processes creating temp files related to PCRE.NET package
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: AWL Bypass with Winrm.vbs and Malicious WsmPty.xsl/WsmTxt.xsl - File
properties.description: Detects execution of attacker-controlled WsmPty.xsl or WsmTxt.xsl via winrm.vbs and copied cscript.exe (can be renamed)
properties.author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community

properties.name: Creation of WerFault.exe/Wer.dll in Unusual Folder
properties.description: Detects the creation of a file named "WerFault.exe" or "wer.dll" in an uncommon folder, which could be a sign of WerFault DLL hijacking.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: WScript or CScript Dropper - File
properties.description: Detects a file ending in jse, vbe, js, vba, vbs written by cscript.exe or wscript.exe
properties.author: Tim Shelton

properties.name: DPAPI Backup Keys And Certificate Export Activity IOC
properties.description: Detects file names with specific patterns seen generated and used by tools such as Mimikatz and DSInternals related to exported or stolen DPAPI backup keys and certificates.
properties.author: Nounou Mbeiri, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Write to Webapps Root Directory
properties.description:
Detects suspicious file writes to the root directory of web applications, particularly Apache web servers or Tomcat servers.
This may indicate an attempt to deploy malicious files such as web shells or other unauthorized scripts.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using MSConfig Token Modification - File
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a msconfig GUI hack (UACMe 55)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Get-Variable.exe Creation
properties.description:
Get-Variable is a valid PowerShell cmdlet
WindowsApps is by default in the path where PowerShell is executed.
So when the Get-Variable command is issued on PowerShell execution, the system first looks for the Get-Variable executable in the path and executes the malicious binary instead of looking for the PowerShell cmdlet.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Wmiexec Default Output File
properties.description: Detects the creation of the default output filename used by the wmiexec tool
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WinRAR Creating Files in Startup Locations
properties.description:
Detects WinRAR creating files in Windows startup locations, which may indicate an attempt to establish persistence by adding malicious files to the Startup folder.
This kind of behaviour has been associated with exploitation of WinRAR path traversal vulnerability CVE-2025-6218 or CVE-2025-8088.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Anydesk Temporary Artefact
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Initial Access via DLL Search Order Hijacking
properties.description: Detects attempts to create a DLL file to a known desktop application dependencies folder such as Slack, Teams or OneDrive and by an unusual process. This may indicate an attempt to load a malicious module via DLL search order hijacking.
properties.author: Tim Rauch (rule), Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack - File
properties.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `wbemcomn.dll` in the `C:\Windows\System32\wbem\` directory over the network and loading it for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Drop Binaries Into Spool Drivers Color Folder
properties.description: Detects the creation of suspcious binary files inside the "\windows\system32\spool\drivers\color\" as seen in the blog referenced below
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Impacket File Indicators
properties.description: Detects file creation events with filename patterns used by Impacket.
properties.author: The DFIR Report, IrishDeath

properties.name: Potential File Extension Spoofing Using Right-to-Left Override
properties.description: Detects suspicious filenames that contain a right-to-left override character and a potentially spoofed file extensions.
properties.author: Jonathan Peters (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: GatherNetworkInfo.VBS Reconnaissance Script Output
properties.description: Detects creation of files which are the results of executing the built-in reconnaissance script "C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs".
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: RemCom Service File Creation
properties.description: Detects default RemCom service filename which indicates RemCom service installation and execution
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - CrackMapExec File Indicators
properties.description: Detects file creation events with filename patterns used by CrackMapExec.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Potential Remote Credential Dumping Activity Via CrackMapExec Or Impacket-Secretsdump
properties.description: Detects default filenames output from the execution of CrackMapExec and Impacket-secretsdump against an endpoint.
properties.author: SecurityAura

properties.name: Windows Shell/Scripting Application File Write to Suspicious Folder
properties.description: Detects Windows shells and scripting applications that write files to suspicious folders
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: .RDP File Created By Uncommon Application
properties.description: Detects creation of a file with an ".rdp" extension by an application that doesn't commonly create such files.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Profile Modification
properties.description: Detects the creation or modification of a powershell profile which could indicate suspicious activity as the profile can be used as a mean of persistence
properties.author: HieuTT35, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Creation TXT File in User Desktop
properties.description: Ransomware create txt file in the user Desktop
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: New Outlook Macro Created
properties.description: Detects the creation of a macro file for Outlook.
properties.author: @ScoubiMtl

properties.name: Suspicious File Created In PerfLogs
properties.description: Detects suspicious file based on their extension being created in "C:\PerfLogs\". Note that this directory mostly contains ".etl" files
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: BloodHound Collection Files
properties.description: Detects default file names outputted by the BloodHound collection tool SharpHound
properties.author: C.J. May

properties.name: PowerShell Module File Created
properties.description: Detects the creation of a new PowerShell module ".psm1", ".psd1", ".dll", ".ps1", etc.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Installation of TeamViewer Desktop
properties.description: TeamViewer_Desktop.exe is create during install
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious desktop.ini Action
properties.description: Detects unusual processes accessing desktop.ini, which can be leveraged to alter how Explorer displays a folder's content (i.e. renaming files) without changing them on disk.
properties.author: Maxime Thiebaut (@0xThiebaut), Tim Shelton (HAWK.IO)

properties.name: Publisher Attachment File Dropped In Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects creation of files with the ".pub" extension in suspicious or uncommon locations. This could be a sign of attackers abusing Publisher documents
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PSScriptPolicyTest Creation By Uncommon Process
properties.description: Detects the creation of the "PSScriptPolicyTest" PowerShell script by an uncommon process. This file is usually generated by Microsoft Powershell to test against Applocker.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: LiveKD Driver Creation
properties.description: Detects the creation of the LiveKD driver, which is used for live kernel debugging
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Creation In Suspicious Directory By Msdt.EXE
properties.description: Detects msdt.exe creating files in suspicious directories which could be a sign of exploitation of either Follina or Dogwalk vulnerabilities
properties.author: Vadim Varganov, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WerFault LSASS Process Memory Dump
properties.description: Detects WerFault creating a dump file with a name that indicates that the dump file could be an LSASS process memory, which contains user credentials
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DLL Search Order Hijackig Via Additional Space in Path
properties.description:
Detects when an attacker create a similar folder structure to windows system folders such as (Windows, Program Files...)
but with a space in order to trick DLL load search order and perform a "DLL Search Order Hijacking" attack
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Drop by Exchange
properties.description: Detects suspicious file type dropped by an Exchange component in IIS
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Office Macro File Creation
properties.description: Detects the creation of a new office macro files on the systems
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SafetyKatz Dump Indicator
properties.description: Detects default lsass dump filename generated by SafetyKatz.
properties.author: Markus Neis

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Outlook Form
properties.description: Detects the creation of a new Outlook form which can contain malicious code
properties.author: Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Startup Shortcut Persistence Via PowerShell.EXE
properties.description:
Detects PowerShell writing startup shortcuts.
This procedure was highlighted in Red Canary Intel Insights Oct. 2021, "We frequently observe adversaries using PowerShell to write malicious .lnk files into the startup directory to establish persistence.
Accordingly, this detection opportunity is likely to identify persistence mechanisms in multiple threats.
In the context of Yellow Cockatoo, this persistence mechanism eventually launches the command-line script that leads to the installation of a malicious DLL"
properties.author: Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE

properties.name: HackTool - Dumpert Process Dumper Default File
properties.description: Detects the creation of the default dump file used by Outflank Dumpert tool. A process dumper, which dumps the lsass process memory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Process Explorer Driver Creation By Non-Sysinternals Binary
properties.description:
Detects creation of the Process Explorer drivers by processes other than Process Explorer (procexp) itself.
Hack tools or malware may use the Process Explorer driver to elevate privileges, drops it to disk for a few moments, runs a service using that driver and removes it afterwards.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Screensaver Binary File Creation
properties.description:
Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by user inactivity.
Screensavers are programs that execute after a configurable time of user inactivity and consist of Portable Executable (PE) files with a .scr file extension
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious DotNET CLR Usage Log Artifact
properties.description: Detects the creation of Usage Log files by the CLR (clr.dll). These files are named after the executing process once the assembly is finished executing for the first time in the (user) session context.
properties.author: frack113, omkar72, oscd.community, Wojciech Lesicki

properties.name: Adwind RAT / JRAT File Artifact
properties.description: Detects javaw.exe in AppData folder as used by Adwind / JRAT
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tom Ueltschi, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: SCR File Write Event
properties.description: Detects the creation of screensaver files (.scr) outside of system folders. Attackers may execute an application as an ".SCR" file using "rundll32.exe desk.cpl,InstallScreenSaver" for example.
properties.author: Christopher Peacock @securepeacock, SCYTHE @scythe_io

properties.name: Windows Binaries Write Suspicious Extensions
properties.description: Detects Windows executables that write files with suspicious extensions
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: VHD Image Download Via Browser
properties.description:
Detects creation of ".vhd"/".vhdx" files by browser processes.
Malware can use mountable Virtual Hard Disk ".vhd" files to encapsulate payloads and evade security controls.
properties.author: frack113, Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE '@scythe_io'

properties.name: Renamed VsCode Code Tunnel Execution - File Indicator
properties.description: Detects the creation of a file with the name "code_tunnel.json" which indicate execution and usage of VsCode tunneling utility by an "Image" or "Process" other than VsCode.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Outlook Macro Created
properties.description: Detects the creation of a macro file for Outlook.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PsExec Service File Creation
properties.description: Detects default PsExec service filename which indicates PsExec service installation and execution
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: HackTool - Mimikatz Kirbi File Creation
properties.description: Detects the creation of files created by mimikatz such as ".kirbi", "mimilsa.log", etc.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), David ANDRE

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious WDAC Policy File Creation
properties.description: Detects suspicious Windows Defender Application Control (WDAC) policy file creation from abnormal processes that could be abused by attacker to block EDR/AV components while allowing their own malicious code to run on the system.
properties.author: X__Junior

properties.name: NTDS.DIT Creation By Uncommon Parent Process
properties.description: Detects creation of a file named "ntds.dit" (Active Directory Database) by an uncommon parent process or directory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon File Creation By Mysql Daemon Process
properties.description:
Detects the creation of files with scripting or executable extensions by Mysql daemon.
Which could be an indicator of "User Defined Functions" abuse to download malware.
properties.author: Joseph Kamau

properties.name: IIS WebServer Access Logs Deleted
properties.description: Detects the deletion of IIS WebServer access logs which may indicate an attempt to destroy forensic evidence
properties.author: Tim Rauch (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ADS Zone.Identifier Deleted By Uncommon Application
properties.description: Detects the deletion of the "Zone.Identifier" ADS by an uncommon process. Attackers can leverage this in order to bypass security restrictions that make use of the ADS such as Microsoft Office apps.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Tomcat WebServer Logs Deleted
properties.description: Detects the deletion of tomcat WebServer logs which may indicate an attempt to destroy forensic evidence
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Unusual File Deletion by Dns.exe
properties.description: Detects an unexpected file being deleted by dns.exe which my indicate activity related to remote code execution or other forms of exploitation as seen in CVE-2020-1350 (SigRed)
properties.author: Tim Rauch (Nextron Systems), Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Process Deletion of Its Own Executable
properties.description: Detects the deletion of a process's executable by itself. This is usually not possible without workarounds and may be used by malware to hide its traces.
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Backup Files Deleted
properties.description: Detects deletion of files with extensions often used for backup files. Adversaries may delete or remove built-in operating system data and turn off services designed to aid in the recovery of a corrupted system to prevent recovery.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: File Deleted Via Sysinternals SDelete
properties.description: Detects the deletion of files by the Sysinternals SDelete utility. It looks for the common name pattern used to rename files.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: TeamViewer Log File Deleted
properties.description: Detects the deletion of the TeamViewer log files which may indicate an attempt to destroy forensic evidence
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Exchange PowerShell Cmdlet History Deleted
properties.description: Detects the deletion of the Exchange PowerShell cmdlet History logs which may indicate an attempt to destroy forensic evidence
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Prefetch File Deleted
properties.description: Detects the deletion of a prefetch file which may indicate an attempt to destroy forensic evidence
properties.author: Cedric MAURUGEON

properties.name: EventLog EVTX File Deleted
properties.description: Detects the deletion of the event log files which may indicate an attempt to destroy forensic evidence
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Console History Logs Deleted
properties.description: Detects the deletion of the PowerShell console History logs which may indicate an attempt to destroy forensic evidence
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Access To Crypto Currency Wallets By Uncommon Applications
properties.description:
Detects file access requests to crypto currency files by uncommon processes.
Could indicate potential attempt of crypto currency wallet stealing.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Credential Manager Access By Uncommon Applications
properties.description:
Detects suspicious processes based on name and location that access the windows credential manager and vault.
Which can be a sign of credential stealing. Example case would be usage of mimikatz "dpapi::cred" function
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Access to Browser Credential Storage
properties.description:
Detects file access to browser credential storage paths by non-browser processes, which may indicate credential access attempts.
Adversaries may attempt to access browser credential storage to extract sensitive information such as usernames and passwords or cookies.
This behavior is often commonly observed in credential stealing malware.
properties.author: frack113, X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems), Parth-FourCore

properties.name: Access To Potentially Sensitive Sysvol Files By Uncommon Applications
properties.description: Detects file access requests to potentially sensitive files hosted on the Windows Sysvol share.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Access To Windows DPAPI Master Keys By Uncommon Applications
properties.description:
Detects file access requests to the the Windows Data Protection API Master keys by an uncommon application.
This can be a sign of credential stealing. Example case would be usage of mimikatz "dpapi::masterkey" function
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Access To Windows Credential History File By Uncommon Applications
properties.description:
Detects file access requests to the Windows Credential History File by an uncommon application.
This can be a sign of credential stealing. Example case would be usage of mimikatz "dpapi::credhist" function
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Microsoft Teams Sensitive File Access By Uncommon Applications
properties.description: Detects file access attempts to sensitive Microsoft teams files (leveldb, cookies) by an uncommon process.
properties.author: @SerkinValery

properties.name: File Creation Date Changed to Another Year
properties.description:
Attackers may change the file creation time of a backdoor to make it look like it was installed with the operating system.
Note that many processes legitimately change the creation time of a file; it does not necessarily indicate malicious activity.
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Unusual File Modification by dns.exe
properties.description: Detects an unexpected file being modified by dns.exe which my indicate activity related to remote code execution or other forms of exploitation as seen in CVE-2020-1350 (SigRed)
properties.author: Tim Rauch (Nextron Systems), Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Suspicious Scripting in a WMI Consumer
properties.description: Detects suspicious commands that are related to scripting/powershell in WMI Event Consumers
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro

properties.name: Suspicious Encoded Scripts in a WMI Consumer
properties.description: Detects suspicious encoded payloads in WMI Event Consumers
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WMI Event Subscription
properties.description: Detects creation of WMI event subscription persistence method
properties.author: Tom Ueltschi (@c_APT_ure)

properties.name: Tamper Windows Defender - PSClassic
properties.description: Attempting to disable scheduled scanning and other parts of Windows Defender ATP or set default actions to allow.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Nslookup PowerShell Download Cradle
properties.description: Detects a powershell download cradle using nslookup. This cradle uses nslookup to extract payloads from DNS records.
properties.author: Sai Prashanth Pulisetti @pulisettis, Aishwarya Singam

properties.name: Potential RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.EXE Abuse
properties.description: Detects PowerShell module creation where the module Contents are set to "function Get-VMRemoteFXPhysicalVideoAdapter". This could be a sign of potential abuse of  the "RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe" binary which is known to be vulnerable to module load-order hijacking.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Delete Volume Shadow Copies Via WMI With PowerShell
properties.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities via PowerShell
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Downgrade Attack - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects PowerShell downgrade attack by comparing the host versions with the actually used engine version 2.0
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Lee Holmes (idea), Harish Segar (improvements)

properties.name: Use Get-NetTCPConnection
properties.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of network connections to or from the compromised system they are currently accessing or from remote systems by querying for information over the network.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Called from an Executable Version Mismatch
properties.description: Detects PowerShell called from an executable by the version mismatch method
properties.author: Sean Metcalf (source), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Non PowerShell WSMAN COM Provider
properties.description: Detects suspicious use of the WSMAN provider without PowerShell.exe as the host application.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Download
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote PowerShell Session (PS Classic)
properties.description: Detects remote PowerShell sessions
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Renamed Powershell Under Powershell Channel
properties.description: Detects a renamed Powershell execution, which is a common technique used to circumvent security controls and bypass detection logic that's dependent on process names and process paths.
properties.author: Harish Segar, frack113

properties.name: Netcat The Powershell Version
properties.description: Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Zip A Folder With PowerShell For Staging In Temp - PowerShell
properties.description:
Detects PowerShell scripts that make use of the "Compress-Archive" Cmdlet in order to compress folders and files where the output is stored in a potentially suspicious location that is used often by malware for exfiltration.
An adversary might compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Get Current User
properties.description: Detects the use of PowerShell to identify the current logged user.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Powershell XML Execute Command
properties.description:
Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution.
PowerShell is a powerful interactive command-line interface and scripting environment included in the Windows operating system. (Citation: TechNet PowerShell)
Adversaries can use PowerShell to perform a number of actions, including discovery of information and execution of code
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - WinPwn Execution - ScriptBlock
properties.description: Detects scriptblock text keywords indicative of potential usge of the tool WinPwn. A tool for Windows and Active Directory reconnaissance and exploitation.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Testing Usage of Uncommonly Used Port
properties.description:
Adversaries may communicate using a protocol and port paring that are typically not associated.
For example, HTTPS over port 8088(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019) or port 587(Citation: Fortinet Agent Tesla April 2018) as opposed to the traditional port 443.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Windows Screen Capture with CopyFromScreen
properties.description:
Adversaries may attempt to take screen captures of the desktop to gather information over the course of an operation.
Screen capturing functionality may be included as a feature of a remote access tool used in post-compromise operations
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Disable Powershell Command History
properties.description: Detects scripts or commands that disabled the Powershell command history by removing psreadline module
properties.author: Ali Alwashali

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Mailbox Export to Share - PS
properties.description: Detects usage of the powerShell New-MailboxExportRequest Cmdlet to exports a mailbox to a remote or local share, as used in ProxyShell exploitations
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Root Certificate Installed - PowerShell
properties.description: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.
properties.author: oscd.community, @redcanary, Zach Stanford @svch0st

properties.name: Suspicious Service DACL Modification Via Set-Service Cmdlet - PS
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Set-Service" powershell cmdlet to configure a new SecurityDescriptor that allows a service to be hidden from other utilities such as "sc.exe", "Get-Service"...etc. (Works only in powershell 7)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Credential Prompt
properties.description: Detects PowerShell calling a credential prompt
properties.author: John Lambert (idea), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Active Directory Group Enumeration With Get-AdGroup
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Get-AdGroup" cmdlet to enumerate Groups within Active Directory
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Download - Powershell Script
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DSInternals Suspicious PowerShell Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
properties.description:
Detects execution and usage of the DSInternals PowerShell module. Which can be used to perform what might be considered as suspicious activity such as dumping DPAPI backup keys or manipulating NTDS.DIT files.
The DSInternals PowerShell Module exposes several internal features of Active Directory and Azure Active Directory. These include FIDO2 and NGC key auditing, offline ntds.dit file manipulation, password auditing, DC recovery from IFM backups and password hash calculation.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Tamper Windows Defender - ScriptBlockLogging
properties.description: Detects PowerShell scripts attempting to disable scheduled scanning and other parts of Windows Defender ATP or set default actions to allow.
properties.author: frack113, elhoim, Tim Shelton (fps, alias support), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Generic
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Data Exfiltration Via Audio File
properties.description: Detects potential exfiltration attempt via audio file using PowerShell
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the following code block \u2014
properties.author: Daniel Bohannon (@Mandiant/@FireEye), oscd.community

properties.name: PowerShell Set-Acl On Windows Folder - PsScript
properties.description: Detects PowerShell scripts to set the ACL to a file in the Windows folder
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Automated Collection Command PowerShell
properties.description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Modify Group Policy Settings - ScriptBlockLogging
properties.description: Detect malicious GPO modifications can be used to implement many other malicious behaviors.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Call To Win32_NTEventlogFile Class - PSScript
properties.description: Detects usage of the WMI class "Win32_NTEventlogFile" in a potentially suspicious way (delete, backup, change permissions, etc.) from a PowerShell script
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Winlogon Helper DLL
properties.description:
Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete.
Registry entries in HKLM\Software[Wow6432Node]Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ and HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ are
used to manage additional helper programs and functionalities that support Winlogon. Malicious modifications to these Registry keys may cause Winlogon to
load and execute malicious DLLs and/or executables.
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Access to Browser Login Data
properties.description:
Adversaries may acquire credentials from web browsers by reading files specific to the target browser.
Web browsers commonly save credentials such as website usernames and passwords so that they do not need to be entered manually in the future.
Web browsers typically store the credentials in an encrypted format within a credential store.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Web Access Installation - PsScript
properties.description: Detects the installation and configuration of PowerShell Web Access, which could be used for remote access and potential abuse
properties.author: Michael Haag

properties.name: Recon Information for Export with PowerShell
properties.description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious SSL Connection
properties.description: Adversaries may employ a known encryption algorithm to conceal command and control traffic rather than relying on any inherent protections provided by a communication protocol.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Abuse of Service Permissions to Hide Services Via Set-Service - PS
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Set-Service" powershell cmdlet to configure a new SecurityDescriptor that allows a service to be hidden from other utilities such as "sc.exe", "Get-Service"...etc. (Works only in powershell 7)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Suspicious PowerShell Keywords
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious keywords that could indicate the use of a PowerShell exploitation framework
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Perez Diego (@darkquassar), Tuan Le (NCSGroup)

properties.name: Potential Keylogger Activity
properties.description: Detects PowerShell scripts that contains reference to keystroke capturing functions
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WMImplant Hack Tool
properties.description: Detects parameters used by WMImplant
properties.author: NVISO

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Unsigned AppX Installation Attempt Using Add-AppxPackage - PsScript
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Add-AppxPackage" or it's alias "Add-AppPackage" to install unsigned AppX packages
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Get-ADUser Enumeration Using UserAccountControl Flags
properties.description: Detects AS-REP roasting is an attack that is often-overlooked. It is not very common as you have to explicitly set accounts that do not require pre-authentication.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Add Windows Capability Via PowerShell Script
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Add-WindowsCapability" cmdlet to add Windows capabilities. Notable capabilities could be "OpenSSH" and others.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin - Powershell
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Create Volume Shadow Copy with Powershell
properties.description: Adversaries may attempt to access or create a copy of the Active Directory domain database in order to steal credential information
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - Rubeus Execution - ScriptBlock
properties.description: Detects the execution of the hacktool Rubeus using specific command line flags
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential AMSI Bypass Script Using NULL Bits
properties.description: Detects usage of special strings/null bits in order to potentially bypass AMSI functionalities
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious IO.FileStream
properties.description: Open a handle on the drive volume via the \\.\ DOS device path specifier and perform direct access read of the first few bytes of the volume.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Malicious Nishang PowerShell Commandlets
properties.description: Detects Commandlet names and arguments from the Nishang exploitation framework
properties.author: Alec Costello

properties.name: Powershell Create Scheduled Task
properties.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows Task Scheduler to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execution to Bypass Powershell Restriction
properties.description: Detects SyncAppvPublishingServer process execution which usually utilized by adversaries to bypass PowerShell execution restrictions.
properties.author: Ensar amil, @sblmsrsn, OSCD Community

properties.name: Enumerate Credentials from Windows Credential Manager With PowerShell
properties.description:
Adversaries may search for common password storage locations to obtain user credentials.
Passwords are stored in several places on a system, depending on the operating system or application holding the credentials.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Powershell DNSExfiltration
properties.description: DNSExfiltrator allows for transferring (exfiltrate) a file over a DNS request covert channel
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: User Discovery And Export Via Get-ADUser Cmdlet - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects usage of the Get-ADUser cmdlet to collect user information and output it to a file
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip - Powershell
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Powershell Directory Enumeration
properties.description: Detects technique used by MAZE ransomware to enumerate directories using Powershell
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Change User Agents with WebRequest
properties.description:
Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols associated with web traffic to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.
Commands to the remote system, and often the results of those commands, will be embedded within the protocol traffic between the client and server.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Enable Windows Remote Management
properties.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to interact with remote systems using Windows Remote Management (WinRM). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious GetTypeFromCLSID ShellExecute
properties.description: Detects suspicious Powershell code that execute COM Objects
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature Command PowerShell
properties.description:
Detect built in PowerShell cmdlet Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature, Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool.
Similar to DISM.exe, this cmdlet is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Unconstrained Delegation Discovery Via Get-ADComputer - ScriptBlock
properties.description: Detects the use of the "Get-ADComputer" cmdlet in order to identify systems which are configured for unconstrained delegation.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Zip A Folder With PowerShell For Staging In Temp - PowerShell Script
properties.description:
Detects PowerShell scripts that make use of the "Compress-Archive" Cmdlet in order to compress folders and files where the output is stored in a potentially suspicious location that is used often by malware for exfiltration.
An adversary might compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Replace Desktop Wallpaper by Powershell
properties.description:
