An adversary may deface systems internal to an organization in an attempt to intimidate or mislead users.
This may take the form of modifications to internal websites, or directly to user systems with the replacement of the desktop wallpaper
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell WMI Win32_Product Install MSI
properties.description: Detects the execution of an MSI file using PowerShell and the WMI Win32_Product class
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Powershell Keylogging
properties.description: Adversaries may log user keystrokes to intercept credentials as the user types them.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Powershell Local Email Collection
properties.description:
Adversaries may target user email on local systems to collect sensitive information.
Files containing email data can be acquired from a users local system, such as Outlook storage or cache files.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious X509Enrollment - Ps Script
properties.description: Detect use of X509Enrollment
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Import PowerShell Modules From Suspicious Directories
properties.description: Detects powershell scripts that import modules from suspicious directories
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher - Powershell
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Extracting Information with PowerShell
properties.description:
Adversaries may search local file systems and remote file shares for files containing insecurely stored credentials.
These can be files created by users to store their own credentials, shared credential stores for a group of individuals,
configuration files containing passwords for a system or service, or source code/binary files containing embedded passwords.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Detected Windows Software Discovery - PowerShell
properties.description: Adversaries may attempt to enumerate software for a variety of reasons, such as figuring out what security measures are present or if the compromised system has a version of software that is vulnerable.
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Start-Process PassThru
properties.description: Powershell use PassThru option to start in background
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Registry Modification Attempt Via VBScript - PowerShell
properties.description:
Detects attempts to modify the registry using VBScript's CreateObject("Wscript.shell") and RegWrite methods embedded within PowerShell scripts or commands.
Threat actors commonly embed VBScript code within PowerShell to perform registry modifications, attempting to evade detection that monitors for direct registry access through traditional tools.
This technique can be used for persistence, defense evasion, and privilege escalation by modifying registry keys without using regedit.exe, reg.exe, or PowerShell's native registry cmdlets.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Script With File Upload Capabilities
properties.description: Detects PowerShell scripts leveraging the "Invoke-WebRequest" cmdlet to send data via either "PUT" or "POST" method.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Invoke-Mimikatz PowerShell Script
properties.description: Detects Invoke-Mimikatz PowerShell script and alike. Mimikatz is a credential dumper capable of obtaining plaintext Windows account logins and passwords.
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Suspicious Process Discovery With Get-Process
properties.description: Get the processes that are running on the local computer.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Malicious PowerShell Commandlets - ScriptBlock
properties.description: Detects Commandlet names from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks
properties.author: Sean Metcalf, Florian Roth, Bartlomiej Czyz @bczyz1, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali, Tim Shelton, Mustafa Kaan Demir, Georg Lauenstein, Max Altgelt, Tobias Michalski, Austin Songer

properties.name: Potential COM Objects Download Cradles Usage - PS Script
properties.description: Detects usage of COM objects that can be abused to download files in PowerShell by CLSID
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Invoke-Item From Mount-DiskImage
properties.description: Adversaries may abuse container files such as disk image (.iso, .vhd) file formats to deliver malicious payloads that may not be tagged with MOTW.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Kerberos Ticket Request via PowerShell Script - ScriptBlock
properties.description:
Detects PowerShell scripts that utilize native PowerShell Identity modules to request Kerberos tickets.
This behavior is typically seen during a Kerberos or silver ticket attack. A successful execution will output the SPNs for the endpoint in question.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Veeam Backup Servers Credential Dumping Script Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of a PowerShell script that contains calls to the "Veeam.Backup" class, in order to dump stored credentials.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Suspicious Windows Feature Enabled
properties.description:
Detects usage of the built-in PowerShell cmdlet "Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature" used as a Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool.
Similar to DISM.exe, this cmdlet is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerView PowerShell Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
properties.description: Detects Cmdlet names from PowerView of the PowerSploit exploitation framework.
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Malicious ShellIntel PowerShell Commandlets
properties.description: Detects Commandlet names from ShellIntel exploitation scripts.
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Computer Discovery And Export Via Get-ADComputer Cmdlet - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects usage of the Get-ADComputer cmdlet to collect computer information and output it to a file
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.EXE Abuse - PowerShell ScriptBlock
properties.description: Detects PowerShell module creation where the module Contents are set to "function Get-VMRemoteFXPhysicalVideoAdapter". This could be a sign of potential abuse of the "RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe" binary which is known to be vulnerable to module load-order hijacking.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Remote Session Creation
properties.description:
Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution.
PowerShell is a powerful interactive command-line interface and scripting environment included in the Windows operating system
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Get Information for SMB Share
properties.description:
Adversaries may look for folders and drives shared on remote systems as a means of identifying sources of information to gather as
a precursor for Collection and to identify potential systems of interest for Lateral Movement.
Networks often contain shared network drives and folders that enable users to access file directories on various systems across a network.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: DirectorySearcher Powershell Exploitation
properties.description: Enumerates Active Directory to determine computers that are joined to the domain
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell ADRecon Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of ADRecon.ps1 for AD reconnaissance which has been reported to be actively used by FIN7
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Suspicious Get Local Groups Information - PowerShell
properties.description:
Detects the use of PowerShell modules and cmdlets to gather local group information.
Adversaries may use local system permission groups to determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group such as the local administrators group.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Password Policy Discovery With Get-AdDefaultDomainPasswordPolicy
properties.description: Detetcts PowerShell activity in which Get-Addefaultdomainpasswordpolicy is used to get the default password policy for an Active Directory domain.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Eventlog Clear
properties.description: Detects usage of known powershell cmdlets such as "Clear-EventLog" to clear the Windows event logs
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PSAsyncShell - Asynchronous TCP Reverse Shell
properties.description: Detects the use of PSAsyncShell an Asynchronous TCP Reverse Shell written in powershell
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Silence.EDA Detection
properties.description: Detects Silence EmpireDNSAgent as described in the Group-IP report
properties.author: Alina Stepchenkova, Group-IB, oscd.community

properties.name: Code Executed Via Office Add-in XLL File
properties.description:
Adversaries may abuse Microsoft Office add-ins to obtain persistence on a compromised system.
Office add-ins can be used to add functionality to Office programs
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential WinAPI Calls Via PowerShell Scripts
properties.description: Detects use of WinAPI functions in PowerShell scripts
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Tamper Windows Defender Remove-MpPreference - ScriptBlockLogging
properties.description: Detects attempts to remove Windows Defender configuration using the 'MpPreference' cmdlet
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Powershell Add Name Resolution Policy Table Rule
properties.description:
Detects powershell scripts that adds a Name Resolution Policy Table (NRPT) rule for the specified namespace.
This will bypass the default DNS server and uses a specified server for answering the query.
properties.author: Borna Talebi

properties.name: Deletion of Volume Shadow Copies via WMI with PowerShell - PS Script
properties.description: Detects deletion of Windows Volume Shadow Copies with PowerShell code and Get-WMIObject. This technique is used by numerous ransomware families such as Sodinokibi/REvil
properties.author: Tim Rauch, frack113

properties.name: Disable of ETW Trace - Powershell
properties.description: Detects usage of powershell cmdlets to disable or remove ETW trace sessions
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Mailbox SMTP Forward Rule
properties.description: Detects usage of the powerShell Set-Mailbox Cmdlet to set-up an SMTP forwarding rule.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Automated Collection Bookmarks Using Get-ChildItem PowerShell
properties.description:
Adversaries may enumerate browser bookmarks to learn more about compromised hosts.
Browser bookmarks may reveal personal information about users (ex: banking sites, interests, social media, etc.) as well as details about
internal network resources such as servers, tools/dashboards, or other related infrastructure.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious New-PSDrive to Admin Share
properties.description: Adversaries may use to interact with a remote network share using Server Message Block (SMB). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: AADInternals PowerShell Cmdlets Execution - PsScript
properties.description: Detects ADDInternals Cmdlet execution. A tool for administering Azure AD and Office 365. Which can be abused by threat actors to attack Azure AD or Office 365.
properties.author: Austin Songer (@austinsonger), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell WindowStyle Option
properties.description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden
properties.author: frack113, Tim Shelton (fp AWS)

properties.name: Clear PowerShell History - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects keywords that could indicate clearing PowerShell history
properties.author: Ilyas Ochkov, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: PowerShell Hotfix Enumeration
properties.description: Detects call to "Win32_QuickFixEngineering" in order to enumerate installed hotfixes often used in "enum" scripts by attackers
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Hyper-V Cmdlets
properties.description: Adversaries may carry out malicious operations using a virtual instance to avoid detection
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Remove Account From Domain Admin Group
properties.description:
Adversaries may interrupt availability of system and network resources by inhibiting access to accounts utilized by legitimate users.
Accounts may be deleted, locked, or manipulated (ex: changed credentials) to remove access to accounts.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Powershell Timestomp
properties.description:
Adversaries may modify file time attributes to hide new or changes to existing files.
Timestomping is a technique that modifies the timestamps of a file (the modify, access, create, and change times), often to mimic files that are in the same folder.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious GPO Discovery With Get-GPO
properties.description: Detect use of Get-GPO to get one GPO or all the GPOs in a domain.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Using Character Join
properties.description: Detects specific techniques often seen used inside of PowerShell scripts to obfscuate Alias creation
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: PowerShell Get-Process LSASS in ScriptBlock
properties.description: Detects a Get-Process command on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Security Software Discovery Via Powershell Script
properties.description:
Detects calls to "get-process" where the output is piped to a "where-object" filter to search for security solution processes.
Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of security software, configurations, defensive tools, and sensors that are installed on a system or in a cloud environment. This may include things such as firewall rules and anti-virus
properties.author: frack113, Anish Bogati, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Packet Capture Activity Via Start-NetEventSession - ScriptBlock
properties.description:
Detects the execution of powershell scripts with calls to the "Start-NetEventSession" cmdlet. Which allows an attacker to start event and packet capture for a network event session.
Adversaries may attempt to capture network to gather information over the course of an operation.
Data captured via this technique may include user credentials, especially those sent over an insecure, unencrypted protocol.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Live Memory Dump Using Powershell
properties.description: Detects usage of a PowerShell command to dump the live memory of a Windows machine
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Powershell LocalAccount Manipulation
properties.description:
Adversaries may manipulate accounts to maintain access to victim systems.
Account manipulation may consist of any action that preserves adversary access to a compromised account, such as modifying credentials or permission groups
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via PowerShell User Profile Using Add-Content
properties.description: Detects calls to "Add-Content" cmdlet in order to modify the content of the user profile and potentially adding suspicious commands for persistence
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Using Alias Cmdlets
properties.description: Detects Set-Alias or New-Alias cmdlet usage. Which can be use as a mean to obfuscate PowerShell scripts
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Manipulation of User Computer or Group Security Principals Across AD
properties.description:
Adversaries may create a domain account to maintain access to victim systems.
Domain accounts are those managed by Active Directory Domain Services where access and permissions are configured across systems and services that are part of that domain..
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Deleted Mounted Share
properties.description: Detects when when a mounted share is removed. Adversaries may remove share connections that are no longer useful in order to clean up traces of their operation
properties.author: oscd.community, @redcanary, Zach Stanford @svch0st

properties.name: Suspicious TCP Tunnel Via PowerShell Script
properties.description: Detects powershell scripts that creates sockets/listeners which could be indicative of tunneling activity
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32 - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Mount-DiskImage
properties.description: Adversaries may abuse container files such as disk image (.iso, .vhd) file formats to deliver malicious payloads that may not be tagged with MOTW.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Windows Firewall Profile Disabled
properties.description: Detects when a user disables the Windows Firewall via a Profile to help evade defense.
properties.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger

properties.name: PowerShell Script With File Hostname Resolving Capabilities
properties.description: Detects PowerShell scripts that have capabilities to read files, loop through them and resolve DNS host entries.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Registry-Free Process Scope COR_PROFILER
properties.description:
Adversaries may leverage the COR_PROFILER environment variable to hijack the execution flow of programs that load the .NET CLR.
The COR_PROFILER is a .NET Framework feature which allows developers to specify an unmanaged (or external of .NET) profiling DLL to be loaded into each .NET process that loads the Common Language Runtime (CLR).
These profiliers are designed to monitor, troubleshoot, and debug managed code executed by the .NET CLR.
(Citation: Microsoft Profiling Mar 2017)
(Citation: Microsoft COR_PROFILER Feb 2013)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Windows Defender Exclusions Added - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects modifications to the Windows Defender configuration settings using PowerShell to add exclusions
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Powershell WMI Persistence
properties.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event subscription.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell ShellCode
properties.description: Detects Base64 encoded Shellcode
properties.author: David Ledbetter (shellcode), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Script Change Permission Via Set-Acl - PsScript
properties.description: Detects PowerShell scripts set ACL to of a file or a folder
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Write-EventLog Usage
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Write-EventLog" cmdlet with 'RawData' flag. The cmdlet can be levreage to write malicious payloads to the EventLog and then retrieve them later for later use
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "Set-ExecutionPolicy" cmdlet.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Powershell MsXml COM Object
properties.description:
Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution.
PowerShell is a powerful interactive command-line interface and scripting environment included in the Windows operating system. (Citation: TechNet PowerShell)
Adversaries can use PowerShell to perform a number of actions, including discovery of information and execution of code
properties.author: frack113, MatilJ

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro

properties.name: Powershell Install a DLL in System Directory
properties.description: Uses PowerShell to install/copy a file into a system directory such as "System32" or "SysWOW64"
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Powershell Store File In Alternate Data Stream
properties.description: Storing files in Alternate Data Stream (ADS) similar to Astaroth malware.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell ICMP Exfiltration
properties.description: Detects Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol - ICMP. Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an un-encrypted network protocol other than that of the existing command and control channel.
properties.author: Bartlomiej Czyz @bczyz1, oscd.community

properties.name: PowerShell PSAttack
properties.description: Detects the use of PSAttack PowerShell hack tool
properties.author: Sean Metcalf (source), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Troubleshooting Pack Cmdlet Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of "TroubleshootingPack" cmdlets to leverage CVE-2022-30190 or action similar to "msdt" lolbin (as described in LOLBAS)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: NTFS Alternate Data Stream
properties.description: Detects writing data into NTFS alternate data streams from powershell. Needs Script Block Logging.
properties.author: Sami Ruohonen

properties.name: Potential Active Directory Enumeration Using AD Module - PsScript
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Import-Module" cmdlet to load the "Microsoft.ActiveDirectory.Management.dl" DLL. Which is often used by attackers to perform AD enumeration.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Certificate Exported Via PowerShell - ScriptBlock
properties.description: Detects calls to cmdlets inside of PowerShell scripts that are used to export certificates from the local certificate store. Threat actors were seen abusing this to steal private keys from compromised machines.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Powershell Sensitive File Discovery
properties.description: Detect adversaries enumerate sensitive files
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Powershell Detect Virtualization Environment
properties.description:
Adversaries may employ various system checks to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments.
This may include changing behaviors based on the results of checks for the presence of artifacts indicative of a virtual machine environment (VME) or sandbox
properties.author: frack113, Duc.Le-GTSC

properties.name: AD Groups Or Users Enumeration Using PowerShell - ScriptBlock
properties.description:
Adversaries may attempt to find domain-level groups and permission settings.
The knowledge of domain-level permission groups can help adversaries determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group.
Adversaries may use this information to determine which users have elevated permissions, such as domain administrators.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Connection to Remote Account
properties.description:
Adversaries with no prior knowledge of legitimate credentials within the system or environment may guess passwords to attempt access to accounts.
Without knowledge of the password for an account, an adversary may opt to systematically guess the password using a repetitive or iterative mechanism
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Unblock-File
properties.description: Remove the Zone.Identifier alternate data stream which identifies the file as downloaded from the internet.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Create Local User
properties.description: Detects creation of a local user via PowerShell
properties.author: @ROxPinTeddy

properties.name: Powershell Execute Batch Script
properties.description:
Adversaries may abuse the Windows command shell for execution.
The Windows command shell ([cmd](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0106)) is the primary command prompt on Windows systems.
The Windows command prompt can be used to control almost any aspect of a system, with various permission levels required for different subsets of commands.
Batch files (ex: .bat or .cmd) also provide the shell with a list of sequential commands to run, as well as normal scripting operations such as conditionals and loops.
Common uses of batch files include long or repetitive tasks, or the need to run the same set of commands on multiple system
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential In-Memory Execution Using Reflection.Assembly
properties.description: Detects usage of "Reflection.Assembly" load functions to dynamically load assemblies in memory
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Execute Invoke-command on Remote Host
properties.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to interact with remote systems using Windows Remote Management (WinRM). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious FromBase64String Usage On Gzip Archive - Ps Script
properties.description: Detects attempts of decoding a base64 Gzip archive in a PowerShell script. This technique is often used as a method to load malicious content into memory afterward.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Get-ADReplAccount
properties.description:
The DSInternals PowerShell Module exposes several internal features of Active Directory and Azure Active Directory.
These include FIDO2 and NGC key auditing, offline ntds.dit file manipulation, password auditing, DC recovery from IFM backups and password hash calculation.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Powershell Suspicious Win32_PnPEntity
properties.description: Adversaries may attempt to gather information about attached peripheral devices and components connected to a computer system.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: AMSI Bypass Pattern Assembly GetType
properties.description: Detects code fragments found in small and obfuscated AMSI bypass PowerShell scripts
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WMIC Unquoted Services Path Lookup - PowerShell
properties.description: Detects known WMI recon method to look for unquoted service paths, often used by pentest inside of powershell scripts attackers enum scripts
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Active Directory Computers Enumeration With Get-AdComputer
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Get-AdComputer" to enumerate Computers or properties within Active Directory.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Malicious PowerShell Keywords
properties.description: Detects keywords from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks
properties.author: Sean Metcalf (source), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
properties.description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs
properties.author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573

properties.name: Dump Credentials from Windows Credential Manager With PowerShell
properties.description:
Adversaries may search for common password storage locations to obtain user credentials.
Passwords are stored in several places on a system, depending on the operating system or application holding the credentials.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Service Registry Permissions Weakness Check
properties.description:
Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the Registry entries used by services.
Adversaries may use flaws in the permissions for registry to redirect from the originally specified executable to one that they control, in order to launch their own code at Service start.
Windows stores local service configuration information in the Registry under HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Security Descriptors - ScriptBlock
properties.description: Detects usage of certain functions and keywords that are used to manipulate security descriptors in order to potentially set a backdoor. As seen used in the DAMP project.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Clearing Windows Console History
properties.description: Identifies when a user attempts to clear console history. An adversary may clear the command history of a compromised account to conceal the actions undertaken during an intrusion.
properties.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the code block cited in the reference section below
properties.author: Daniel Bohannon (@Mandiant/@FireEye), oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Computer Machine Password by PowerShell
properties.description:
The Reset-ComputerMachinePassword cmdlet changes the computer account password that the computers use to authenticate to the domain controllers in the domain.
You can use it to reset the password of the local computer.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Download - PoshModule
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Malicious PowerShell Commandlets - PoshModule
properties.description: Detects Commandlet names from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro

properties.name: Use Get-NetTCPConnection - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of network connections to or from the compromised system they are currently accessing or from remote systems by querying for information over the network.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Decompress Commands
properties.description: A General detection for specific decompress commands in PowerShell logs. This could be an adversary decompressing files.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Potential RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.EXE Abuse - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects PowerShell module creation where the module Contents are set to "function Get-VMRemoteFXPhysicalVideoAdapter". This could be a sign of potential abuse of the "RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe" binary which is known to be vulnerable to module load-order hijacking.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Bad Opsec Powershell Code Artifacts
properties.description:
focuses on trivial artifacts observed in variants of prevalent offensive ps1 payloads, including
Cobalt Strike Beacon, PoshC2, Powerview, Letmein, Empire, Powersploit, and other attack payloads
that often undergo minimal changes by attackers due to bad opsec.
properties.author: ok @securonix invrep_de, oscd.community

properties.name: AD Groups Or Users Enumeration Using PowerShell - PoshModule
properties.description:
Adversaries may attempt to find domain-level groups and permission settings.
The knowledge of domain-level permission groups can help adversaries determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group.
Adversaries may use this information to determine which users have elevated permissions, such as domain administrators.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Clear PowerShell History - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects keywords that could indicate clearing PowerShell history
properties.author: Ilyas Ochkov, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32 - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: HackTool - Evil-WinRm Execution - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects the execution of Evil-WinRM via PowerShell Module logs by leveraging the hardcoded strings inside the utility.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Zip A Folder With PowerShell For Staging In Temp  - PowerShell Module
properties.description:
Detects PowerShell scripts that make use of the "Compress-Archive" Cmdlet in order to compress folders and files where the output is stored in a potentially suspicious location that is used often by malware for exfiltration.
An adversary might compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: PowerShell Get Clipboard
properties.description: A General detection for the Get-Clipboard commands in PowerShell logs. This could be an adversary capturing clipboard contents.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Potential Active Directory Enumeration Using AD Module - PsModule
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Import-Module" cmdlet to load the "Microsoft.ActiveDirectory.Management.dl" DLL. Which is often used by attackers to perform AD enumeration.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Get Information for SMB Share - PowerShell Module
properties.description:
Adversaries may look for folders and drives shared on remote systems as a means of identifying sources of information to gather as a precursor for Collection and
to identify potential systems of interest for Lateral Movement.
Networks often contain shared network drives and folders that enable users to access file directories on various systems across a network.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Remote PowerShell Session (PS Module)
properties.description: Detects remote PowerShell sessions
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Tim Shelton

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Get-ADDBAccount Usage
properties.description: Detects suspicious invocation of the Get-ADDBAccount script that reads from a ntds.dit file and may be used to get access to credentials without using any credential dumpers
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Alternate PowerShell Hosts - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects alternate PowerShell hosts potentially bypassing detections looking for powershell.exe
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: SyncAppvPublishingServer Bypass Powershell Restriction - PS Module
properties.description: Detects SyncAppvPublishingServer process execution which usually utilized by adversaries to bypass PowerShell execution restrictions.
properties.author: Ensar amil, @sblmsrsn, OSCD Community

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Generic - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Get Local Groups Information
properties.description:
Detects the use of PowerShell modules and cmdlets to gather local group information.
Adversaries may use local system permission groups to determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group such as the local administrators group.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Malicious PowerShell Scripts - PoshModule
properties.description: Detects the execution of known offensive powershell scripts used for exploitation or reconnaissance
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION - PowerShell Module
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Credential Dumping Activity By Python Based Tool
properties.description: Detects LSASS process access for potential credential dumping by a Python-like tool such as LaZagne or Pypykatz.
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj, Jonhnathan Ribeiro

properties.name: Lsass Memory Dump via Comsvcs DLL
properties.description: Detects adversaries leveraging the MiniDump export function from comsvcs.dll via rundll32 to perform a memory dump from lsass.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Credential Dumping Attempt Via Svchost
properties.description: Detects when a process tries to access the memory of svchost to potentially dump credentials.
properties.author: Florent Labouyrie

properties.name: Function Call From Undocumented COM Interface EditionUpgradeManager
properties.description: Detects function calls from the EditionUpgradeManager COM interface. Which is an interface that is not used by standard executables.
properties.author: oscd.community, Dmitry Uchakin

properties.name: HackTool - CobaltStrike BOF Injection Pattern
properties.description: Detects a typical pattern of a CobaltStrike BOF which inject into other processes
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - LittleCorporal Generated Maldoc Injection
properties.description: Detects the process injection of a LittleCorporal generated Maldoc.
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Credential Dumping Attempt Via WerFault
properties.description: Detects process LSASS memory dump using Mimikatz, NanoDump, Invoke-Mimikatz, Procdump or Taskmgr based on the CallTrace pointing to ntdll.dll, dbghelp.dll or dbgcore.dll for win10, server2016 and up.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SysmonEnte Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of SysmonEnte, a tool to attack the integrity of Sysmon
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CMSTP Execution Process Access
properties.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
properties.author: Nik Seetharaman

properties.name: HackTool - HandleKatz Duplicating LSASS Handle
properties.description: Detects HandleKatz opening LSASS to duplicate its handle to later dump the memory without opening any new handles
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj (rule), @thefLinkk

properties.name: Suspicious LSASS Access Via MalSecLogon
properties.description: Detects suspicious access to LSASS handle via a call trace to "seclogon.dll" with a suspicious access right.
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden (original elastic rule), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Generic Process Access
properties.description: Detects process access requests from hacktool processes based on their default image name
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using WOW64 Logger DLL Hijack
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a WoW64 logger DLL hijack (UACMe 30)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: LSASS Memory Access by Tool With Dump Keyword In Name
properties.description: Detects LSASS process access requests from a source process with the "dump" keyword in its image name.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Credential Dumping Activity Via LSASS
properties.description:
Detects process access requests to the LSASS process with specific call trace calls and access masks.
This behaviour is expressed by many credential dumping tools such as Mimikatz, NanoDump, Invoke-Mimikatz, Procdump and even the Taskmgr dumping feature.
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden, Michael Haag

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious GrantedAccess Flags On LSASS
properties.description: Detects process access requests to LSASS process with potentially suspicious access flags
properties.author: Florian Roth, Roberto Rodriguez, Dimitrios Slamaris, Mark Russinovich, Thomas Patzke, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Sherif Eldeeb, James Dickenson, Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community

properties.name: Uncommon Process Access Rights For Target Image
properties.description: Detects process access request to uncommon target images with a "PROCESS_ALL_ACCESS" access mask.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Potential Direct Syscall of NtOpenProcess
properties.description: Detects potential calls to NtOpenProcess directly from NTDLL.
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton (FP)

properties.name: Remote LSASS Process Access Through Windows Remote Management
properties.description: Detects remote access to the LSASS process via WinRM. This could be a sign of credential dumping from tools like mimikatz.
properties.author: Patryk Prauze - ING Tech

properties.name: Suspicious Svchost Process Access
properties.description: Detects suspicious access to the "svchost" process such as that used by Invoke-Phantom to kill the thread of the Windows event logging service.
properties.author: Tim Burrell

properties.name: LSASS Access From Potentially White-Listed Processes
properties.description: Detects a possible process memory dump that uses a white-listed filename like TrolleyExpress.exe as a way to dump the LSASS process memory without Microsoft Defender interference
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential SmadHook.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "SmadHook.dll", a DLL used by SmadAV antivirus
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers Activity Via Scrcons.EXE DLL Load
properties.description: Detects signs of the WMI script host process "scrcons.exe" loading scripting DLLs which could indicates WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers EventConsumers activity.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Potential RjvPlatform.DLL Sideloading From Default Location
properties.description: Detects loading of "RjvPlatform.dll" by the "SystemResetPlatform.exe" binary which can be abused as a method of DLL side loading since the "$SysReset" directory isn't created by default.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Volume Shadow Copy Vsstrace.dll Load
properties.description: Detects the image load of VSS DLL by uncommon executables
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Core DLL Loaded By Non PowerShell Process
properties.description:
Detects loading of essential DLLs used by PowerShell by non-PowerShell process.
Detects behavior similar to meterpreter's "load powershell" extension.
properties.author: Tom Kern, oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova, Tim Shelton, Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: PCRE.NET Package Image Load
properties.description: Detects processes loading modules related to PCRE.NET package
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Amsi.DLL Loaded Via LOLBIN Process
properties.description: Detects loading of "Amsi.dll" by a living of the land process. This could be an indication of a "PowerShell without PowerShell" attack
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: VBA DLL Loaded Via Office Application
properties.description: Detects VB DLL's loaded by an office application. Which could indicate the presence of VBA Macros.
properties.author: Antonlovesdnb

properties.name: MMC Loading Script Engines DLLs
properties.description:
Detects when the Microsoft Management Console (MMC) loads the DLL libraries like vbscript, jscript etc which might indicate an attempt
to execute malicious scripts within a trusted system process for bypassing application whitelisting or defense evasion.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SharpEvtMute DLL Load
properties.description: Detects the load of EvtMuteHook.dll, a key component of SharpEvtHook, a tool that tampers with the Windows event logs
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Unsigned Mfdetours.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects DLL sideloading of unsigned "mfdetours.dll". Executing "mftrace.exe" can be abused to attach to an arbitrary process and force load any DLL named "mfdetours.dll" from the current directory of execution.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Microsoft VBA For Outlook Addin Loaded Via Outlook
properties.description: Detects outlvba (Microsoft VBA for Outlook Addin) DLL being loaded by the outlook process
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Mfdetours.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "mfdetours.dll". While using "mftrace.exe" it can be abused to attach to an arbitrary process and force load any DLL named "mfdetours.dll" from the current directory of execution.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Unsigned Thor Scanner Execution
properties.description: Detects loading and execution of an unsigned thor scanner binary.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Wazuh Security Platform DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL side loading of DLLs that are part of the Wazuh security platform
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential ShellDispatch.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "ShellDispatch.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Via comctl32.dll
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading using comctl32.dll to obtain system privileges
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Subhash Popuri (@pbssubhash)

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Via VMware Xfer
properties.description: Detects loading of a DLL by the VMware Xfer utility from the non-default directory which may be an attempt to sideload arbitrary DLL
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SILENTTRINITY Stager DLL Load
properties.description: Detects SILENTTRINITY stager dll loading activity
properties.author: Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious WSMAN Provider Image Loads
properties.description: Detects signs of potential use of the WSMAN provider from uncommon processes locally and remote execution.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Load Of RstrtMgr.DLL By A Suspicious Process
properties.description:
Detects the load of RstrtMgr DLL (Restart Manager) by a suspicious process.
This library has been used during ransomware campaigns to kill processes that would prevent file encryption by locking them (e.g. Conti ransomware, Cactus ransomware). It has also recently been seen used by the BiBi wiper for Windows.
It could also be used for anti-analysis purposes by shut downing specific processes.
properties.author: Luc Gnaux

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of DbgModel.DLL
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "DbgModel.dll"
properties.author: Gary Lobermier

properties.name: Potential DCOM InternetExplorer.Application DLL Hijack - Image Load
properties.description: Detects potential DLL hijack of "iertutil.dll" found in the DCOM InternetExplorer.Application Class
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR), wagga

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of Non-Existent DLLs From System Folders
properties.description:
Detects DLL sideloading of system DLLs that are not present on the system by default (at least not in system directories).
Usually this technique is used to achieve UAC bypass or privilege escalation.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), SBousseaden

properties.name: Unsigned DLL Loaded by Windows Utility
properties.description:
Detects windows utilities loading an unsigned or untrusted DLL.
Adversaries often abuse those programs to proxy execution of malicious code.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Microsoft Excel Add-In Loaded From Uncommon Location
properties.description: Detects Microsoft Excel loading an Add-In (.xll) file from an uncommon location
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: GAC DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
properties.description: Detects any GAC DLL being loaded by an Office Product
properties.author: Antonlovesdnb

properties.name: Potential 7za.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "7za.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior

properties.name: Fax Service DLL Search Order Hijack
properties.description: The Fax service attempts to load ualapi.dll, which is non-existent. An attacker can then (side)load their own malicious DLL using this service.
properties.author: NVISO

properties.name: System Control Panel Item Loaded From Uncommon Location
properties.description: Detects image load events of system control panel items (.cpl) from uncommon or non-system locations which might be the result of sideloading.
properties.author: Anish Bogati

properties.name: Unsigned Module Loaded by ClickOnce Application
properties.description: Detects unsigned module load by ClickOnce application.
properties.author: @SerkinValery

properties.name: Aruba Network Service Potential DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading activity via the Aruba Networks Virtual Intranet Access "arubanetsvc.exe" process using DLL Search Order Hijacking
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential SolidPDFCreator.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "SolidPDFCreator.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DotNET Assembly DLL Loaded Via Office Application
properties.description: Detects any assembly DLL being loaded by an Office Product
properties.author: Antonlovesdnb

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of MsCorSvc.DLL
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "mscorsvc.dll".
properties.author: Wietze Beukema

properties.name: Potential RjvPlatform.DLL Sideloading From Non-Default Location
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "RjvPlatform.dll" by "SystemResetPlatform.exe" located in a non-default location.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Using Coregen.exe
properties.description: Detect usage of the "coregen.exe" (Microsoft CoreCLR Native Image Generator) binary to sideload arbitrary DLLs.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of Libcurl.DLL Via GUP.EXE
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "libcurl.dll" by the "gup.exe" process from an uncommon location
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential CCleanerReactivator.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "CCleanerReactivator.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior

properties.name: Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
properties.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `wbemcomn.dll` in the `C:\Windows\System32\wbem\` directory over the network and loading it for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Potential JLI.dll Side-Loading
properties.description:
Detects potential DLL side-loading of jli.dll.
JLI.dll has been observed being side-loaded by Java processes by various threat actors, including APT41, XWorm,
and others in order to load malicious payloads in context of legitimate Java processes.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Unsigned .node File Loaded
properties.description:
Detects the loading of unsigned .node files.
Adversaries may abuse a lack of .node integrity checking to execute arbitrary code inside of trusted applications such as Slack.
.node files are native add-ons for Electron-based applications, which are commonly used for desktop applications like Slack, Discord, and Visual Studio Code.
This technique has been observed in the DripLoader malware, which uses unsigned .node files to load malicious native code into Electron applications.
properties.author: Jonathan Beierle (@hullabrian)

properties.name: Suspicious Unsigned Dbghelp/Dbgcore DLL Loaded
properties.description:
Detects the load of dbghelp/dbgcore DLL (used to make memory dumps) by suspicious processes.
Tools like ProcessHacker and some attacker tradecract use MiniDumpWriteDump API found in dbghelp.dll or dbgcore.dll.
As an example, SilentTrynity C2 Framework has a module that leverages this API to dump the contents of Lsass.exe and transfer it over the network back to the attacker's machine.
properties.author: Perez Diego (@darkquassar), oscd.community, Ecco

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of DBGHELP.DLL
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "dbghelp.dll"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Wietze Beukema (project and research)

properties.name: DLL Load By System Process From Suspicious Locations
properties.description: Detects when a system process (i.e. located in system32, syswow64, etc.) loads a DLL from a suspicious location or a location with permissive permissions such as "C:\Users\Public"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Libvlc.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "libvlc.dll", a DLL that is legitimately used by "VLC.exe"
properties.author: X__Junior

properties.name: Potential RoboForm.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "roboform.dll", a DLL used by RoboForm Password Manager
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CredUI.DLL Loaded By Uncommon Process
properties.description: Detects loading of "credui.dll" and related DLLs by an uncommon process. Attackers might leverage this DLL for potential use of "CredUIPromptForCredentials" or "CredUnPackAuthenticationBufferW".
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Potential Mpclient.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential sideloading of "mpclient.dll" by Windows Defender processes ("MpCmdRun" and "NisSrv") from their non-default directory.
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Suspicious Renamed Comsvcs DLL Loaded By Rundll32
properties.description: Detects rundll32 loading a renamed comsvcs.dll to dump process memory
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass With Fake DLL
properties.description: Attempts to load dismcore.dll after dropping it
properties.author: oscd.community, Dmitry Uchakin

properties.name: Potential Vivaldi_elf.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "vivaldi_elf.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Time Travel Debugging Utility Usage - Image
properties.description: Detects usage of Time Travel Debugging Utility. Adversaries can execute malicious processes and dump processes, such as lsass.exe, via tttracer.exe.
properties.author: Ensar amil, @sblmsrsn, @oscd_initiative

properties.name: Trusted Path Bypass via Windows Directory Spoofing
properties.description:
Detects DLLs loading from a spoofed Windows directory path with an extra space (e.g "C:\Windows \System32") which can bypass Windows trusted path verification.
This technique tricks Windows into treating the path as trusted, allowing malicious DLLs to load with high integrity privileges bypassing UAC.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Antivirus Software DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of DLLs that are part of antivirus software suchas McAfee, Symantec...etc
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Wietze Beukema (project and research)

properties.name: Remote DLL Load Via Rundll32.EXE
properties.description: Detects a remote DLL load event via "rundll32.exe".
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Via ClassicExplorer32.dll
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading using ClassicExplorer32.dll from the Classic Shell software
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: BaaUpdate.exe Suspicious DLL Load
properties.description:
Detects BitLocker Access Agent Update Utility (baaupdate.exe) loading DLLs from suspicious locations that are publicly writable which could indicate an attempt to lateral movement via BitLocker DCOM & COM Hijacking.
This technique abuses COM Classes configured as INTERACTIVE USER to spawn processes in the context of the logged-on user's session. Specifically, it targets the BDEUILauncher Class (CLSID ab93b6f1-be76-4185-a488-a9001b105b94)
which can launch BaaUpdate.exe, which is vulnerable to COM Hijacking when started with input parameters. This allows attackers to execute code in the user's context without needing to steal credentials or use additional techniques to compromise the account.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Edputil.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "edputil.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: VMMap Unsigned Dbghelp.DLL Potential Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of an unsigned dbghelp.dll by the Sysinternals VMMap.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential System DLL Sideloading From Non System Locations
properties.description: Detects DLL sideloading of DLLs usually located in system locations (System32, SysWOW64, etc.).
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Azure Browser SSO Abuse
properties.description:
Detects abusing Azure Browser SSO by requesting OAuth 2.0 refresh tokens for an Azure-AD-authenticated Windows user (i.e. the machine is joined to Azure AD and a user logs in with their Azure AD account) wanting to perform SSO authentication in the browser.
An attacker can use this to authenticate to Azure AD in a browser as that user.
properties.author: Den Iuzvyk

properties.name: VMGuestLib DLL Sideload
properties.description: Detects DLL sideloading of VMGuestLib.dll by the WmiApSrv service.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Volume Shadow Copy Vssapi.dll Load
properties.description: Detects the image load of VSS DLL by uncommon executables
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Iviewers.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "iviewers.dll" (OLE/COM Object Interface Viewer)
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using Iscsicpl - ImageLoad
properties.description: Detects the "iscsicpl.exe" UAC bypass technique that leverages a DLL Search Order hijacking technique to load a custom DLL's from temp or a any user controlled location in the users %PATH%
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Rcdll.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of rcdll.dll
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Python DLL SideLoading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of Python DLL files.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: DotNet CLR DLL Loaded By Scripting Applications
properties.description: Detects .NET CLR DLLs being loaded by scripting applications such as wscript or cscript. This could be an indication of potential suspicious execution.
properties.author: omkar72, oscd.community

properties.name: DLL Loaded From Suspicious Location Via Cmspt.EXE
properties.description: Detects cmstp loading "dll" or "ocx" files from suspicious locations
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential CCleanerDU.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "CCleanerDU.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WMI Persistence - Command Line Event Consumer
properties.description: Detects WMI command line event consumers
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: Microsoft Office DLL Sideload
properties.description: Detects DLL sideloading of DLLs that are part of Microsoft Office from non standard location
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Wietze Beukema (project and research)

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of KeyScramblerIE.DLL Via KeyScrambler.EXE
properties.description:
Detects potential DLL side loading of "KeyScramblerIE.dll" by "KeyScrambler.exe".
Various threat actors and malware have been found side loading a masqueraded "KeyScramblerIE.dll" through "KeyScrambler.exe".
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Potential Goopdate.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "goopdate.dll", a DLL used by googleupdate.exe
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Load Of RstrtMgr.DLL By An Uncommon Process
properties.description:
Detects the load of RstrtMgr DLL (Restart Manager) by an uncommon process.
This library has been used during ransomware campaigns to kill processes that would prevent file encryption by locking them (e.g. Conti ransomware, Cactus ransomware). It has also recently been seen used by the BiBi wiper for Windows.
It could also be used for anti-analysis purposes by shut downing specific processes.
properties.author: Luc Gnaux

properties.name: WMIC Loading Scripting Libraries
properties.description: Detects threat actors proxy executing code and bypassing application controls by leveraging wmic and the `/FORMAT` argument switch to download and execute an XSL file (i.e js, vbs, etc).
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: PowerShell Core DLL Loaded Via Office Application
properties.description: Detects PowerShell core DLL being loaded by an Office Product
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential EACore.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "EACore.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of MpSvc.DLL
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "MpSvc.dll".
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Wietze Beukema

properties.name: Potential WWlib.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "wwlib.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential appverifUI.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "appverifUI.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Via JsSchHlp
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading using JUSTSYSTEMS Japanese word processor
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Waveedit.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "waveedit.dll", which is part of the Nero WaveEditor audio editing software.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Unsigned Image Loaded Into LSASS Process
properties.description: Loading unsigned image (DLL, EXE) into LSASS process
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Abusable DLL Potential Sideloading From Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of DLLs that are known to be abused from suspicious locations
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Diagnostic Library Sdiageng.DLL Loaded By Msdt.EXE
properties.description: Detects both of CVE-2022-30190 (Follina) and DogWalk vulnerabilities exploiting msdt.exe binary to load the "sdiageng.dll" library
properties.author: Greg (rule)

properties.name: Suspicious Volume Shadow Copy VSS_PS.dll Load
properties.description:
Detects the image load of vss_ps.dll by uncommon executables. This DLL is used by the Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) to manage shadow copies of files and volumes.
It is often abused by attackers to delete or manipulate shadow copies, which can hinder forensic investigations and data recovery efforts.
The fact that it is loaded by processes that are not typically associated with VSS operations can indicate suspicious activity.
properties.author: Markus Neis, @markus_neis

properties.name: CLR DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
properties.description: Detects CLR DLL being loaded by an Office Product
properties.author: Antonlovesdnb

properties.name: Python Image Load By Non-Python Process
properties.description:
Detects the image load of "Python Core" by a non-Python process. This might be indicative of a execution of executable that has been bundled from Python code.
Various tools like Py2Exe, PyInstaller, and cx_Freeze are used to bundle Python code into standalone executables.
Threat actors often use these tools to bundle malicious Python scripts into executables, sometimes to obfuscate the code or to bypass security measures.
properties.author: Patrick St. John, OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Clfs.SYS Loaded By Process Located In a Potential Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects Clfs.sys being loaded by a process running from a potentially suspicious location. Clfs.sys is loaded as part of many CVEs exploits that targets Common Log File.
properties.author: X__Junior

properties.name: Potential AVKkid.DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "AVKkid.dll"
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Third Party Software DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects DLL sideloading of DLLs that are part of third party software (zoom, discord....etc)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Wietze Beukema (project and research)

properties.name: DLL Sideloading Of ShellChromeAPI.DLL
properties.description:
Detects processes loading the non-existent DLL "ShellChromeAPI". One known example is the "DeviceEnroller" binary in combination with the "PhoneDeepLink" flag tries to load this DLL.
Adversaries can drop their own renamed DLL and execute it via DeviceEnroller.exe using this parameter
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of DBGCORE.DLL
properties.description: Detects DLL sideloading of "dbgcore.dll"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Wietze Beukema (project and research)

properties.name: Potential Chrome Frame Helper DLL Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "chrome_frame_helper.dll"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Wietze Beukema (project and research)

properties.name: VMMap Signed Dbghelp.DLL Potential Sideloading
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of a signed dbghelp.dll by the Sysinternals VMMap.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Defense Evasion Via Raw Disk Access By Uncommon Tools
properties.description: Detects raw disk access using uncommon tools or tools that are located in suspicious locations (heavy filtering is required), which could indicate possible defense evasion attempts
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community

properties.name: IE ZoneMap Setting Downgraded To MyComputer Zone For HTTP Protocols
properties.description: Detects changes to Internet Explorer's (IE / Windows Internet properties) ZoneMap configuration of the "HTTP" and "HTTPS" protocols to point to the "My Computer" zone. This allows downloaded files from the Internet to be granted the same level of trust as files stored locally.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Michael Haag (idea)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Logon Scripts - Registry
properties.description: Detects creation of "UserInitMprLogonScript" registry value which can be used as a persistence method by malicious actors
properties.author: Tom Ueltschi (@c_APT_ure)

properties.name: COM Hijack via Sdclt
properties.description: Detects changes to 'HKCU\Software\Classes\Folder\shell\open\command\DelegateExecute'
properties.author: Omkar Gudhate

properties.name: Potential AutoLogger Sessions Tampering
properties.description: Detects tampering with autologger trace sessions which is a technique used by attackers to disable logging
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New BgInfo.EXE Custom DB Path Registry Configuration
properties.description: Detects setting of a new registry database value related to BgInfo configuration. Attackers can for example set this value to save the results of the commands executed by BgInfo in order to exfiltrate information.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential PSFactoryBuffer COM Hijacking
properties.description: Detects changes to the PSFactory COM InProcServer32 registry. This technique was used by RomCom to create persistence storing a malicious DLL.
properties.author: BlackBerry Threat Research and Intelligence Team - @Joseliyo_Jstnk

properties.name: New BgInfo.EXE Custom VBScript Registry Configuration
properties.description: Detects setting of a new registry value related to BgInfo configuration, which can be abused to execute custom VBScript via "BgInfo.exe"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Ransomware Activity Using LegalNotice Message
properties.description: Detect changes to the "LegalNoticeCaption" or "LegalNoticeText" registry values where the message set contains keywords often used in ransomware ransom messages
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Hide Schedule Task Via Index Value Tamper
properties.description:
Detects when the "index" value of a scheduled task is modified from the registry
Which effectively hides it from any tooling such as "schtasks /query" (Read the referenced link for more information about the effects of this technique)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Bypass UAC Using DelegateExecute
properties.description: Bypasses User Account Control using a fileless method
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Scripted Diagnostics Turn Off Check Enabled - Registry
properties.description: Detects enabling TurnOffCheck which can be used to bypass defense of MSDT Follina vulnerability
properties.author: Christopher Peacock @securepeacock, SCYTHE @scythe_io

properties.name: Suspicious Keyboard Layout Load
properties.description: Detects the keyboard preload installation with a suspicious keyboard layout, e.g. Chinese, Iranian or Vietnamese layout load in user session on systems maintained by US staff only
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Add DisallowRun Execution to Registry
properties.description: Detect set DisallowRun to 1 to prevent user running specific computer program
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Persistence Using DebugPath
properties.description: Detects potential persistence using Appx DebugPath
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential ClickFix Execution Pattern - Registry
properties.description:
Detects potential ClickFix malware execution patterns by monitoring registry modifications in RunMRU keys containing HTTP/HTTPS links.
ClickFix is known to be distributed through phishing campaigns and uses techniques like clipboard hijacking and fake CAPTCHA pages.
Through the fakecaptcha pages, the adversary tricks users into opening the Run dialog box and pasting clipboard-hijacked content,
such as one-liners that execute remotely hosted malicious files or scripts.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via New AMSI Providers - Registry
properties.description:
Detects when an attacker adds a new AMSI provider via the Windows Registry to bypass AMSI (Antimalware Scan Interface) protections.
Attackers may add custom AMSI providers to persist on the system and evade detection by security software that relies on AMSI for scanning scripts and other content.
This technique is often used in conjunction with fileless malware and script-based attacks to maintain persistence while avoiding detection.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Shim Database In Uncommon Location
properties.description: Detects the installation of a new shim database where the file is located in a non-default location
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Driver Added To Disallowed Images In HVCI - Registry
properties.description: Detects changes to the "HVCIDisallowedImages" registry value to potentially add a driver to the list, in order to prevent it from loading.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Omar Khaled (@beacon_exe)

properties.name: Change User Account Associated with the FAX Service
properties.description: Detect change of the user account associated with the FAX service to avoid the escalation problem.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Space Characters in TypedPaths Registry Path - FileFix
properties.description: Detects the occurrence of numerous space characters in TypedPaths registry paths, which may indicate execution via phishing lures using file-fix techniques to hide malicious commands.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Outlook EnableUnsafeClientMailRules Setting Enabled - Registry
properties.description: Detects an attacker trying to enable the outlook security setting "EnableUnsafeClientMailRules" which allows outlook to run applications or execute macros
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Environment Variable Has Been Registered
properties.description: Detects the creation of user-specific or system-wide environment variables via the registry. Which contains suspicious commands and strings
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
