properties.name: Session Manager Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Python Function Execution Security Warning Disabled In Excel - Registry
properties.description:
Detects changes to the registry value "PythonFunctionWarnings" that would prevent any warnings or alerts from showing when Python functions are about to be executed.
Threat actors could run malicious code through the new Microsoft Excel feature that allows Python to run within the spreadsheet.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), @Kostastsale

properties.name: Wdigest Enable UseLogonCredential
properties.description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of UseLogonCredential from HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest to enable clear-text credentials
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Windows Defender Service Disabled - Registry
properties.description: Detects when an attacker or tool disables the  Windows Defender service (WinDefend) via the registry
properties.author: Jn Trenansk, frack113, AlertIQ, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: ETW Logging Disabled For rpcrt4.dll
properties.description: Detects changes to the "ExtErrorInformation" key in order to disable ETW logging for rpcrt4.dll
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Bypass UAC Using Event Viewer
properties.description: Bypasses User Account Control using Event Viewer and a relevant Windows Registry modification
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Path In Keyboard Layout IME File Registry Value
properties.description:
Detects usage of Windows Input Method Editor (IME) keyboard layout feature, which allows an attacker to load a DLL into the process after sending the WM_INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST message.
Before doing this, the client needs to register the DLL in a special registry key that is assumed to implement this keyboard layout. This registry key should store a value named "Ime File" with a DLL path.
IMEs are essential for languages that have more characters than can be represented on a standard keyboard, such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Activate Suppression of Windows Security Center Notifications
properties.description: Detect set Notification_Suppress to 1 to disable the Windows security center notification
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Enable Local Manifest Installation With Winget
properties.description: Detects changes to the AppInstaller (winget) policy. Specifically the activation of the local manifest installation, which allows a user to install new packages via custom manifests.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Antivirus Filter Driver Disallowed On Dev Drive - Registry
properties.description: Detects activity that indicates a user disabling the ability for Antivirus mini filter to inspect a "Dev Drive".
properties.author: @kostastsale, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Attachment Manager Settings Associations Tamper
properties.description: Detects tampering with attachment manager settings policies associations to lower the default file type risks (See reference for more information)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Registry Hide Function from User
properties.description: Detects registry modifications that hide internal tools or functions from the user (malware like Agent Tesla, Hermetic Wiper uses this technique)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: COM Object Hijacking Via Modification Of Default System CLSID Default Value
properties.description: Detects potential COM object hijacking via modification of default system CLSID.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via AppCompat RegisterAppRestart Layer
properties.description:
Detects the setting of the REGISTERAPPRESTART compatibility layer on an application.
This compatibility layer allows an application to register for restart using the "RegisterApplicationRestart" API.
This can be potentially abused as a persistence mechanism.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disable Administrative Share Creation at Startup
properties.description: Administrative shares are hidden network shares created by Microsoft Windows NT operating systems that grant system administrators remote access to every disk volume on a network-connected system
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Registry Disable System Restore
properties.description: Detects the modification of the registry to disable a system restore on the computer
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Hypervisor Enforced Code Integrity Disabled
properties.description: Detects changes to the HypervisorEnforcedCodeIntegrity registry key and the "Enabled" value being set to 0 in order to disable the Hypervisor Enforced Code Integrity feature. This allows an attacker to load unsigned and untrusted code to be run in the kernel
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Anish Bogati

properties.name: New BgInfo.EXE Custom WMI Query Registry Configuration
properties.description: Detects setting of a new registry value related to BgInfo configuration, which can be abused to execute custom WMI query via "BgInfo.exe"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Internet Explorer Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Outlook Today Page
properties.description:
Detects potential persistence activity via outlook today page.
An attacker can set a custom page to execute arbitrary code and link to it via the registry values "URL" and "UserDefinedUrl".
properties.author: Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems), David Bertho (@dbertho) & Eirik Sveen (@0xSV1), Storebrand

properties.name: CurrentControlSet Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Netsh Helper DLL - Registry
properties.description: Detects changes to the Netsh registry key to add a new DLL value. This change might be an indication of a potential persistence attempt by adding a malicious Netsh helper
properties.author: Anish Bogati

properties.name: MaxMpxCt Registry Value Changed
properties.description:
Detects changes to the "MaxMpxCt" registry value.
MaxMpxCt specifies the maximum outstanding network requests for the server per client, which is used when negotiating a Server Message Block (SMB) connection with a client. Note if the value is set beyond 125 older Windows 9x clients will fail to negotiate.
Ransomware threat actors and operators (specifically BlackCat) were seen increasing this value in order to handle a higher volume of traffic.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ETW Logging Disabled In .NET Processes - Sysmon Registry
properties.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: UAC Bypass via Event Viewer
properties.description: Detects UAC bypass method using Windows event viewer
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Macro Enabled In A Potentially Suspicious Document
properties.description: Detects registry changes to Office trust records where the path is located in a potentially suspicious location
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Provisioning Registry Key Abuse For Binary Proxy Execution - REG
properties.description: Detects potential abuse of the provisioning registry key for indirect command execution through "Provlaunch.exe".
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: COM Hijacking via TreatAs
properties.description: Detect modification of TreatAs key to enable "rundll32.exe -sta" command
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Uncommon Microsoft Office Trusted Location Added
properties.description: Detects changes to registry keys related to "Trusted Location" of Microsoft Office where the path is set to something uncommon. Attackers might add additional trusted locations to avoid macro security restrictions.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Wow6432Node CurrentVersion Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Usage of Renamed Sysinternals Tools - RegistrySet
properties.description: Detects non-sysinternals tools setting the "accepteula" key which normally is set on sysinternals tool execution
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Netsh Helper DLL Registered From A Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects changes to the Netsh registry key to add a new DLL value that is located on a suspicious location. This change might be an indication of a potential persistence attempt by adding a malicious Netsh helper
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via MyComputer Registry Keys
properties.description: Detects modification to the "Default" value of the "MyComputer" key and subkeys to point to a custom binary that will be launched whenever the associated action is executed (see reference section for example)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Disabled
properties.description: Detects when an attacker tries to disable User Account Control (UAC) by setting the registry value "EnableLUA" to 0.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: CurrentVersion NT Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: WinSock2 Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Windows Recall Feature Enabled - Registry
properties.description:
Detects the enabling of the Windows Recall feature via registry manipulation. Windows Recall can be enabled by setting the value of "DisableAIDataAnalysis" to "0".
Adversaries may enable Windows Recall as part of post-exploitation discovery and collection activities.
This rule assumes that Recall is already explicitly disabled on the host, and subsequently enabled by the adversary.
properties.author: Sajid Nawaz Khan

properties.name: Potential PowerShell Execution Policy Tampering
properties.description: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Excel Add-in - Registry
properties.description: Detect potential persistence via the creation of an excel add-in (XLL) file to make it run automatically when Excel is started.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Service Installed
properties.description:
Detects installation of NalDrv or PROCEXP152 services via registry-keys to non-system32 folders.
Both services are used in the tool Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU)
properties.author: xknow (@xknow_infosec), xorxes (@xor_xes)

properties.name: Disabled Windows Defender Eventlog
properties.description: Detects the disabling of the Windows Defender eventlog as seen in relation to Lockbit 3.0 infections
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Execution DLL of Choice Using WAB.EXE
properties.description: This rule detects that the path to the DLL written in the registry is different from the default one. Launched WAB.exe tries to load the DLL from Registry.
properties.author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova

properties.name: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed to Zero
properties.description:
Detects tampering of RDP Terminal Service/Server sensitive settings.
Such as allowing unauthorized users access to a system via the 'fAllowUnsolicited' or enabling RDP via 'fDenyTSConnections', etc.
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden, David ANDRE, Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Suspicious Space Characters in RunMRU Registry Path - ClickFix
properties.description: Detects the occurrence of numerous space characters in RunMRU registry paths, which may indicate execution via phishing lures using clickfix techniques to hide malicious commands in the Windows Run dialog box from naked eyes.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential SentinelOne Shell Context Menu Scan Command Tampering
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious changes to the SentinelOne context menu scan command by a process other than SentinelOne.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Periodic Backup For System Registry Hives Enabled
properties.description:
Detects the enabling of the "EnablePeriodicBackup" registry value. Once enabled, The OS will backup System registry hives on restarts to the "C:\Windows\System32\config\RegBack" folder. Windows creates a "RegIdleBackup" task to manage subsequent backups.
Registry backup was a default behavior on Windows and was disabled as of "Windows 10, version 1803".
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Custom Protocol Handler
properties.description: Detects potential persistence activity via the registering of a new custom protocole handlers. While legitimate applications register protocole handlers often times during installation. And attacker can abuse this by setting a custom handler to be used as a persistence mechanism.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Default RDP Port Changed to Non Standard Port
properties.description:
Detects changes to the default RDP port.
Remote desktop is a common feature in operating systems. It allows a user to log into a remote system using an interactive session with a graphical user interface.
Microsoft refers to its implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) as Remote Desktop Services (RDS).
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: RestrictedAdminMode Registry Value Tampering
properties.description:
Detects changes to the "DisableRestrictedAdmin" registry value in order to disable or enable RestrictedAdmin mode.
RestrictedAdmin mode prevents the transmission of reusable credentials to the remote system to which you connect using Remote Desktop.
This prevents your credentials from being harvested during the initial connection process if the remote server has been compromise
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Shim Database Modification
properties.description:
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims.
The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Disable Windows Defender Functionalities Via Registry Keys
properties.description: Detects when attackers or tools disable Windows Defender functionalities via the Windows registry
properties.author: AlertIQ, Jn Trenansk, frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Potential WerFault ReflectDebugger Registry Value Abuse
properties.description: Detects potential WerFault "ReflectDebugger" registry value abuse for persistence.
properties.author: X__Junior

properties.name: Outlook Security Settings Updated - Registry
properties.description: Detects changes to the registry values related to outlook security settings
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Visual Studio Tools for Office
properties.description: Detects persistence via Visual Studio Tools for Office (VSTO) add-ins in Office applications.
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Desktop Background Change Via Registry
properties.description:
Detects registry value settings that would replace the user's desktop background.
This is a common technique used by malware to change the desktop background to a ransom note or other image.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Stephen Lincoln @slincoln-aiq (AttackIQ)

properties.name: UAC Notification Disabled
properties.description:
Detects when an attacker tries to disable User Account Control (UAC) notification by tampering with the "UACDisableNotify" value.
UAC is a critical security feature in Windows that prevents unauthorized changes to the operating system. It prompts the user for permission or an administrator password before allowing actions that could affect the system's operation or change settings that affect other users.
When "UACDisableNotify" is set to 1, UAC prompts are suppressed.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Winlogon Notify Key Logon Persistence
properties.description:
Adversaries may abuse features of Winlogon to execute DLLs and/or executables when a user logs in.
Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Sysmon Driver Altitude Change
properties.description:
Detects changes in Sysmon driver altitude value.
If the Sysmon driver is configured to load at an altitude of another registered service, it will fail to load at boot.
properties.author: B.Talebi

properties.name: Suspicious Execution Of Renamed Sysinternals Tools - Registry
properties.description: Detects the creation of the "accepteula" key related to the Sysinternals tools being created from executables with the wrong name (e.g. a renamed Sysinternals tool)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Change Winevt Channel Access Permission Via Registry
properties.description: Detects tampering with the "ChannelAccess" registry key in order to change access to Windows event channel.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: ServiceDll Hijack
properties.description:
Detects changes to the "ServiceDLL" value related to a service in the registry.
This is often used as a method of persistence.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Classes Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Wow6432Node Windows NT CurrentVersion Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Trust Access Disable For VBApplications
properties.description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "AccessVBOM" to a value of "1" which disables trust access for VBA on the victim machine and lets attackers execute malicious macros without any Microsoft Office warnings.
properties.author: Trent Liffick (@tliffick), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Script Execution Policy Enabled
properties.description: Detects the enabling of the PowerShell script execution policy. Once enabled, this policy allows scripts to be executed.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Thurein Oo

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious ODBC Driver Registered
properties.description: Detects the registration of a new ODBC driver where the driver is located in a potentially suspicious location
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Office Macros Warning Disabled
properties.description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "VBAWarning" to a value of "1" which enables the execution of all macros, whether signed or unsigned.
properties.author: Trent Liffick (@tliffick), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via GlobalFlags
properties.description: Detects registry persistence technique using the GlobalFlags and SilentProcessExit keys
properties.author: Karneades, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Florian Roth

properties.name: Disable Windows Event Logging Via Registry
properties.description: Detects tampering with the "Enabled" registry key in order to disable Windows logging of a Windows event channel
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Registry Persistence via Explorer Run Key
properties.description: Detects a possible persistence mechanism using RUN key for Windows Explorer and pointing to a suspicious folder
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community

properties.name: Persistence Via Disk Cleanup Handler - Autorun
properties.description:
Detects when an attacker modifies values of the Disk Cleanup Handler in the registry to achieve persistence via autorun.
The disk cleanup manager is part of the operating system.
It displays the dialog box [] The user has the option of enabling or disabling individual handlers by selecting or clearing their check box in the disk cleanup manager's UI.
Although Windows comes with a number of disk cleanup handlers, they aren't designed to handle files produced by other applications.
Instead, the disk cleanup manager is designed to be flexible and extensible by enabling any developer to implement and register their own disk cleanup handler.
Any developer can extend the available disk cleanup services by implementing and registering a disk cleanup handler.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Application Allowed Through Exploit Guard
properties.description: Detects applications being added to the "allowed applications" list of exploit guard in order to bypass controlled folder settings
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Sysinternal Tool Execution - Registry
properties.description: Detects the execution of a Sysinternals Tool via the creation of the "accepteula" registry key
properties.author: Markus Neis

properties.name: New Application in AppCompat
properties.description: A General detection for a new application in AppCompat. This indicates an application executing for the first time on an endpoint.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: ScreenSaver Registry Key Set
properties.description: Detects registry key established after masqueraded .scr file execution using Rundll32 through desk.cpl
properties.author: Jose Luis Sanchez Martinez (@Joseliyo_Jstnk)

properties.name: Enabling COR Profiler Environment Variables
properties.description: Detects .NET Framework CLR and .NET Core CLR "cor_enable_profiling" and "cor_profiler" variables being set and configured.
properties.author: Jose Rodriguez (@Cyb3rPandaH), OTR (Open Threat Research), Jimmy Bayne (@bohops)

properties.name: New TimeProviders Registered With Uncommon DLL Name
properties.description:
Detects processes setting a new DLL in DllName in under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\W32Time\TimeProvider.
Adversaries may abuse time providers to execute DLLs when the system boots.
The Windows Time service (W32Time) enables time synchronization across and within domains.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via TypedPaths
properties.description: Detects modification addition to the 'TypedPaths' key in the user or admin registry from a non standard application. Which might indicate persistence attempt
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Modification of IE Registry Settings
properties.description: Detects modification of the registry settings used for Internet Explorer and other Windows components that use these settings. An attacker can abuse this registry key to add a domain to the trusted sites Zone or insert JavaScript for persistence
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential COM Object Hijacking Via TreatAs Subkey - Registry
properties.description: Detects COM object hijacking via TreatAs subkey
properties.author: Kutepov Anton, oscd.community

properties.name: Disable Windows Firewall by Registry
properties.description: Detect set EnableFirewall to 0 to disable the Windows firewall
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Running Chrome VPN Extensions via the Registry 2 VPN Extension
properties.description: Running Chrome VPN Extensions via the Registry install 2 vpn extension
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: ETW Logging Disabled For SCM
properties.description: Detects changes to the "TracingDisabled" key in order to disable ETW logging for services.exe (SCM)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Common Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split), wagga (name)

properties.name: Windows Event Log Access Tampering Via Registry
properties.description: Detects changes to the Windows EventLog channel permission values. It focuses on changes to the Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) string, as modifications to these values can restrict access to specific users or groups, potentially aiding in defense evasion by controlling who can view or modify a event log channel. Upon execution, the user shouldn't be able to access the event log channel via the event viewer or via utilities such as "Get-EventLog" or "wevtutil".
properties.author: X__Junior

properties.name: Registry Modification to Hidden File Extension
properties.description: Hides the file extension through modification of the registry
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Enable LM Hash Storage
properties.description:
Detects changes to the "NoLMHash" registry value in order to allow Windows to store LM Hashes.
By setting this registry value to "0" (DWORD), Windows will be allowed to store a LAN manager hash of your password in Active Directory and local SAM databases.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Add Debugger Entry To Hangs Key For Persistence
properties.description: Detects when an attacker adds a new "Debugger" value to the "Hangs" key in order to achieve persistence which will get invoked when an application crashes
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential EventLog File Location Tampering
properties.description: Detects tampering with EventLog service "file" key. In order to change the default location of an Evtx file. This technique is used to tamper with log collection and alerting
properties.author: D3F7A5105

properties.name: Lolbas OneDriveStandaloneUpdater.exe Proxy Download
properties.description:
Detects setting a custom URL for OneDriveStandaloneUpdater.exe to download a file from the Internet without executing any
anomalous executables with suspicious arguments. The downloaded file will be in C:\Users\redacted\AppData\Local\Microsoft\OneDrive\StandaloneUpdaterreSignInSettingsConfig.json
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via AutodialDLL
properties.description: Detects change the the "AutodialDLL" key which could be used as a persistence method to load custom DLL via the "ws2_32" library
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disable Windows Security Center Notifications
properties.description: Detect set UseActionCenterExperience to 0 to disable the Windows security center notification
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Credential Dumping Attempt Using New NetworkProvider - REG
properties.description: Detects when an attacker tries to add a new network provider in order to dump clear text credentials, similar to how the NPPSpy tool does it
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Command Executed Via Run Dialog Box - Registry
properties.description:
Detects execution of commands via the run dialog box on Windows by checking values of the "RunMRU" registry key.
This technique was seen being abused by threat actors to deceive users into pasting and executing malicious commands, often disguised as CAPTCHA verification steps.
properties.author: Ahmed Farouk, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Directory Service Restore Mode(DSRM) Registry Value Tampering
properties.description:
Detects changes to "DsrmAdminLogonBehavior" registry value.
During a Domain Controller (DC) promotion, administrators create a Directory Services Restore Mode (DSRM) local administrator account with a password that rarely changes. The DSRM account is an Administrator account that logs in with the DSRM mode when the server is booting up to restore AD backups or recover the server from a failure.
Attackers could abuse DSRM account to maintain their persistence and access to the organization's Active Directory.
If the "DsrmAdminLogonBehavior" value is set to "0", the administrator account can only be used if the DC starts in DSRM.
If the "DsrmAdminLogonBehavior" value is set to "1", the administrator account can only be used if the local AD DS service is stopped.
If the "DsrmAdminLogonBehavior" value is set to "2", the administrator account can always be used.
properties.author: Nischal Khadgi

properties.name: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed
properties.description:
Detects tampering of RDP Terminal Service/Server sensitive settings.
Such as allowing unauthorized users access to a system via the 'fAllowUnsolicited' or enabling RDP via 'fDenyTSConnections', etc.

Below is a list of registry keys/values that are monitored by this rule:

- Shadow: Used to enable Remote Desktop shadowing, which allows an administrator to view or control a user's session.
- DisableRemoteDesktopAntiAlias: Disables anti-aliasing for remote desktop sessions.
- DisableSecuritySettings: Disables certain security settings for Remote Desktop connections.
- fAllowUnsolicited: Allows unsolicited remote assistance offers.
- fAllowUnsolicitedFullControl: Allows unsolicited remote assistance offers with full control.
- InitialProgram: Specifies a program to run automatically when a user logs on to a remote computer.
- ServiceDll: Used in RDP hijacking techniques to specify a custom DLL to be loaded by the Terminal Services service.
- SecurityLayer: Specifies the security layer used for RDP connections.
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden, David ANDRE, Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via DLLPathOverride
properties.description: Detects when an attacker adds a new "DLLPathOverride" value to the "Natural Language" key in order to achieve persistence which will get invoked by "SearchIndexer.exe" process
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential CobaltStrike Service Installations - Registry
properties.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement.
properties.author: Wojciech Lesicki

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Scrobj.dll COM Hijacking
properties.description: Detect use of scrobj.dll as this DLL looks for the ScriptletURL key to get the location of the script to execute
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: NET NGenAssemblyUsageLog Registry Key Tamper
properties.description:
Detects changes to the NGenAssemblyUsageLog registry key.
.NET Usage Log output location can be controlled by setting the NGenAssemblyUsageLog CLR configuration knob in the Registry or by configuring an environment variable (as described in the next section).
By simplify specifying an arbitrary value (e.g. fake output location or junk data) for the expected value, a Usage Log file for the .NET execution context will not be created.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell as a Service in Registry
properties.description: Detects that a powershell code is written to the registry as a service.
properties.author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova

properties.name: Disable PUA Protection on Windows Defender
properties.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender PUA protection
properties.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger

properties.name: VBScript Payload Stored in Registry
properties.description: Detects VBScript content stored into registry keys as seen being used by UNC2452 group
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Internet Explorer DisableFirstRunCustomize Enabled
properties.description: Detects changes to the Internet Explorer "DisableFirstRunCustomize" value, which prevents Internet Explorer from running the first run wizard the first time a user starts the browser after installing Internet Explorer or Windows.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disable Privacy Settings Experience in Registry
properties.description: Detects registry modifications that disable Privacy Settings Experience
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: DNS-over-HTTPS Enabled by Registry
properties.description:
Detects when a user enables DNS-over-HTTPS.
This can be used to hide internet activity or be used to hide the process of exfiltrating data.
With this enabled organization will lose visibility into data such as query type, response and originating IP that are used to determine bad actors.
properties.author: Austin Songer

properties.name: Hypervisor Enforced Paging Translation Disabled
properties.description: Detects changes to the "DisableHypervisorEnforcedPagingTranslation" registry value. Where the it is set to "1" in order to disable the Hypervisor Enforced Paging Translation feature.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Logging Disabled Via Registry Key Tampering
properties.description: Detects changes to the registry for the currently logged-in user. In order to disable PowerShell module logging, script block logging or transcription and script execution logging
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Old TLS1.0/TLS1.1 Protocol Version Enabled
properties.description: Detects applications or users re-enabling old TLS versions by setting the "Enabled" value to "1" for the "Protocols" registry key.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Modify User Shell Folders Startup Value
properties.description: Detect modification of the startup key to a path where a payload could be stored to be launched during startup
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Hiding User Account Via SpecialAccounts Registry Key
properties.description: Detects modifications to the registry key "HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\Userlist" where the value is set to "0" in order to hide user account from being listed on the logon screen.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Outlook Macro Execution Without Warning Setting Enabled
properties.description: Detects the modification of Outlook security setting to allow unprompted execution of macros.
properties.author: @ScoubiMtl

properties.name: Winget Admin Settings Modification
properties.description: Detects changes to the AppInstaller (winget) admin settings. Such as enabling local manifest installations or disabling installer hash checks
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Outlook Home Page
properties.description:
Detects potential persistence activity via outlook home page.
An attacker can set a home page to achieve code execution and persistence by editing the WebView registry keys.
properties.author: Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems), David Bertho (@dbertho) & Eirik Sveen (@0xSV1), Storebrand

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via App Paths Default Property
properties.description:
Detects changes to the "Default" property for keys located in the \Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\App Paths\ registry. Which might be used as a method of persistence
The entries found under App Paths are used primarily for the following purposes.
First, to map an application's executable file name to that file's fully qualified path.
Second, to prepend information to the PATH environment variable on a per-application, per-process basis.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: FileFix - Command Evidence in TypedPaths
properties.description: Detects commonly-used chained commands and strings in the most recent 'url' value of the 'TypedPaths' key, which could be indicative of a user being targeted by the FileFix technique.
properties.author: Alfie Champion (delivr.to), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Extension In Keyboard Layout IME File Registry Value
properties.description:
Detects usage of Windows Input Method Editor (IME) keyboard layout feature, which allows an attacker to load a DLL into the process after sending the WM_INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST message.
Before doing this, the client needs to register the DLL in a special registry key that is assumed to implement this keyboard layout. This registry key should store a value named "Ime File" with a DLL path.
IMEs are essential for languages that have more characters than can be represented on a standard keyboard, such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Microsoft Office Protected View Disabled
properties.description: Detects changes to Microsoft Office protected view registry keys with which the attacker disables this feature.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
properties.description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disable Internal Tools or Feature in Registry
properties.description: Detects registry modifications that change features of internal Windows tools (malware like Agent Tesla uses this technique)
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), CrimpSec

properties.name: Tamper With Sophos AV Registry Keys
properties.description: Detects tamper attempts to sophos av functionality via registry key modification
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Add Port Monitor Persistence in Registry
properties.description:
Adversaries may use port monitors to run an attacker supplied DLL during system boot for persistence or privilege escalation.
A port monitor can be set through the AddMonitor API call to set a DLL to be loaded at startup.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Change the Fax Dll
properties.description: Detect possible persistence using Fax DLL load when service restart
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Lsass Full Dump Request Via DumpType Registry Settings
properties.description: Detects the setting of the "DumpType" registry value to "2" which stands for a "Full Dump". Technique such as LSASS Shtinkering requires this value to be "2" in order to dump LSASS.
properties.author: @pbssubhash

properties.name: CrashControl CrashDump Disabled
properties.description: Detects disabling the CrashDump per registry (as used by HermeticWiper)
properties.author: Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CurrentVersion Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell In Registry Run Keys
properties.description: Detects potential PowerShell commands or code within registry run keys
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Allow RDP Remote Assistance Feature
properties.description: Detect enable rdp feature to allow specific user to rdp connect on the targeted machine
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PUA - Sysinternals Tools Execution - Registry
properties.description: Detects the execution of some potentially unwanted tools such as PsExec, Procdump, etc. (part of the Sysinternals suite) via the creation of the "accepteula" registry key.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disable Exploit Guard Network Protection on Windows Defender
properties.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender Exploit Guard Network Protection
properties.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via CHM Helper DLL
properties.description: Detects when an attacker modifies the registry key "HtmlHelp Author" to achieve persistence
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Secure Desktop Prompt Disabled
properties.description:
Detects when an attacker tries to change User Account Control (UAC) elevation request destination via the "PromptOnSecureDesktop" value.
The "PromptOnSecureDesktop" setting specifically determines whether UAC prompts are displayed on the secure desktop. The secure desktop is a separate desktop environment that's isolated from other processes running on the system. It's designed to prevent malicious software from intercepting or tampering with UAC prompts.
When "PromptOnSecureDesktop" is set to 0, UAC prompts are displayed on the user's current desktop instead of the secure desktop. This reduces the level of security because it potentially exposes the prompts to manipulation by malicious software.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - Registry
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via LSA Extensions
properties.description:
Detects when an attacker modifies the "REG_MULTI_SZ" value named "Extensions" to include a custom DLL to achieve persistence via lsass.
The "Extensions" list contains filenames of DLLs being automatically loaded by lsass.exe. Each DLL has its InitializeLsaExtension() method called after loading.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Printer Driver Empty Manufacturer
properties.description: Detects a suspicious printer driver installation with an empty Manufacturer value
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disable Tamper Protection on Windows Defender
properties.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender Tamper Protection
properties.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger

properties.name: Persistence Via Hhctrl.ocx
properties.description: Detects when an attacker modifies the registry value of the "hhctrl" to point to a custom binary
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Scheduled TaskCache Change by Uncommon Program
properties.description: Monitor the creation of a new key under 'TaskCache' when a new scheduled task is registered by a process that is not svchost.exe, which is suspicious
properties.author: Syed Hasan (@syedhasan009)

properties.name: Service Binary in Suspicious Folder
properties.description: Detect the creation of a service with a service binary located in a suspicious directory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Bypass UAC Using SilentCleanup Task
properties.description:
Detects the setting of the environement variable "windir" to a non default value.
Attackers often abuse this variable in order to trigger a UAC bypass via the "SilentCleanup" task.
The SilentCleanup task located in %windir%\system32\cleanmgr.exe is an auto-elevated task that can be abused to elevate any file with administrator privileges without prompting UAC.
properties.author: frack113, Nextron Systems

properties.name: Potential Attachment Manager Settings Attachments Tamper
properties.description: Detects tampering with attachment manager settings policies attachments (See reference for more information)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential PendingFileRenameOperations Tampering
properties.description: Detect changes to the "PendingFileRenameOperations" registry key from uncommon or suspicious images locations to stage currently used files for rename or deletion after reboot.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Register New IFiltre For Persistence
properties.description:
Detects when an attacker registers a new IFilter for an extension. Microsoft Windows Search uses filters to extract the content of items for inclusion in a full-text index.
You can extend Windows Search to index new or proprietary file types by writing filters to extract the content, and property handlers to extract the properties of files.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Root or CA or AuthRoot Certificate to Store
properties.description: Detects the addition of new root, CA or AuthRoot certificates to the Windows registry
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Disable Microsoft Defender Firewall via Registry
properties.description: Adversaries may disable or modify system firewalls in order to bypass controls limiting network usage
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: New ODBC Driver Registered
properties.description: Detects the registration of a new ODBC driver.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Add Debugger Entry To AeDebug For Persistence
properties.description: Detects when an attacker adds a new "Debugger" value to the "AeDebug" key in order to achieve persistence which will get invoked when an application crashes
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Custom File Open Handler Executes PowerShell
properties.description: Detects the abuse of custom file open handler, executing powershell
properties.author: CD_R0M_

properties.name: Disable Macro Runtime Scan Scope
properties.description: Detects tampering with the MacroRuntimeScanScope registry key to disable runtime scanning of enabled macros
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DHCP Callout DLL Installation
properties.description: Detects the installation of a Callout DLL via CalloutDlls and CalloutEnabled parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DHCP server (restart required)
properties.author: Dimitrios Slamaris

properties.name: Office Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Potential AMSI COM Server Hijacking
properties.description: Detects changes to the AMSI come server registry key in order disable AMSI scanning functionalities. When AMSI attempts to starts its COM component, it will query its registered CLSID and return a non-existent COM server. This causes a load failure and prevents any scanning methods from being accessed, ultimately rendering AMSI useless
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Security Event Logging Disabled via MiniNt Registry Key - Registry Set
properties.description:
Detects the addition of the 'MiniNt' key to the registry. Upon a reboot, Windows Event Log service will stop writing events.
Windows Event Log is a service that collects and stores event logs from the operating system and applications. It is an important component of Windows security and auditing.
Adversary may want to disable this service to disable logging of security events which could be used to detect their activities.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Registry Explorer Policy Modification
properties.description: Detects registry modifications that disable internal tools or functions in explorer (malware like Agent Tesla uses this technique)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Winlogon AllowMultipleTSSessions Enable
properties.description:
Detects when the 'AllowMultipleTSSessions' value is enabled.
Which allows for multiple Remote Desktop connection sessions to be opened at once.
This is often used by attacker as a way to connect to an RDP session without disconnecting the other users
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Shim Database Patching Activity
properties.description: Detects installation of new shim databases that try to patch sections of known processes for potential process injection or persistence.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Wow6432Node Classes Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Event Viewer Events.asp
properties.description: Detects potential registry persistence technique using the Event Viewer "Events.asp" technique
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - Registry
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: System Scripts Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Outlook LoadMacroProviderOnBoot Setting
properties.description: Detects the modification of Outlook setting "LoadMacroProviderOnBoot" which if enabled allows the automatic loading of any configured VBA project/module
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Enable Microsoft Dynamic Data Exchange
properties.description: Enable Dynamic Data Exchange protocol (DDE) in all supported editions of Microsoft Word or Excel.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: ClickOnce Trust Prompt Tampering
properties.description: Detects changes to the ClickOnce trust prompt registry key in order to enable an installation from different locations such as the Internet.
properties.author: @SerkinValery, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Displaying Hidden Files Feature Disabled
properties.description:
Detects modifications to the "Hidden" and "ShowSuperHidden" explorer registry values in order to disable showing of hidden files and system files.
This technique is abused by several malware families to hide their files from normal users.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Persistence Via New SIP Provider
properties.description: Detects when an attacker register a new SIP provider for persistence and defense evasion
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Registry Persistence via Service in Safe Mode
properties.description: Detects the modification of the registry to allow a driver or service to persist in Safe Mode.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Mpnotify
properties.description: Detects when an attacker register a new SIP provider for persistence and defense evasion
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: IE Change Domain Zone
properties.description: Hides the file extension through modification of the registry
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: UAC Bypass via Sdclt
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using registry key manipulation of sdclt.exe (e.g. UACMe 53)
properties.author: Omer Yampel, Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Defender Exclusions Added - Registry
properties.description: Detects the Setting of Windows Defender Exclusions
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Registry Persistence Attempt Via Windows Telemetry
properties.description:
Detects potential persistence behavior using the windows telemetry registry key.
Windows telemetry makes use of the binary CompatTelRunner.exe to run a variety of commands and perform the actual telemetry collections.
This binary was created to be easily extensible, and to that end, it relies on the registry to instruct on which commands to run.
The problem is, it will run any arbitrary command without restriction of location or type.
properties.author: Lednyov Alexey, oscd.community, Sreeman

properties.name: Potential Registry Persistence Attempt Via DbgManagedDebugger
properties.description: Detects the addition of the "Debugger" value to the "DbgManagedDebugger" key in order to achieve persistence. Which will get invoked when an application crashes
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: WFP Filter Added via Registry
properties.description: Detects registry modifications that add Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) filters, which may be used to block security tools and EDR agents from reporting events.
properties.author: Frack113

properties.name: Potential Signing Bypass Via Windows Developer Features - Registry
properties.description: Detects when the enablement of developer features such as "Developer Mode" or "Application Sideloading". Which allows the user to install untrusted packages.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Installed
properties.description: Detects the installation of a DNS plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New File Association Using Exefile
properties.description: Detects the abuse of the exefile handler in new file association. Used for bypass of security products.
properties.author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Disk Cleanup Handler - Registry
properties.description:
Detects when an attacker modifies values of the Disk Cleanup Handler in the registry to achieve persistence.
The disk cleanup manager is part of the operating system. It displays the dialog box []
The user has the option of enabling or disabling individual handlers by selecting or clearing their check box in the disk cleanup manager's UI.
Although Windows comes with a number of disk cleanup handlers, they aren't designed to handle files produced by other applications.
Instead, the disk cleanup manager is designed to be flexible and extensible by enabling any developer to implement and register their own disk cleanup handler.
Any developer can extend the available disk cleanup services by implementing and registering a disk cleanup handler.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Removal Of SD Value to Hide Schedule Task - Registry
properties.description: Remove SD (Security Descriptor) value in \Schedule\TaskCache\Tree registry hive to hide schedule task. This technique is used by Tarrask malware
properties.author: Sittikorn S

properties.name: Folder Removed From Exploit Guard ProtectedFolders List - Registry
properties.description: Detects the removal of folders from the "ProtectedFolders" list of of exploit guard. This could indicate an attacker trying to launch an encryption process or trying to manipulate data inside of the protected folder
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Recall Feature Enabled - DisableAIDataAnalysis Value Deleted
properties.description:
Detects the enabling of the Windows Recall feature via registry manipulation. Windows Recall can be enabled by deleting the existing "DisableAIDataAnalysis" registry value.
Adversaries may enable Windows Recall as part of post-exploitation discovery and collection activities.
This rule assumes that Recall is already explicitly disabled on the host, and subsequently enabled by the adversary.
properties.author: Sajid Nawaz Khan

properties.name: Delete Defender Scan ShellEx Context Menu Registry Key
properties.description: Detects deletion of registry key that adds 'Scan with Defender' option in context menu. Attackers may use this to make it harder for users to scan files that are suspicious.
properties.author: Matt Anderson (Huntress)

properties.name: Removal Of Index Value to Hide Schedule Task - Registry
properties.description: Detects when the "index" value of a scheduled task is removed or deleted from the registry. Which effectively hides it from any tooling such as "schtasks /query"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Terminal Server Client Connection History Cleared - Registry
properties.description: Detects the deletion of registry keys containing the MSTSC connection history
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Removal Of AMSI Provider Registry Keys
properties.description: Detects the deletion of AMSI provider registry key entries in HKLM\Software\Microsoft\AMSI. This technique could be used by an attacker in order to disable AMSI inspection.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Removal of Potential COM Hijacking Registry Keys
properties.description:
Detects any deletion of entries in ".*\shell\open\command" registry keys.
These registry keys might have been used for COM hijacking activities by a threat actor or an attacker and the deletion could indicate steps to remove its tracks.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: RunMRU Registry Key Deletion - Registry
properties.description:
Detects attempts to delete the RunMRU registry key, which stores the history of commands executed via the run dialog.
In the clickfix techniques, the phishing lures instruct users to open a run dialog through (Win + R) and execute malicious commands.
Adversaries may delete this key to cover their tracks after executing commands.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New DLL Added to AppCertDlls Registry Key
properties.description:
Dynamic-link libraries (DLLs) that are specified in the AppCertDLLs value in the Registry key can be abused to obtain persistence and privilege escalation
by causing a malicious DLL to be loaded and run in the context of separate processes on the computer.
properties.author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community

properties.name: New DLL Added to AppInit_DLLs Registry Key
properties.description: DLLs that are specified in the AppInit_DLLs value in the Registry key HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows are loaded by user32.dll into every process that loads user32.dll
properties.author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community, Tim Shelton

properties.name: Narrator's Feedback-Hub Persistence
properties.description: Detects abusing Windows 10 Narrator's Feedback-Hub
properties.author: Dmitriy Lifanov, oscd.community

properties.name: WINEKEY Registry Modification
properties.description: Detects potential malicious modification of run keys by winekey or team9 backdoor
properties.author: omkar72

properties.name: Office Application Startup - Office Test
properties.description: Detects the addition of office test registry that allows a user to specify an arbitrary DLL that will be executed every time an Office application is started
properties.author: omkar72

properties.name: UAC Bypass Via Wsreset
properties.description: Unfixed method for UAC bypass from Windows 10. WSReset.exe file associated with the Windows Store. It will run a binary file contained in a low-privilege registry.
properties.author: oscd.community, Dmitry Uchakin

properties.name: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Usage - Registry
properties.description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), @twjackomo, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: DLL Load via LSASS
properties.description: Detects a method to load DLL via LSASS process using an undocumented Registry key
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Run Key from Download
properties.description: Detects the suspicious RUN keys created by software located in Download or temporary Outlook/Internet Explorer directories
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poude (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disable Security Events Logging Adding Reg Key MiniNt
properties.description: Detects the addition of a key 'MiniNt' to the registry. Upon a reboot, Windows Event Log service will stop writing events.
properties.author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community

properties.name: Potential Qakbot Registry Activity
properties.description: Detects a registry key used by IceID in a campaign that distributes malicious OneNote files
properties.author: Hieu Tran

properties.name: Suspicious Camera and Microphone Access
properties.description: Detects Processes accessing the camera and microphone from suspicious folder
properties.author: Den Iuzvyk

properties.name: Security Support Provider (SSP) Added to LSA Configuration
properties.description: Detects the addition of a SSP to the registry. Upon a reboot or API call, SSP DLLs gain access to encrypted and plaintext passwords stored in Windows.
properties.author: iwillkeepwatch

properties.name: CMSTP Execution Registry Event
properties.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
properties.author: Nik Seetharaman

properties.name: Windows Registry Trust Record Modification
properties.description: Alerts on trust record modification within the registry, indicating usage of macros
properties.author: Antonlovesdnb, Trent Liffick (@tliffick)

properties.name: New PortProxy Registry Entry Added
properties.description: Detects the modification of the PortProxy registry key which is used for port forwarding.
properties.author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)

properties.name: Wdigest CredGuard Registry Modification
properties.description:
Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of IsCredGuardEnabled from
HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest to disable Cred Guard on a system.
This is usually used with UseLogonCredential to manipulate the caching credentials.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Atbroker Registry Change
properties.description: Detects creation/modification of Assistive Technology applications and persistence with usage of 'at'
properties.author: Mateusz Wydra, oscd.community

properties.name: NetNTLM Downgrade Attack - Registry
properties.description: Detects NetNTLM downgrade attack
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), wagga, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Splunk STRT)

properties.name: Creation of a Local Hidden User Account by Registry
properties.description: Sysmon registry detection of a local hidden user account.
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Run Once Task Configuration in Registry
properties.description: Rule to detect the configuration of Run Once registry key. Configured payload can be run by runonce.exe /AlternateShellStartup
properties.author: Avneet Singh @v3t0_, oscd.community

properties.name: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Registry Manipulation
properties.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook
properties.author: Alexander Rausch

properties.name: Esentutl Volume Shadow Copy Service Keys
properties.description: Detects the volume shadow copy service initialization and processing via esentutl. Registry keys such as HKLM\\System\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\VSS\\Diag\\VolSnap\\Volume are captured.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Windows Credential Editor Registry
properties.description: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Path To Screensaver Binary Modified
properties.description: Detects value modification of registry key containing path to binary used as screensaver.
properties.author: Bartlomiej Czyz @bczyz1, oscd.community

properties.name: Registry Tampering by Potentially Suspicious Processes
properties.description:
Detects suspicious registry modifications made by suspicious processes such as script engine processes such as WScript, or CScript etc.
These processes are rarely used for legitimate registry modifications, and their activity may indicate an attempt to modify the registry
without using standard tools like regedit.exe or reg.exe, potentially for evasion and persistence.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Enable Remote Connection Between Anonymous Computer - AllowAnonymousCallback
properties.description: Detects enabling of the "AllowAnonymousCallback" registry value, which allows a remote connection between computers that do not have a trust relationship.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HybridConnectionManager Service Installation - Registry
properties.description: Detects the installation of the Azure Hybrid Connection Manager service to allow remote code execution from Azure function.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Windows Defender Threat Severity Default Action Modified
properties.description:
Detects modifications or creations of Windows Defender's default threat action settings based on severity to 'allow' or take 'no action'.
This is a highly suspicious configuration change that effectively disables Defender's ability to automatically mitigate threats of a certain severity level,
allowing malicious software to run unimpeded. An attacker might use this technique to bypass defenses before executing payloads.
properties.author: Matt Anderson (Huntress)

properties.name: Registry Entries For Azorult Malware
properties.description: Detects the presence of a registry key created during Azorult execution
properties.author: Trent Liffick

properties.name: Registry Persistence Mechanisms in Recycle Bin
properties.description: Detects persistence registry keys for Recycle Bin
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Shell Open Registry Keys Manipulation
properties.description: Detects the shell open key manipulation (exefile and ms-settings) used for persistence and the pattern of UAC Bypass using fodhelper.exe, computerdefaults.exe, slui.exe via registry keys (e.g. UACMe 33 or 62)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Credential Dumping Via LSASS SilentProcessExit Technique
properties.description: Detects changes to the Registry in which a monitor program gets registered to dump the memory of the lsass.exe process
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Thread Created In KeePass.EXE
properties.description: Detects remote thread creation in "KeePass.exe" which could indicates potential password dumping activity
properties.author: Timon Hackenjos

properties.name: Remote Thread Creation In Mstsc.Exe From Suspicious Location
properties.description:
Detects remote thread creation in the "mstsc.exe" process by a process located in a potentially suspicious location.
This technique is often used by attackers in order to hook some APIs used by DLLs loaded by "mstsc.exe" during RDP authentications in order to steal credentials.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Potential CobaltStrike Process Injection
properties.description: Detects a potential remote threat creation with certain characteristics which are typical for Cobalt Strike beacons
properties.author: Olaf Hartong, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community

properties.name: Remote Thread Creation Ttdinject.exe Proxy
properties.description: Detects a remote thread creation of Ttdinject.exe used as proxy
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - CACTUSTORCH Remote Thread Creation
properties.description: Detects remote thread creation from CACTUSTORCH as described in references.
properties.author: @SBousseaden (detection), Thomas Patzke (rule)

properties.name: Remote Thread Creation Via PowerShell In Uncommon Target
properties.description: Detects the creation of a remote thread from a Powershell process in an uncommon target process
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Password Dumper Remote Thread in LSASS
properties.description:
Detects password dumper activity by monitoring remote thread creation EventID 8 in combination with the lsass.exe process as TargetImage.
The process in field Process is the malicious program. A single execution can lead to hundreds of events.
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: Potential Credential Dumping Attempt Via PowerShell Remote Thread
properties.description: Detects remote thread creation by PowerShell processes into "lsass.exe"
properties.author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova

properties.name: Remote Thread Creation In Uncommon Target Image
properties.description: Detects uncommon target processes for remote thread creation
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Thread Creation By Uncommon Source Image
properties.description: Detects uncommon processes creating remote threads.
properties.author: Perez Diego (@darkquassar), oscd.community

properties.name: Rare Remote Thread Creation By Uncommon Source Image
properties.description: Detects uncommon processes creating remote threads.
properties.author: Perez Diego (@darkquassar), oscd.community

properties.name: QuickAssist Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of Microsoft Quick Assist tool "QuickAssist.exe". This utility can be used by attackers to gain remote access.
properties.author: Muhammad Faisal (@faisalusuf)

properties.name: Powershell Token Obfuscation - Process Creation
properties.description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Windows Defender Tampering Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects potential tampering with Windows Defender settings such as adding exclusion using wmic
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Greedy Compression Using Rar.EXE
properties.description: Detects RAR usage that creates an archive from a suspicious folder, either a system folder or one of the folders often used by attackers for staging purposes
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Wmiexec Default Powershell Command
properties.description: Detects the execution of PowerShell with a specific flag sequence that is used by the Wmiexec script
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using ChangePK and SLUI
properties.description: Detects an UAC bypass that uses changepk.exe and slui.exe (UACMe 61)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential PsExec Remote Execution
properties.description: Detects potential psexec command that initiate execution on a remote systems via common commandline flags used by the utility
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious ClickFix/FileFix Execution Pattern
properties.description:
Detects suspicious execution patterns where users are tricked into running malicious commands via clipboard manipulation, either through the Windows Run dialog (ClickFix) or File Explorer address bar (FileFix).
Attackers leverage social engineering campaignssuch as fake CAPTCHA challenges or urgent alertsencouraging victims to paste clipboard contents, often executing mshta.exe, powershell.exe, or similar commands to infect systems.
properties.author: montysecurity, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Sysmon Discovery Via Default Driver Altitude Using Findstr.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of "findstr" with the argument "385201". Which could indicate potential discovery of an installed Sysinternals Sysmon service using the default driver altitude (even if the name is changed).
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Arbitrary Command Execution Using Msdt.EXE
properties.description: Detects processes leveraging the "ms-msdt" handler or the "msdt.exe" binary to execute arbitrary commands as seen in the follina (CVE-2022-30190) vulnerability
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Ping Hex IP
properties.description: Detects a ping command that uses a hex encoded IP address
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Process Creation Using Sysnative Folder
properties.description: Detects process creation events that use the Sysnative folder (common for CobaltStrike spawns)
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Explorer Process Tree Break
properties.description:
Detects a command line process that uses explorer.exe to launch arbitrary commands or binaries,
which is similar to cmd.exe /c, only it breaks the process tree and makes its parent a new instance of explorer spawning from "svchost"
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), @gott_cyber

properties.name: Shell32 DLL Execution in Suspicious Directory
properties.description: Detects shell32.dll executing a DLL in a suspicious directory
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Child Process Created as System
properties.description: Detection of child processes spawned with SYSTEM privileges by parents with LOCAL SERVICE or NETWORK SERVICE accounts
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Roberto Rodriguez (@Cyb3rWard0g), Open Threat Research (OTR)

properties.name: Suspicious Child Process Of BgInfo.EXE
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes of "BgInfo.exe" which could be a sign of potential abuse of the binary to proxy execution via external VBScript
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Compress Data and Lock With Password for Exfiltration With WINZIP
properties.description: An adversary may compress or encrypt data that is collected prior to exfiltration using 3rd party utilities
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Use of TTDInject.exe
properties.description: Detects the executiob of TTDInject.exe, which is used by Windows 10 v1809 and newer to debug time travel (underlying call of tttracer.exe)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Download Pattern
properties.description: Detects a Powershell process that contains download commands in its command line string
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Jonhnathan Ribeiro

properties.name: Conhost Spawned By Uncommon Parent Process
properties.description: Detects when the Console Window Host (conhost.exe) process is spawned by an uncommon parent process, which could be indicative of potential code injection activity.
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Msxsl.EXE Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of the MSXSL utility. This can be used to execute Extensible Stylesheet Language (XSL) files. These files are commonly used to describe the processing and rendering of data within XML files.
Adversaries can abuse this functionality to execute arbitrary files while potentially bypassing application whitelisting defenses.
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
properties.description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - Pypykatz Credentials Dumping Activity
properties.description: Detects the usage of "pypykatz" to obtain stored credentials. Adversaries may attempt to extract credential material from the Security Account Manager (SAM) database through Windows registry where the SAM database is stored
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Devtoolslauncher.exe Executes Specified Binary
properties.description: The Devtoolslauncher.exe executes other binary
properties.author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community (rule), @_felamos (idea)

properties.name: Veeam Backup Database Suspicious Query
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious SQL queries using SQLCmd targeting the Veeam backup databases in order to steal information.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Driver/DLL Installation Via Odbcconf.EXE
