properties.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "INSTALLDRIVER" action where the driver doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. This is often used as a defense evasion method.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using IEInstal - Process
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using IEInstal.exe (UACMe 64)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Provisioning Registry Key Abuse For Binary Proxy Execution
properties.description: Detects potential abuse of the provisioning registry key for indirect command execution through "Provlaunch.exe".
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Visual Studio NodejsTools PressAnyKey Arbitrary Binary Execution
properties.description: Detects child processes of Microsoft.NodejsTools.PressAnyKey.exe that can be used to execute any other binary
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential RDP Session Hijacking Activity
properties.description: Detects potential RDP Session Hijacking activity on Windows systems
properties.author: @juju4

properties.name: Suspicious Child Process Of SQL Server
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the SQLServer process. This could indicate potential RCE or SQL Injection.
properties.author: FPT.EagleEye Team, wagga

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - Renamed MeshAgent Execution - Windows
properties.description:
Detects the execution of a renamed instance of the Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) tool, MeshAgent.
RMM tools such as MeshAgent are commonly utilized by IT administrators for legitimate remote support and system management.
However, malicious actors may exploit these tools by renaming them to bypass detection mechanisms, enabling unauthorized access and control over compromised systems.
properties.author: Norbert Janiewicz (AlphaSOC)

properties.name: Stop Windows Service Via PowerShell Stop-Service
properties.description: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the PowerShell Cmdlet "Stop-Service"
properties.author: Jakob Weinzettl, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Download and Execution Cradles
properties.description: Detects PowerShell download and execution cradles.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Code Execution via Pcwutl.dll
properties.description: Detects launch of executable by calling the LaunchApplication function from pcwutl.dll library.
properties.author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community

properties.name: Attempts of Kerberos Coercion Via DNS SPN Spoofing
properties.description:
Detects the presence of "UWhRC....AAYBAAAA" pattern in command line.
The pattern "1UWhRCAAAAA..BAAAA" is a base64-encoded signature that corresponds to a marshaled CREDENTIAL_TARGET_INFORMATION structure.
Attackers can use this technique to coerce authentication from victim systems to attacker-controlled hosts.
It is one of the strong indicators of a Kerberos coercion attack, where adversaries manipulate DNS records
to spoof Service Principal Names (SPNs) and redirect authentication requests like in CVE-2025-33073.
If you see this pattern in the command line, it is likely an attempt to add spoofed Service Principal Names (SPNs) to DNS records,
or checking for the presence of such records through the `nslookup` command.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Windows Service Tampering
properties.description: Detects the usage of binaries such as 'net', 'sc' or 'powershell' in order to stop, pause, disable or delete critical or important Windows services such as AV, Backup, etc. As seen being used in some ransomware scripts
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113 , X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Add Windows Capability Via PowerShell Cmdlet
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Add-WindowsCapability" cmdlet to add Windows capabilities. Notable capabilities could be "OpenSSH" and others.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Php Inline Command Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of php using the "-r" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live php code.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Koadic Execution
properties.description: Detects command line parameters used by Koadic hack tool
properties.author: wagga, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Windows Internet Hosted WebDav Share Mount Via Net.EXE
properties.description: Detects when an internet hosted webdav share is mounted using the "net.exe" utility
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Doppelanger LSASS Dumper Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the Doppelanger hacktool which is used to dump LSASS memory via process cloning while evading common detection methods
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 1
properties.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
properties.author: @Kostastsale, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: Mstsc.EXE Execution From Uncommon Parent
properties.description: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file located in suspicious locations.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Download Via Bitsadmin To A Suspicious Target Folder
properties.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file to a suspicious target folder
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ImagingDevices Unusual Parent/Child Processes
properties.description: Detects unusual parent or children of the ImagingDevices.exe (Windows Contacts) process as seen being used with Bumblebee activity
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dnx.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the execution of Dnx.EXE. The Dnx utility allows for the execution of C# code.
Attackers might abuse this in order to bypass application whitelisting.
properties.author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community

properties.name: Potential Suspicious Mofcomp Execution
properties.description:
Detects execution of the "mofcomp" utility as a child of a suspicious shell or script running utility or by having a suspicious path in the commandline.
The "mofcomp" utility parses a file containing MOF statements and adds the classes and class instances defined in the file to the WMI repository.
Attackers abuse this utility to install malicious MOF scripts
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Cookies Session Hijacking
properties.description: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "-c" flag in order to save cookie data.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Import LDAP Data Interchange Format File Via Ldifde.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of "Ldifde.exe" with the import flag "-i". The can be abused to include HTTP-based arguments which will allow the arbitrary download of files from a remote server.
properties.author: @gott_cyber

properties.name: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
properties.description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Configuration And Service Reconnaissance Via Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" in order to query reconnaissance information from the registry. Adversaries may interact with the Windows registry to gather information about credentials, the system, configuration, and installed software.
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Csc.EXE Execution Form Potentially Suspicious Parent
properties.description: Detects a potentially suspicious parent of "csc.exe", which could be a sign of payload delivery.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SharPersist Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the hacktool SharPersist - used to deploy various different kinds of persistence mechanisms
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
properties.description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g (rule), oscd.community (improvements)

properties.name: Potential Memory Dumping Activity Via LiveKD
properties.description: Detects execution of LiveKD based on PE metadata or image name
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential DLL File Download Via PowerShell Invoke-WebRequest
properties.description: Detects potential DLL files being downloaded using the PowerShell Invoke-WebRequest or Invoke-RestMethod cmdlets.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Hieu Tran

properties.name: Suspicious File Download From File Sharing Domain Via Wget.EXE
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads from file sharing domains using wget.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Download Using Notepad++ GUP Utility
properties.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater (gup) from a process other than Notepad++ to download files.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Base64 Encoded WMI Classes
properties.description: Detects calls to base64 encoded WMI class such as "Win32_ShadowCopy", "Win32_ScheduledJob", etc.
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Using SettingSyncHost.exe as LOLBin
properties.description: Detects using SettingSyncHost.exe to run hijacked binary
properties.author: Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

properties.name: Taskmgr as LOCAL_SYSTEM
properties.description: Detects the creation of taskmgr.exe process in context of LOCAL_SYSTEM
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Allow Service Access Using Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE
properties.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to allow access to a service from a suspicious trustee. This can be used to override access restrictions set by previous ACLs.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Parent Process
properties.description: Detects a suspicious or uncommon parent processes of PowerShell
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Harish Segar

properties.name: Uncommon Link.EXE Parent Process
properties.description:
Detects an uncommon parent process of "LINK.EXE".
Link.EXE in Microsoft incremental linker. Its a utility usually bundled with Visual Studio installation.
Multiple utilities often found in the same folder (editbin.exe, dumpbin.exe, lib.exe, etc) have a hardcode call to the "LINK.EXE" binary without checking its validity.
This would allow an attacker to sideload any binary with the name "link.exe" if one of the aforementioned tools get executed from a different location.
By filtering the known locations of such utilities we can spot uncommon parent process of LINK.EXE that might be suspicious or malicious.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Xwizard.EXE Execution From Non-Default Location
properties.description:
Detects the execution of Xwizard tool from a non-default directory.
When executed from a non-default directory, this utility can be abused in order to side load a custom version of "xwizards.dll".
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - NetSupport Execution From Unusual Location
properties.description: Detects execution of client32.exe (NetSupport RAT) from an unusual location (outside of 'C:\Program Files')
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Cab File Extraction Via Wusa.EXE From Potentially Suspicious Paths
properties.description: Detects the execution of the "wusa.exe" (Windows Update Standalone Installer) utility to extract ".cab" files using the "/extract" argument from potentially suspicious paths.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote CHM File Download/Execution Via HH.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of "hh.exe" to execute/download remotely hosted ".chm" files.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon AddinUtil.EXE CommandLine Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) with uncommon Addinroot or Pipelineroot paths. An adversary may execute AddinUtil.exe with uncommon Addinroot/Pipelineroot paths that point to the adversaries Addins.Store payload.
properties.author: Michael McKinley (@McKinleyMike), Tony Latteri (@TheLatteri)

properties.name: HackTool - SysmonEOP Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the PoC that can be used to exploit Sysmon CVE-2022-41120
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ETW Trace Evasion Activity
properties.description: Detects command line activity that tries to clear or disable any ETW trace log which could be a sign of logging evasion.
properties.author: @neu5ron, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Speech Runtime Binary Child Process
properties.description:
Detects suspicious Speech Runtime Binary Execution by monitoring its child processes.
Child processes spawned by SpeechRuntime.exe could indicate an attempt for lateral movement via COM & DCOM hijacking.
properties.author: andrewdanis

properties.name: Import PowerShell Modules From Suspicious Directories - ProcCreation
properties.description: Detects powershell scripts that import modules from suspicious directories
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Sensitive File Recovery From Backup Via Wbadmin.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the dump of highly sensitive files such as "NTDS.DIT" and "SECURITY" hive.
Attackers can leverage the "wbadmin" utility in order to dump sensitive files that might contain credential or sensitive information.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Java Running with Remote Debugging
properties.description: Detects a JAVA process running with remote debugging allowing more than just localhost to connect
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using Event Viewer RecentViews
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Event Viewer RecentViews
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Response File Execution Via Odbcconf.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "-f" flag in order to load a response file which might contain a malicious action.
properties.author: Kirill Kiryanov, Beyu Denis, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Arbitrary Code Execution Via Node.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution node.exe which is shipped with multiple software such as VMware, Adobe...etc. In order to execute arbitrary code. For example to establish reverse shell as seen in Log4j attacks...etc
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential MsiExec Masquerading
properties.description: Detects the execution of msiexec.exe from an uncommon directory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CobaltStrike Load by Rundll32
properties.description: Rundll32 can be use by Cobalt Strike with StartW function to load DLLs from the command line.
properties.author: Wojciech Lesicki

properties.name: Operator Bloopers Cobalt Strike Commands
properties.description: Detects use of Cobalt Strike commands accidentally entered in the CMD shell
properties.author: _pete_0, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: Suspicious Service DACL Modification Via Set-Service Cmdlet
properties.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications via the "Set-Service" cmdlet using the "SecurityDescriptorSddl" flag (Only available with PowerShell 7) that can be used to hide services or make them unstopable
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: LSASS Process Reconnaissance Via Findstr.EXE
properties.description: Detects findstring commands that include the keyword lsass, which indicates recon actviity for the LSASS process PID
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Run Once Task Execution as Configured in Registry
properties.description: This rule detects the execution of Run Once task as configured in the registry
properties.author: Avneet Singh @v3t0_, oscd.community, Christopher Peacock @SecurePeacock (updated)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process of KeyScrambler.exe
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of KeyScrambler.exe
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Msiexec Quiet Installation
properties.description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: WhoAmI as Parameter
properties.description: Detects a suspicious process command line that uses whoami as first parameter (as e.g. used by EfsPotato)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Service StartupType Change Via Sc.EXE
properties.description: Detect the use of "sc.exe" to change the startup type of a service to "disabled" or "demand"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Indirect Command Execution From Script File Via Bash.EXE
properties.description:
Detects execution of Microsoft bash launcher without any flags to execute the content of a bash script directly.
This can be used to potentially bypass defenses and execute Linux or Windows-based binaries directly via bash.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Whoami.EXE Execution From Privileged Process
properties.description: Detects the execution of "whoami.exe" by privileged accounts that are often abused by threat actors
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Teymur Kheirkhabarov

properties.name: Suspicious Serv-U Process Pattern
properties.description: Detects a suspicious process pattern which could be a sign of an exploited Serv-U service
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Child Process Of AddinUtil.EXE
properties.description: Detects uncommon child processes of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) which could be a sign of potential abuse of the binary to proxy execution via a custom Addins.Store payload.
properties.author: Michael McKinley (@McKinleyMike), Tony Latteri (@TheLatteri)

properties.name: Verclsid.exe Runs COM Object
properties.description: Detects when verclsid.exe is used to run COM object via GUID
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community

properties.name: Remote PowerShell Session Host Process (WinRM)
properties.description: Detects remote PowerShell sections by monitoring for wsmprovhost (WinRM host process) as a parent or child process (sign of an active PowerShell remote session).
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: PUA - NSudo Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of NSudo tool for command execution
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: HackTool - SafetyKatz Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the hacktool SafetyKatz via PE information and default Image name
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - System Informer Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of System Informer, a task manager tool to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level operations
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed ProcDump Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of a renamed ProcDump executable.
This often done by attackers or malware in order to evade defensive mechanisms.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential RDP Tunneling Via SSH
properties.description: Execution of ssh.exe to perform data exfiltration and tunneling through RDP
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Meterpreter/CobaltStrike Activity
properties.description: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service starting
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Ecco, Florian Roth

properties.name: Whoami.EXE Execution Anomaly
properties.description: Detects the execution of whoami.exe with suspicious parent processes.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Active Directory Structure Export Via Csvde.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of "csvde.exe" in order to export organizational Active Directory structure.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Userinit Child Process
properties.description: Detects a suspicious child process of userinit
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Samir Bousseaden (idea)

properties.name: Tasks Folder Evasion
properties.description:
The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths.
Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application
in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Sensitive File Dump Via Wbadmin.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the dump of highly sensitive files such as "NTDS.DIT" and "SECURITY" hive.
Attackers can leverage the "wbadmin" utility in order to dump sensitive files that might contain credential or sensitive information.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Insecure Transfer Via Curl.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "--insecure" flag.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 3
properties.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
properties.author: @Kostastsale, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: Potential Dosfuscation Activity
properties.description: Detects possible payload obfuscation via the commandline
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious LNK Command-Line Padding with Whitespace Characters
properties.description:
Detects exploitation of LNK file command-line length discrepancy, where attackers hide malicious commands beyond the 260-character UI limit while the actual command-line argument field supports 4096 characters using whitespace padding (e.g., 0x20, 0x09-0x0D).
Adversaries insert non-printable whitespace characters (e.g., Line Feed \x0A, Carriage Return \x0D) to pad the visible section of the LNK file, pushing malicious commands past the UI-visible boundary.
The hidden payload, executed at runtime but invisible in Windows Explorer properties, enables stealthy execution and evasioncommonly used for social engineering attacks.
This rule flags suspicious use of such padding observed in real-world attacks.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Csi.exe Usage
properties.description: Csi.exe is a signed binary from Microsoft that comes with Visual Studio and provides C# interactive capabilities. It can be used to run C# code from a file passed as a parameter in command line. Early version of this utility provided with Microsoft Roslyn Community Technology Preview was named 'rcsi.exe'
properties.author: Konstantin Grishchenko, oscd.community

properties.name: Taskkill Symantec Endpoint Protection
properties.description:
Detects one of the possible scenarios for disabling Symantec Endpoint Protection.
Symantec Endpoint Protection antivirus software services incorrectly implement the protected service mechanism.
As a result, the NT AUTHORITY/SYSTEM user can execute the taskkill /im command several times ccSvcHst.exe /f, thereby killing the process belonging to the service, and thus shutting down the service.
properties.author: Ilya Krestinichev, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Cabinet File Execution Via Msdt.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of msdt.exe using the "cab" flag which could indicates suspicious diagcab files with embedded answer files leveraging CVE-2022-30190
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), GossiTheDog, frack113

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Exchange PowerShell Snap-Ins Usage
properties.description: Detects adding and using Exchange PowerShell snap-ins to export mailbox data. As seen used by HAFNIUM and APT27
properties.author: FPT.EagleEye, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Potential Impacket Lateral Movement Activity
properties.description: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework
properties.author: Ecco, oscd.community, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Tim Rauch

properties.name: Potential RDP Tunneling Via Plink
properties.description: Execution of plink to perform data exfiltration and tunneling
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: MMC Executing Files with Reversed Extensions Using RTLO Abuse
properties.description: Detects malicious behavior where the MMC utility (`mmc.exe`) executes files with reversed extensions caused by Right-to-Left Override (RLO) abuse, disguising them as document formats.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 2
properties.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
properties.author: @Kostastsale, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: Suspicious Key Manager Access
properties.description: Detects the invocation of the Stored User Names and Passwords dialogue (Key Manager)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Download From File-Sharing Website Via Bitsadmin
properties.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file from a suspicious domain
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: RDP Connection Allowed Via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of the netsh command to open and allow connections to port 3389 (RDP). As seen used by Sarwent Malware
properties.author: Sander Wiebing

properties.name: Execution Of Non-Existing File
properties.description: Checks whether the image specified in a process creation event is not a full, absolute path (caused by process ghosting or other unorthodox methods to start a process)
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Defender Context Menu Removed
properties.description:
Detects the use of reg.exe or PowerShell to delete the Windows Defender context menu handler registry keys.
This action removes the "Scan with Microsoft Defender" option from the right-click menu for files, directories, and drives.
Attackers may use this technique to hinder manual, on-demand scans and reduce the visibility of the security product.
properties.author: Matt Anderson (Huntress)

properties.name: Uncommon System Information Discovery Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the use of the WMI command-line (WMIC) utility to identify and display various system information,
including OS, CPU, GPU, and disk drive names; memory capacity; display resolution; and baseboard, BIOS,
and GPU driver products/versions.
Some of these commands were used by Aurora Stealer in late 2022/early 2023.
properties.author: TropChaud

properties.name: Arbitrary File Download Via Squirrel.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of the "Squirrel.exe" to download arbitrary files. This binary is part of multiple Electron based software installations (Slack, Teams, Discord, etc.)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Karneades / Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Certificate Exported Via Certutil.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of the certutil with the "exportPFX" flag which allows the utility to export certificates.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Windows Credential Editor (WCE) Execution
properties.description:
Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE), a popular post-exploitation tool used to extract plaintext passwords, hash, PIN code and Kerberos tickets from memory.
It is often used by threat actors for credential dumping and lateral movement within compromised networks.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Service Creation Using Sc.EXE
properties.description: Detects the creation of a new service using the "sc.exe" utility.
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of VsCode
properties.description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes spawning from a VsCode "code.exe" process. This could indicate an attempt of persistence via VsCode tasks or terminal profiles.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Where Execution
properties.description:
Adversaries may enumerate browser bookmarks to learn more about compromised hosts.
Browser bookmarks may reveal personal information about users (ex: banking sites, interests, social media, etc.) as well as details about
internal network resources such as servers, tools/dashboards, or other related infrastructure.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - AdFind Suspicious Execution
properties.description: Detects AdFind execution with common flags seen used during attacks
properties.author: Janantha Marasinghe (https://github.com/blueteam0ps), FPT.EagleEye Team, omkar72, oscd.community

properties.name: PowerShell Web Access Feature Enabled Via DISM
properties.description: Detects the use of DISM to enable the PowerShell Web Access feature, which could be used for remote access and potential abuse
properties.author: Michael Haag

properties.name: RemoteFXvGPUDisablement Abuse Via AtomicTestHarnesses
properties.description: Detects calls to the AtomicTestHarnesses "Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand" which is designed to abuse the "RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe" binary to run custom PowerShell code via module load-order hijacking.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Base64 Encoded FromBase64String Cmdlet
properties.description: Detects usage of a base64 encoded "FromBase64String" cmdlet in a process command line
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - RemoteKrbRelay Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of RemoteKrbRelay, a Kerberos relaying tool via CommandLine flags and PE metadata.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Autorun Registry Modified via WMI
properties.description: Detects suspicious activity where the WMIC process is used to create an autorun registry entry via reg.exe, which is often indicative of persistence mechanisms employed by malware.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Advanced IP Scanner Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of Advanced IP Scanner. Seems to be a popular tool for ransomware groups.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), @ROxPinTeddy

properties.name: Scheduled Task Creation Masquerading as System Processes
properties.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involve system processes, which may indicate malicious actors masquerading as or abusing these processes to execute payloads or maintain persistence.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Use NTFS Short Name in Command Line
properties.description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid command-line detection
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious X509Enrollment - Process Creation
properties.description: Detect use of X509Enrollment
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Harvesting Of Wifi Credentials Via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Detect the harvesting of wifi credentials using netsh.exe
properties.author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades), oscd.community

properties.name: Whoami.EXE Execution With Output Option
properties.description: Detects the execution of "whoami.exe" with the "/FO" flag to choose CSV as output format or with redirection options to export the results to a file for later use.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Program Location Whitelisted In Firewall Via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Detects Netsh command execution that whitelists a program located in a suspicious location in the Windows Firewall
properties.author: Sander Wiebing, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: Change Default File Association To Executable Via Assoc
properties.description:
Detects when a program changes the default file association of any extension to an executable.
When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Malicious Windows Script Components File Execution by TAEF Detection
properties.description:
Windows Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) framework allows you to run automation by executing tests files written on different languages (C, C#, Microsoft COM Scripting interfaces
Adversaries may execute malicious code (such as WSC file with VBScript, dll and so on) directly by running te.exe
properties.author: Agro (@agro_sev) oscd.community

properties.name: Boot Configuration Tampering Via Bcdedit.EXE
properties.description: Detects the use of the bcdedit command to tamper with the boot configuration data. This technique is often times used by malware or attackers as a destructive way before launching ransomware.
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

properties.name: DriverQuery.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detect usage of the "driverquery" utility. Which can be used to perform reconnaissance on installed drivers
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Lolbin Unregmp2.exe Use As Proxy
properties.description: Detect usage of the "unregmp2.exe" binary as a proxy to launch a custom version of "wmpnscfg.exe"
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Security Tools Keyword Lookup Via Findstr.EXE
properties.description:
Detects execution of "findstr" to search for common names of security tools. Attackers often pipe the results of recon commands such as "tasklist" or "whoami" to "findstr" in order to filter out the results.
This detection focuses on the keywords that the attacker might use as a filter.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using MSConfig Token Modification - Process
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a msconfig GUI hack (UACMe 55)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Tampering With Security Products Via WMIC
properties.description: Detects uninstallation or termination of security products using the WMIC utility
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Execution Of Regasm/Regsvcs With Uncommon Extension
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious execution of the Regasm/Regsvcs utilities with an uncommon extension.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WebDav Client Execution Via Rundll32.EXE
properties.description:
Detects "svchost.exe" spawning "rundll32.exe" with command arguments like "C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie".
This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on a WebDav server).
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Suspicious BitLocker Access Agent Update Utility Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of the BitLocker Access Agent Update Utility (baaupdate.exe) which is not a common parent process for other processes.
Suspicious child processes spawned by baaupdate.exe could indicate an attempt at lateral movement via BitLocker DCOM & COM Hijacking.
properties.author: andrewdanis, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Deletion Via Del
properties.description:
Detects execution of the builtin "del"/"erase" commands in order to delete files.
Adversaries may delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity.
Malware, tools, or other non-native files dropped or created on a system by an adversary may leave traces to indicate to what was done within a network and how.
Removal of these files can occur during an intrusion, or as part of a post-intrusion process to minimize the adversary's footprint.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - Process
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Velociraptor Child Process
properties.description: Detects the suspicious use of the Velociraptor DFIR tool to execute other tools or download additional payloads, as seen in a campaign where it was abused for remote access and to stage further attacks.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Discovery Activity Via Dnscmd.EXE
properties.description: Detects an attempt to leverage dnscmd.exe to enumerate the DNS zones of a domain. DNS zones used to host the DNS records for a particular domain.
properties.author: @gott_cyber

properties.name: Sdiagnhost Calling Suspicious Child Process
properties.description: Detects sdiagnhost.exe calling a suspicious child process (e.g. used in exploits for Follina / CVE-2022-30190)
properties.author: Nextron Systems, @Kostastsale

properties.name: HackTool - winPEAS Execution
properties.description: WinPEAS is a script that search for possible paths to escalate privileges on Windows hosts. The checks are explained on book.hacktricks.xyz
properties.author: Georg Lauenstein (sure[secure])

properties.name: Hacktool Execution - PE Metadata
properties.description: Detects the execution of different Windows based hacktools via PE metadata (company, product, etc.) even if the files have been renamed
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: JScript Compiler Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of the "jsc.exe" (JScript Compiler).
Attacker might abuse this in order to compile JScript files on the fly and bypassing application whitelisting.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session Detection
properties.description:
This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqltoolsps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the Microsoft SQL Server Management studio.
Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.
properties.author: Agro (@agro_sev) oscd.communitly

properties.name: HackTool - SharpLdapWhoami Execution
properties.description: Detects SharpLdapWhoami, a whoami alternative that queries the LDAP service on a domain controller
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Arbitrary File Download Via MSPUB.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of "MSPUB" (Microsoft Publisher) to download arbitrary files
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - SoftPerfect Netscan Execution
properties.description:
Detects usage of SoftPerfect's "netscan.exe". An application for scanning networks.
It is actively used in-the-wild by threat actors to inspect and understand the network architecture of a victim.
properties.author: @d4ns4n_ (Wuerth-Phoenix)

properties.name: HackTool - CrackMapExec PowerShell Obfuscation
properties.description: The CrachMapExec pentesting framework implements a PowerShell obfuscation with some static strings detected by this rule.
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: New Root Certificate Installed Via Certutil.EXE
properties.description:
Detects execution of "certutil" with the "addstore" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system.
Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.
properties.author: oscd.community, @redcanary, Zach Stanford @svch0st

properties.name: Renamed Jusched.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "jusched.exe" as seen used by the cobalt group
properties.author: Markus Neis, Swisscom

properties.name: Suspicious Execution of Hostname
properties.description: Use of hostname to get information
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Audit Policy Tampering Via Auditpol
properties.description:
Threat actors can use auditpol binary to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability.
This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.
properties.author: Janantha Marasinghe (https://github.com/blueteam0ps)

properties.name: Windows Recovery Environment Disabled Via Reagentc
properties.description:
Detects attempts to disable windows recovery environment using Reagentc.
ReAgentc.exe is a command-line tool in Windows used to manage the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE).
It allows users to enable, disable, and configure WinRE, which is used for troubleshooting and repairing common boot issues.
properties.author: Daniel Koifman (KoifSec), Michael Vilshin

properties.name: Abuse of Service Permissions to Hide Services Via Set-Service
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Set-Service" powershell cmdlet to configure a new SecurityDescriptor that allows a service to be hidden from other utilities such as "sc.exe", "Get-Service"...etc. (Works only in powershell 7)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disabled Volume Snapshots
properties.description: Detects commands that temporarily turn off Volume Snapshots
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Reg Add BitLocker
properties.description: Detects suspicious addition to BitLocker related registry keys via the reg.exe utility
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Uncommon Child Process Spawned By Odbcconf.EXE
properties.description: Detects an uncommon child process of "odbcconf.exe" binary which normally shouldn't have any child processes.
properties.author: Harjot Singh @cyb3rjy0t

properties.name: Disabled IE Security Features
properties.description: Detects command lines that indicate unwanted modifications to registry keys that disable important Internet Explorer security features
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Certify Execution
properties.description: Detects Certify a tool for Active Directory certificate abuse based on PE metadata characteristics and common command line arguments.
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Manipulation Of Default Accounts Via Net.EXE
properties.description: Detects suspicious manipulations of default accounts such as 'administrator' and 'guest'. For example 'enable' or 'disable' accounts or change the password...etc
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Filter Driver Unloaded Via Fltmc.EXE
properties.description: Detect filter driver unloading activity via fltmc.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Powershell Executed From Headless ConHost Process
properties.description:
Detects the use of powershell commands from headless ConHost window.
The "--headless" flag hides the windows from the user upon execution.
properties.author: Matt Anderson (Huntress)

properties.name: Gzip Archive Decode Via PowerShell
properties.description: Detects attempts of decoding encoded Gzip archives via PowerShell.
properties.author: Hieu Tran

properties.name: WSL Kali-Linux Usage
properties.description: Detects the use of Kali Linux through Windows Subsystem for Linux
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious WindowsTerminal Child Processes
properties.description: Detects suspicious children spawned via the Windows Terminal application which could be a sign of persistence via WindowsTerminal (see references section)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WMI Backdoor Exchange Transport Agent
properties.description: Detects a WMI backdoor in Exchange Transport Agents via WMI event filters
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: System Information Discovery via Registry Queries
properties.description: Detects attempts to query system information directly from the Windows Registry.
properties.author: lazarg

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Netsh Helper DLL
properties.description: Detects the execution of netsh with "add helper" flag in order to add a custom helper DLL. This technique can be abused to add a malicious helper DLL that can be used as a persistence proxy that gets called when netsh.exe is executed.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious File Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64 where the extensions of the file is suspicious
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Silent Installation
properties.description: Detects AnyDesk Remote Desktop silent installation. Which can be used by attackers to gain remote access.
properties.author: Jn Trenansk

properties.name: Service DACL Abuse To Hide Services Via Sc.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of the "sc.exe" utility adding a new service with special permission seen used by threat actors which makes the service hidden and unremovable.
properties.author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)

properties.name: Regsvr32 DLL Execution With Suspicious File Extension
properties.description: Detects the execution of REGSVR32.exe with DLL files masquerading as other files
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Installation Execution
properties.description: Detects ScreenConnect program starts that establish a remote access to a system.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation Involving Temp Folder
properties.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involves a temporary folder and runs only once
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Process Memory Dump via RdrLeakDiag.EXE
properties.description: Detects the use of the Microsoft Windows Resource Leak Diagnostic tool "rdrleakdiag.exe" to dump process memory
properties.author: Cedric MAURUGEON, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Parent Double Extension File Execution
properties.description: Detect execution of suspicious double extension files in ParentCommandLine
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Base64 MZ Header In CommandLine
properties.description: Detects encoded base64 MZ header in the commandline
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - ADCSPwn Execution
properties.description: Detects command line parameters used by ADCSPwn, a tool to escalate privileges in an active directory network by coercing authenticate from machine accounts and relaying to the certificate service
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious RDP Redirect Using TSCON
properties.description: Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SharpMove Tool Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of SharpMove, a .NET utility performing multiple tasks such as "Task Creation", "SCM" query, VBScript execution using WMI via its PE metadata and command line options.
properties.author: Luca Di Bartolomeo (CrimpSec)

properties.name: Arbitrary File Download Via PresentationHost.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of "PresentationHost" which is a utility that runs ".xbap" (Browser Applications) files to download arbitrary files
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Mstsc.EXE Execution With Local RDP File
properties.description: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Christopher Peacock @securepeacock

properties.name: Potential Binary Proxy Execution Via VSDiagnostics.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "VSDiagnostics.exe" with the "start" command in order to launch and proxy arbitrary binaries.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Seatbelt Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the PUA/Recon tool Seatbelt via PE information of command line parameters
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: VolumeShadowCopy Symlink Creation Via Mklink
properties.description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Potential WMI Lateral Movement WmiPrvSE Spawned PowerShell
properties.description: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.
properties.author: Markus Neis @Karneades

properties.name: Visual Basic Command Line Compiler Usage
properties.description: Detects successful code compilation via Visual Basic Command Line Compiler that utilizes Windows Resource to Object Converter.
properties.author: Ensar amil, @sblmsrsn, @oscd_initiative

properties.name: Start of NT Virtual DOS Machine
properties.description: Ntvdm.exe allows the execution of 16-bit Windows applications on 32-bit Windows operating systems, as well as the execution of both 16-bit and 32-bit DOS applications
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Odbcconf.EXE Suspicious DLL Location
properties.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" where the path of the DLL being registered is located in a potentially suspicious location.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DLL Execution Via Register-cimprovider.exe
properties.description: Detects using register-cimprovider.exe to execute arbitrary dll file.
properties.author: Ivan Dyachkov, Yulia Fomina, oscd.community

properties.name: Rundll32 Execution With Uncommon DLL Extension
properties.description: Detects the execution of rundll32 with a command line that doesn't contain a common extension
properties.author: Tim Shelton, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Yassine Oukessou

properties.name: PUA - Ngrok Execution
properties.description:
Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available.
Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: BitLockerTogo.EXE Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of "BitLockerToGo.EXE".
BitLocker To Go is BitLocker Drive Encryption on removable data drives. This feature includes the encryption of, USB flash drives, SD cards, External hard disk drives, Other drives that are formatted by using the NTFS, FAT16, FAT32, or exFAT file system.
This is a rarely used application and usage of it at all is worth investigating.
Malware such as Lumma stealer has been seen using this process as a target for process hollowing.
properties.author: Josh Nickels, mttaggart

properties.name: Sysinternals PsService Execution
properties.description: Detects usage of Sysinternals PsService which can be abused for service reconnaissance and tampering
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Malicious PowerShell Commandlets - ProcessCreation
properties.description: Detects Commandlet names from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious CertReq Command to Download
properties.description:
Detects a suspicious CertReq execution downloading a file.
This behavior is often used by attackers to download additional payloads or configuration files.
Certreq is a built-in Windows utility used to request and retrieve certificates from a certification authority (CA). However, it can be abused by threat actors for malicious purposes.
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious CustomShellHost Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of CustomShellHost.exe where the child isn't located in 'C:\Windows\explorer.exe'. CustomShellHost is a known LOLBin that can be abused by attackers for defense evasion techniques.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass via Windows Firewall Snap-In Hijack
properties.description: Detects attempts to bypass User Account Control (UAC) by hijacking the Microsoft Management Console (MMC) Windows Firewall snap-in
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Potential ReflectDebugger Content Execution Via WerFault.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "WerFault.exe" with the "-pr" commandline flag that is used to run files stored in the ReflectDebugger key which could be used to store the path to the malware in order to masquerade the execution flow
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential MSTSC Shadowing Activity
properties.description: Detects RDP session hijacking by using MSTSC shadowing
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Execution
properties.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook a automated breach emulations utility
properties.author: Alexander Rausch

properties.name: Process Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of "wmic" with the "process" flag, which adversary might use to list processes running on the compromised host or list installed software hotfixes and patches.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Folder Compress To Potentially Suspicious Output Via Compress-Archive Cmdlet
properties.description:
Detects PowerShell scripts that make use of the "Compress-Archive" Cmdlet in order to compress folders and files where the output is stored in a potentially suspicious location that is used often by malware for exfiltration.
An adversary might compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Suspicious DumpMinitool Execution
properties.description: Detects suspicious ways to use the "DumpMinitool.exe" binary
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Audit Policy Tampering Via NT Resource Kit Auditpol
properties.description:
Threat actors can use an older version of the auditpol binary available inside the NT resource kit to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability.
This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Visual Studio Code Tunnel Service Installation
properties.description: Detects the installation of VsCode tunnel (code-tunnel) as a service.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Regsvr32 HTTP IP Pattern
properties.description: Detects regsvr32 execution to download and install DLLs located remotely where the address is an IP address.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Execution via stordiag.exe
properties.description: Detects the use of stordiag.exe to execute schtasks.exe systeminfo.exe and fltmc.exe
properties.author: Austin Songer (@austinsonger)

properties.name: Imports Registry Key From an ADS
properties.description: Detects the import of a alternate datastream to the registry with regedit.exe.
properties.author: Oddvar Moe, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community

properties.name: ConvertTo-SecureString Cmdlet Usage Via CommandLine
properties.description: Detects usage of the "ConvertTo-SecureString" cmdlet via the commandline. Which is fairly uncommon and could indicate potential suspicious activity
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

properties.name: Suspicious Execution of Shutdown
properties.description: Use of the commandline to shutdown or reboot windows
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Get-Clipboard Cmdlet Via CLI
properties.description: Detects usage of the 'Get-Clipboard' cmdlet via CLI
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remotely Hosted HTA File Executed Via Mshta.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of the "mshta" utility with an argument containing the "http" keyword, which could indicate that an attacker is executing a remotely hosted malicious hta file
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Sigverif.EXE Child Process
properties.description: Detects uncommon child processes spawning from "sigverif.exe", which could indicate potential abuse of the latter as a living of the land binary in order to proxy execution.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Decoded From Base64/Hex Via Certutil.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of certutil with either the "decode" or "decodehex" flags to decode base64 or hex encoded files. This can be abused by attackers to decode an encoded payload before execution
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Potential Obfuscated Ordinal Call Via Rundll32
properties.description: Detects execution of "rundll32" with potential obfuscated ordinal calls
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Hotfix Updates Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of wmic with the "qfe" flag in order to obtain information about installed hotfix updates on the system. This is often used by pentester and attacker enumeration scripts
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - CoercedPotato Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of CoercedPotato, a tool for privilege escalation
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Nmap/Zenmap Execution
properties.description: Detects usage of namp/zenmap. Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts, including those that may be vulnerable to remote software exploitation
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Response File Execution Via Odbcconf.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "-f" flag in order to load a response file with a non-".rsp" extension.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Chromium Browser Instance Executed With Custom Extension
properties.description: Detects a Chromium based browser process with the 'load-extension' flag to start a instance with a custom extension
properties.author: Aedan Russell, frack113, X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Defense Evasion Via Binary Rename
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.
properties.author: Matthew Green @mgreen27, Ecco, James Pemberton @4A616D6573, oscd.community, Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)

properties.name: Enumeration for 3rd Party Creds From CLI
properties.description: Detects processes that query known 3rd party registry keys that holds credentials via commandline
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Downloaded From Direct IP Via Certutil.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files from direct IPs.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Procdump Execution
properties.description: Detects usage of the SysInternals Procdump utility
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Share And Session Enumeration Using Net.EXE
properties.description: Detects attempts to enumerate file shares, printer shares and sessions using "net.exe" with the "view" flag.
properties.author: Endgame, JHasenbusch (ported for oscd.community)

properties.name: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 4
properties.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
properties.author: @Kostastsale, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: Suspicious FileFix Execution Pattern
properties.description:
Detects suspicious FileFix execution patterns where users are tricked into running malicious commands through browser file upload dialog manipulation.
This attack typically begins when users visit malicious websites impersonating legitimate services or news platforms,
which may display fake CAPTCHA challenges or direct instructions to open file explorer and paste clipboard content.
The clipboard content usually contains commands that download and execute malware, such as information stealing tools.
properties.author: 0xFustang, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Local Accounts Discovery
properties.description: Local accounts, System Owner/User discovery using operating systems utilities
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious WmiPrvSE Child Process
properties.description: Detects suspicious and uncommon child processes of WmiPrvSE
properties.author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: HackTool - Empire PowerShell Launch Parameters
properties.description: Detects suspicious powershell command line parameters used in Empire
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Execution Of Regasm/Regsvcs From Uncommon Location
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious execution of the Regasm/Regsvcs utilities from a potentially suspicious location
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Email Exifiltration Via Powershell
properties.description: Detects email exfiltration via powershell cmdlets
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems),  Azure-Sentinel (idea)

properties.name: Suspicious Extrac32 Alternate Data Stream Execution
properties.description: Extract data from cab file and hide it in an alternate data stream
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Use Short Name Path in Image
properties.description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid Image detection
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Potential Command Line Path Traversal Evasion Attempt
properties.description: Detects potential evasion or obfuscation attempts using bogus path traversal via the commandline
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Advpack Call Via Rundll32.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "rundll32" calling "advpack.dll" with potential obfuscated ordinal calls in order to leverage the "RegisterOCX" function
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SILENTTRINITY Stager Execution
properties.description: Detects SILENTTRINITY stager use via PE metadata
properties.author: Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Execution With Known Revoked Signing Certificate
properties.description:
Detects the execution of an AnyDesk binary with a version prior to 8.0.8.
Prior to version 8.0.8, the Anydesk application used a signing certificate that got compromised by threat actors.
Use this rule to detect instances of older versions of Anydesk using the compromised certificate
This is recommended in order to avoid attackers leveraging the certificate and signing their binaries to bypass detections.
properties.author: Sai Prashanth Pulisetti, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Root Certificate Installed From Susp Locations
properties.description: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Exports Critical Registry Keys To a File
properties.description: Detects the export of a crital Registry key to a file.
properties.author: Oddvar Moe, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community

properties.name: Rundll32 Execution Without Parameters
properties.description: Detects rundll32 execution without parameters as observed when running Metasploit windows/smb/psexec exploit module
properties.author: Bartlomiej Czyz, Relativity

properties.name: Curl Web Request With Potential Custom User-Agent
properties.description: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with a potential custom "User-Agent". Attackers can leverage this to download or exfiltrate data via "curl" to a domain that only accept specific "User-Agent" strings
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - F-Secure C3 Load by Rundll32
properties.description: F-Secure C3 produces DLLs with a default exported StartNodeRelay function.
properties.author: Alfie Champion (ajpc500)

properties.name: File Encryption/Decryption Via Gpg4win From Suspicious Locations
properties.description: Detects usage of Gpg4win to encrypt/decrypt files located in potentially suspicious locations.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Register_App.Vbs LOLScript Abuse
properties.description: Detects potential abuse of the "register_app.vbs" script that is part of the Windows SDK. The script offers the capability to register new VSS/VDS Provider as a COM+ application. Attackers can use this to install malicious DLLs for persistence and execution.
properties.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger

properties.name: HackTool - KrbRelayUp Execution
properties.description: Detects KrbRelayUp used to perform a universal no-fix local privilege escalation in Windows domain environments where LDAP signing is not enforced
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Hacktool Execution - Imphash
properties.description: Detects the execution of different Windows based hacktools via their import hash (imphash) even if the files have been renamed
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Unusual Child Process of dns.exe
properties.description: Detects an unexpected process spawning from dns.exe which may indicate activity related to remote code execution or other forms of exploitation as seen in CVE-2020-1350 (SigRed)
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: LOLBAS Data Exfiltration by DataSvcUtil.exe
properties.description: Detects when a user performs data exfiltration by using DataSvcUtil.exe
properties.author: Ialle Teixeira @teixeira0xfffff, Austin Songer @austinsonger

properties.name: Potential File Download Via MS-AppInstaller Protocol Handler
properties.description:
Detects usage of the "ms-appinstaller" protocol handler via command line to potentially download arbitrary files via AppInstaller.EXE
The downloaded files are temporarly stored in ":\Users\%username%\AppData\Local\Packages\Microsoft.DesktopAppInstaller_8wekyb3d8bbwe\AC\INetCache\<RANDOM-8-CHAR-DIRECTORY>"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: New Virtual Smart Card Created Via TpmVscMgr.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "Tpmvscmgr.exe" to create a new virtual smart card.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Curl Download And Execute Combination
properties.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.
properties.author: Sreeman, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Password Set to Never Expire via WMI
properties.description: Detects the use of wmic.exe to modify user account settings and explicitly disable password expiration.
properties.author: Daniel Koifman (KoifSec)

properties.name: Application Removed Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects the removal or uninstallation of an application via "Wmic.EXE".
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Discovery of a System Time
properties.description: Identifies use of various commands to query a systems time. This technique may be used before executing a scheduled task or to discover the time zone of a target system.
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

properties.name: Cmd.EXE Missing Space Characters Execution Anomaly
properties.description:
Detects Windows command lines that miss a space before or after the /c flag when running a command using the cmd.exe.
This could be a sign of obfuscation of a fat finger problem (typo by the developer).
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using Consent and Comctl32 - Process
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using consent.exe and comctl32.dll (UACMe 22)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious JavaScript Execution Via Mshta.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of javascript code using "mshta.exe".
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

properties.name: Finger.EXE Execution
properties.description:
Detects execution of the "finger.exe" utility.
Finger.EXE or "TCPIP Finger Command" is an old utility that is still present on modern Windows installation. It Displays information about users on a specified remote computer (typically a UNIX computer) that is running the finger service or daemon.
Due to the old nature of this utility and the rareness of machines having the finger service. Any execution of "finger.exe" can be considered "suspicious" and worth investigating.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), omkar72, oscd.community

properties.name: PowerShell Execution With Potential Decryption Capabilities
properties.description: Detects PowerShell commands that decrypt an ".LNK" "file to drop the next stage of the malware.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Powershell Defender Disable Scan Feature
properties.description: Detects requests to disable Microsoft Defender features using PowerShell commands
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console
properties.description: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell
properties.author: Michael R. (@nahamike01)

properties.name: Potential SMB Relay Attack Tool Execution
properties.description: Detects different hacktools used for relay attacks on Windows for privilege escalation
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uninstall Sysinternals Sysmon
properties.description: Detects the removal of Sysmon, which could be a potential attempt at defense evasion
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: File Download From IP URL Via Curl.EXE
properties.description: Detects file downloads directly from IP address URL using curl.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New DLL Registered Via Odbcconf.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with "REGSVR" in order to register a new DLL (equivalent to running regsvr32). Attackers abuse this to install and run malicious DLLs.
properties.author: Kirill Kiryanov, Beyu Denis, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Binary Executed From WSL
properties.description:
Detects the execution of Windows binaries from within a WSL instance.
This could be used to masquerade parent-child relationships
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Child Process Of BgInfo.EXE
properties.description: Detects uncommon child processes of "BgInfo.exe" which could be a sign of potential abuse of the binary to proxy execution via external VBScript
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Beyu Denis, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious ZipExec Execution
properties.description: ZipExec is a Proof-of-Concept (POC) tool to wrap binary-based tools into a password-protected zip file.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Electron Application CommandLine
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious CommandLine of electron apps (teams, discord, slack, etc.). This could be a sign of abuse to proxy execution through a signed binary.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Wusa.EXE Executed By Parent Process Located In Suspicious Location
properties.description:
Detects execution of the "wusa.exe" (Windows Update Standalone Installer) utility by a parent process that is located in a suspicious location.
Attackers could instantiate an instance of "wusa.exe" in order to bypass User Account Control (UAC). They can duplicate the access token from "wusa.exe" to gain elevated privileges.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Shim Database Persistence via Sdbinst.EXE
properties.description:
Detects installation of a new shim using sdbinst.exe.
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims
properties.author: Markus Neis

properties.name: Potential Privilege Escalation via Service Permissions Weakness
properties.description: Detect modification of services configuration (ImagePath, FailureCommand and ServiceDLL) in registry by processes with Medium integrity level
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov

properties.name: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity Using Get-LocalGroupMember Cmdlet
properties.description: Detects suspicious reconnaissance command line activity on Windows systems using the PowerShell Get-LocalGroupMember Cmdlet
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious SYSTEM User Process Creation
properties.description: Detects a suspicious process creation as SYSTEM user (suspicious program or command line parameter)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), David ANDRE (additional keywords)

properties.name: Perl Inline Command Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of perl using the "-e"/"-E" flags. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live perl code.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Schedule Task Creation From Env Variable Or Potentially Suspicious Path Via Schtasks.EXE
properties.description: Detects Schtask creations that point to a suspicious folder or an environment variable often used by malware
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
