properties.name: Suspicious Invoke-WebRequest Execution
properties.description: Detects a suspicious call to Invoke-WebRequest cmdlet where the and output is located in a suspicious location
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64. This can be abused by threat actors and attackers for data exfiltration
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious ShellExec_RunDLL Call Via Ordinal
properties.description:
Detects suspicious call to the "ShellExec_RunDLL" exported function of SHELL32.DLL through the ordinal number to launch other commands.
Adversary might only use the ordinal number in order to bypass existing detection that alert on usage of ShellExec_RunDLL on CommandLine.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: PUA - DIT Snapshot Viewer
properties.description: Detects the use of Ditsnap tool, an inspection tool for Active Directory database, ntds.dit.
properties.author: Furkan Caliskan (@caliskanfurkan_)

properties.name: Indirect Inline Command Execution Via Bash.EXE
properties.description:
Detects execution of Microsoft bash launcher with the "-c" flag.
This can be used to potentially bypass defenses and execute Linux or Windows-based binaries directly via bash.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Always Install Elevated Windows Installer
properties.description: Detects Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) trying to install MSI packages with SYSTEM privilege
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Mangatas Tondang (rule), oscd.community

properties.name: Copy From Or To Admin Share Or Sysvol Folder
properties.description: Detects a copy command or a copy utility execution to or from an Admin share or remote
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Teymur Kheirkhabarov @HeirhabarovT, Zach Stanford @svch0st, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Suspicious Usage of For Loop with Recursive Directory Search in CMD
properties.description:
Detects suspicious usage of the cmd.exe 'for /f' loop combined with the 'tokens=' parameter and a recursive directory listing.
This pattern may indicate an attempt to discover and execute system binaries dynamically, for example powershell, a technique sometimes used by attackers to evade detection.
This behavior has been observed in various malicious lnk files.
properties.author: Joseliyo Sanchez, @Joseliyo_Jstnk

properties.name: PrintBrm ZIP Creation of Extraction
properties.description: Detects the execution of the LOLBIN PrintBrm.exe, which can be used to create or extract ZIP files. PrintBrm.exe should not be run on a normal workstation.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: RDP Enable or Disable via Win32_TerminalServiceSetting WMI Class
properties.description:
Detects enabling or disabling of Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) using alternate methods such as WMIC or PowerShell.
In PowerShell one-liner commands, the "SetAllowTSConnections" method of the "Win32_TerminalServiceSetting" class may be used to enable or disable RDP.
In WMIC, the "rdtoggle" alias or "Win32_TerminalServiceSetting" class may be used for the same purpose.
properties.author: Daniel Koifman (KoifSec), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Download Via Certutil.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: InfDefaultInstall.exe .inf Execution
properties.description: Executes SCT script using scrobj.dll from a command in entered into a specially prepared INF file.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: OneNote.EXE Execution of Malicious Embedded Scripts
properties.description:
Detects the execution of malicious OneNote documents that contain embedded scripts.
When a user clicks on a OneNote attachment and then on the malicious link inside the ".one" file, it exports and executes the malicious embedded script from specific directories.
properties.author: @kostastsale

properties.name: Renamed MegaSync Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed MegaSync.exe as seen used by ransomware families like Nefilim, Sodinokibi, Pysa, and Conti.
properties.author: Sittikorn S

properties.name: Potential SquiblyTwo Technique Execution
properties.description: Detects potential SquiblyTwo attack technique with possible renamed WMIC via Imphash and OriginalFileName fields
properties.author: Markus Neis, Florian Roth

properties.name: PUA - Mouse Lock Execution
properties.description: In Kaspersky's 2020 Incident Response Analyst Report they listed legitimate tool "Mouse Lock" as being used for both credential access and collection in security incidents.
properties.author: Cian Heasley

properties.name: Windows Share Mount Via Net.EXE
properties.description: Detects when a share is mounted using the "net.exe" utility
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote File Download Via Findstr.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "findstr" with specific flags and a remote share path. This specific set of CLI flags would allow "findstr" to download the content of the file located on the remote share as described in the LOLBAS entry.
properties.author: Furkan CALISKAN, @caliskanfurkan_, @oscd_initiative, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Credential Dumping Via LSASS Process Clone
properties.description: Detects a suspicious LSASS process process clone that could be a sign of credential dumping activity
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: Nslookup PowerShell Download Cradle - ProcessCreation
properties.description: Detects suspicious powershell download cradle using nslookup. This cradle uses nslookup to extract payloads from DNS records
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Ping/Copy Command Combination
properties.description: Detects uncommon and potentially suspicious one-liner command containing both "ping" and "copy" at the same time, which is usually used by malware.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Arbitrary Shell Command Execution Via Settingcontent-Ms
properties.description: The .SettingContent-ms file type was introduced in Windows 10 and allows a user to create "shortcuts" to various Windows 10 setting pages. These files are simply XML and contain paths to various Windows 10 settings binaries.
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: ETW Logging Tamper In .NET Processes Via CommandLine
properties.description:
Detects changes to environment variables related to ETW logging via the CommandLine.
This could indicate potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: DllUnregisterServer Function Call Via Msiexec.EXE
properties.description: Detects MsiExec loading a DLL and calling its DllUnregisterServer function
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: All Backups Deleted Via Wbadmin.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the deletion of all backups or system state backups via "wbadmin.exe".
This technique is used by numerous ransomware families and actors.
This may only be successful on server platforms that have Windows Backup enabled.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Registry Modification Via Regini.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of regini.exe which can be used to modify registry keys, the changes are imported from one or more text files.
properties.author: Eli Salem, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community

properties.name: File With Suspicious Extension Downloaded Via Bitsadmin
properties.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file with a suspicious extension
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PPL Tampering Via WerFaultSecure
properties.description:
Detects potential abuse of WerFaultSecure.exe to dump Protected Process Light (PPL) processes like LSASS or to freeze security solutions (EDR/antivirus).
This technique is used by tools such as EDR-Freeze and WSASS to bypass PPL protections and access sensitive information or disable security software.
Distinct command line patterns help identify the specific tool:
- WSASS usage typically shows: "WSASS.exe WerFaultSecure.exe [PID]" in ParentCommandLine
- EDR-Freeze usage typically shows: "EDR-Freeze_[version].exe [PID] [timeout]" in ParentCommandLine
Legitimate debugging operations using WerFaultSecure are rare in production environments and should be investigated.
properties.author: Jason (https://github.com/0xbcf)

properties.name: Suspicious DLL Loaded via CertOC.EXE
properties.description: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to load the target DLL file.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Windows Defender Folder Exclusion Added Via Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to add Defender folder exclusions. Qbot has been seen using this technique to add exclusions for folders within AppData and ProgramData.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Mpclient.DLL Sideloading Via OfflineScannerShell.EXE Execution
properties.description:
Detects execution of Windows Defender "OfflineScannerShell.exe" from its non standard directory.
The "OfflineScannerShell.exe" binary is vulnerable to DLL side loading and will load any DLL named "mpclient.dll" from the current working directory.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Computer System Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of wmic utility with the "computersystem" flag in order to obtain information about the machine such as the domain, username, model, etc.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Default PowerSploit/Empire Scheduled Task Creation
properties.description: Detects the creation of a schtask via PowerSploit or Empire Default Configuration.
properties.author: Markus Neis, @Karneades

properties.name: Tamper Windows Defender Remove-MpPreference
properties.description: Detects attempts to remove Windows Defender configurations using the 'MpPreference' cmdlet
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Self Extracting Package Creation Via Iexpress.EXE From Potentially Suspicious Location
properties.description:
Detects the use of iexpress.exe to create binaries via Self Extraction Directive (SED) files located in potentially suspicious locations.
This behavior has been observed in-the-wild by different threat actors.
properties.author: Joseliyo Sanchez, @Joseliyo_Jstnk, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Installation of WSL Kali-Linux
properties.description:
Detects installation of Kali Linux distribution through Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).
Attackers may use Kali Linux WSL to leverage its penetration testing tools and capabilities for malicious purposes.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Diantz Alternate Data Stream Execution
properties.description: Compress target file into a cab file stored in the Alternate Data Stream (ADS) of the target file.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Adplus.EXE Abuse
properties.description: Detects execution of "AdPlus.exe", a binary that is part of the Windows SDK that can be used as a LOLBIN in order to dump process memory and execute arbitrary commands.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Obfuscated PowerShell OneLiner Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a specific OneLiner to download and execute powershell modules in memory.
properties.author: @Kostastsale, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: MSDT Execution Via Answer File
properties.description: Detects execution of "msdt.exe" using an answer file which is simulating the legitimate way of calling msdt via "pcwrun.exe" (For example from the compatibility tab).
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New User Created Via Net.EXE
properties.description: Identifies the creation of local users via the net.exe command.
properties.author: Endgame, JHasenbusch (adapted to Sigma for oscd.community)

properties.name: MMC20 Lateral Movement
properties.description: Detects MMC20.Application Lateral Movement; specifically looks for the spawning of the parent MMC.exe with a command line of "-Embedding" as a child of svchost.exe
properties.author: @2xxeformyshirt (Security Risk Advisors) - rule; Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - NetSupport Execution
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Add Insecure Download Source To Winget
properties.description:
Detects usage of winget to add a new insecure (http) download source.
Winget will not allow the addition of insecure sources, hence this could indicate potential suspicious activity (or typos)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DumpStack.log Defender Evasion
properties.description: Detects the use of the filename DumpStack.log to evade Microsoft Defender
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Deleted Data Overwritten Via Cipher.EXE
properties.description:
Detects usage of the "cipher" built-in utility in order to overwrite deleted data from disk.
Adversaries may destroy data and files on specific systems or in large numbers on a network to interrupt availability to systems, services, and network resources.
Data destruction is likely to render stored data irrecoverable by forensic techniques through overwriting files or data on local and remote drives
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Group And Account Reconnaissance Activity Using Net.EXE
properties.description:
Detects suspicious reconnaissance command line activity on Windows systems using Net.EXE
Check if the user that executed the commands is suspicious (e.g. service accounts, LOCAL_SYSTEM)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), omkar72, @svch0st, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Persistence Via TypedPaths - CommandLine
properties.description: Detects modification addition to the 'TypedPaths' key in the user or admin registry via the commandline. Which might indicate persistence attempt
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of DiskShadow.EXE
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "Diskshadow.exe". This could be an attempt to bypass parent/child relationship detection or application whitelisting rules.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities
properties.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Michael Haag, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community, Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)

properties.name: Potential Binary Impersonating Sysinternals Tools
properties.description:
Detects binaries that use the same name as legitimate sysinternals tools to evade detection.
This rule looks for the execution of binaries that are named similarly to Sysinternals tools.
Adversary may rename their malicious tools as legitimate Sysinternals tools to evade detection.
properties.author: frack113, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - XORDump Execution
properties.description: Detects suspicious use of XORDump process memory dumping utility
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed Remote Utilities RAT (RURAT) Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of renamed Remote Utilities (RURAT) via Product PE header field
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Obfuscated PowerShell MSI Install via WindowsInstaller COM
properties.description:
Detects the execution of obfuscated PowerShell commands that attempt to install MSI packages via the Windows Installer COM object (`WindowsInstaller.Installer`).
The technique involves manipulating strings to hide functionality, such as constructing class names using string insertion (e.g., 'indowsInstaller.Installer'.Insert(0,'W')) and correcting
malformed URLs (e.g., converting 'htps://' to 'https://') at runtime. This behavior is commonly associated with malware loaders or droppers that aim to bypass static detection
by hiding intent in runtime-generated strings and using legitimate tools for code execution. The use of `InstallProduct` and COM object creation, particularly combined with
hidden window execution and suppressed UI, indicates an attempt to install software (likely malicious) without user interaction.
properties.author: Meroujan Antonyan (vx3r)

properties.name: Suspicious Command Patterns In Scheduled Task Creation
properties.description: Detects scheduled task creation using "schtasks" that contain potentially suspicious or uncommon commands
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
properties.description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - TruffleHog Execution
properties.description:
Detects execution of TruffleHog, a tool used to search for secrets in different platforms like Git, Jira, Slack, SharePoint, etc. that could be used maliciously.
While it is a legitimate tool, intended for use in CI pipelines and security assessments,
It was observed in the Shai-Hulud malware campaign targeting npm packages to steal sensitive information.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Download Via Windows Defender MpCmpRun.EXE
properties.description: Detects the use of Windows Defender MpCmdRun.EXE to download files
properties.author: Matthew Matchen

properties.name: Suspicious Program Names
properties.description: Detects suspicious patterns in program names or folders that are often found in malicious samples or hacktools
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Exports Registry Key To a File
properties.description: Detects the export of the target Registry key to a file.
properties.author: Oddvar Moe, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community

properties.name: Potential Renamed Rundll32 Execution
properties.description: Detects when 'DllRegisterServer' is called in the commandline and the image is not rundll32. This could mean that the 'rundll32' utility has been renamed in order to avoid detection
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Execute From Alternate Data Streams
properties.description: Detects execution from an Alternate Data Stream (ADS). Adversaries may use NTFS file attributes to hide their malicious data in order to evade detection
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Assembly Loading Via CL_LoadAssembly.ps1
properties.description: Detects calls to "LoadAssemblyFromPath" or "LoadAssemblyFromNS" that are part of the "CL_LoadAssembly.ps1" script. This can be abused to load different assemblies and bypass App locker controls.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Impersonate Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of the Impersonate tool. Which can be used to manipulate tokens on a Windows computers remotely (PsExec/WmiExec) or interactively
properties.author: Sai Prashanth Pulisetti @pulisettis

properties.name: New Generic Credentials Added Via Cmdkey.EXE
properties.description:
Detects usage of "cmdkey.exe" to add generic credentials.
As an example, this can be used before connecting to an RDP session via command line interface.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed Sysinternals Sdelete Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of a renamed SysInternals Sdelete, which is something an administrator shouldn't do (the renaming)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Execution Location Of Wermgr.EXE
properties.description: Detects suspicious Windows Error Reporting manager (wermgr.exe) execution location.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Extension Shim Database Installation Via Sdbinst.EXE
properties.description:
Detects installation of a potentially suspicious new shim with an uncommon extension using sdbinst.exe.
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - NirCmd Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution, which could be the result of legitimate administrative activity
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: MsiExec Web Install
properties.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addresses as parameter
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PktMon.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of PktMon, a tool that captures network packets.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Hidden Directory Creation Via NTFS INDEX_ALLOCATION Stream - CLI
properties.description: Detects command line containing reference to the "::$index_allocation" stream, which can be used as a technique to prevent access to folders or files from tooling such as "explorer.exe" or "powershell.exe"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Scoubi (@ScoubiMtl)

properties.name: OpenWith.exe Executes Specified Binary
properties.description: The OpenWith.exe executes other binary
properties.author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community (rule), @harr0ey (idea)

properties.name: Disable Important Scheduled Task
properties.description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by disabling their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), X__Junior

properties.name: Kavremover Dropped Binary LOLBIN Usage
properties.description: Detects the execution of a signed binary dropped by Kaspersky Lab Products Remover (kavremover) which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute arbitrary commands and binaries.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Processes Spawned by ConHost
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes related to Windows Shell utilities spawned by `conhost.exe`, which could indicate malicious activity using trusted system components.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Download From IP Via Curl.EXE
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads directly from IP addresses using curl.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Kernel Debugger Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of the Windows Kernel Debugger "kd.exe".
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Processes Spawned by Java.EXE
properties.description: Detects suspicious processes spawned from a Java host process which could indicate a sign of exploitation (e.g. log4j)
properties.author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades), Florian Roth

properties.name: Uncommon  Assistive Technology Applications Execution Via AtBroker.EXE
properties.description: Detects the start of a non built-in assistive technology applications via "Atbroker.EXE".
properties.author: Mateusz Wydra, oscd.community

properties.name: Local Groups Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the execution of "wmic" with the "group" flag.
Adversaries may attempt to find local system groups and permission settings.
The knowledge of local system permission groups can help adversaries determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group.
Adversaries may use this information to determine which users have elevated permissions, such as the users found within the local administrators group.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - SharpLDAPmonitor Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of the SharpLDAPmonitor. Which can monitor the creation, deletion and changes to LDAP objects.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - AdvancedRun Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of AdvancedRun utility
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Process Memory Dump Via Dotnet-Dump
properties.description: Detects the execution of "dotnet-dump" with the "collect" flag. The execution could indicate potential process dumping of critical processes such as LSASS.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Script Execution From Temp Folder
properties.description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

properties.name: HackTool - SharpWSUS/WSUSpendu Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of SharpWSUS or WSUSpendu, utilities that allow for lateral movement through WSUS.
Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) is a critical component of Windows systems and is frequently configured in a way that allows an attacker to circumvent internal networking limitations.
properties.author: @Kostastsale, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Svchost Parent Process
properties.description: Detects an uncommon svchost parent process
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Chopper Webshell Process Pattern
properties.description: Detects patterns found in process executions cause by China Chopper like tiny (ASPX) webshells
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), MSTI (query)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Server Web Shell Execution
properties.description: Detects potential web shell execution from the ScreenConnect server process.
properties.author: Jason Rathbun (Blackpoint Cyber)

properties.name: Capture Credentials with Rpcping.exe
properties.description: Detects using Rpcping.exe to send a RPC test connection to the target server (-s) and force the NTLM hash to be sent in the process.
properties.author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community

properties.name: ShimCache Flush
properties.description: Detects actions that clear the local ShimCache and remove forensic evidence
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Reflective Assembly Load
properties.description: Detects base64 encoded .NET reflective loading of Assembly
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems), pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WmiPrvSE Spawned A Process
properties.description: Detects WmiPrvSE spawning a process
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: HackTool - PurpleSharp Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the PurpleSharp adversary simulation tool
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Persistence Via Sticky Key Backdoor
properties.description:
By replacing the sticky keys executable with the local admins CMD executable, an attacker is able to access a privileged windows console session without authenticating to the system.
When the sticky keys are "activated" the privilleged shell is launched.
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: PUA - DefenderCheck Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of DefenderCheck, a tool to evaluate the signatures used in Microsoft Defender. It can be used to figure out the strings / byte chains used in Microsoft Defender to detect a tool and thus used for AV evasion.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious RASdial Activity
properties.description: Detects suspicious process related to rasdial.exe
properties.author: juju4

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious ASP.NET Compilation Via AspNetCompiler
properties.description: Detects execution of "aspnet_compiler.exe" with potentially suspicious paths for compilation.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Powercfg Execution To Change Lock Screen Timeout
properties.description: Detects suspicious execution of 'Powercfg.exe' to change lock screen timeout
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Password Spraying Attempt Using Dsacls.EXE
properties.description: Detects possible password spraying attempts using Dsacls
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Driver/DLL Installation Via Odbcconf.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with "INSTALLDRIVER" which installs a new ODBC driver. Attackers abuse this to install and run malicious DLLs.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: 7Zip Compressing Dump Files
properties.description: Detects execution of 7z in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Indirect Command Execution By Program Compatibility Wizard
properties.description: Detect indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant pcwrun.exe
properties.author: A. Sungurov , oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Msiexec Quiet Install From Remote Location
properties.description: Detects usage of Msiexec.exe to install packages hosted remotely quietly
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - 3Proxy Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of 3proxy, a tiny free proxy server
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Arbitrary File Download Via Cmdl32.EXE
properties.description:
Detects execution of Cmdl32 with the "/vpn" and "/lan" flags.
Attackers can abuse this utility in order to download arbitrary files via a configuration file.
Inspect the location and the content of the file passed as an argument in order to determine if it is suspicious.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Portable Gpg.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of "gpg.exe" from uncommon location. Often used by ransomware and loaders to decrypt/encrypt data.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - PowerTool Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the tool PowerTool which has the ability to kill a process, delete its process file, unload drivers, and delete the driver files
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Kerberos Ticket Request via CLI
properties.description:
Detects suspicious Kerberos ticket requests via command line using System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken class.
Threat actors may use command line interfaces to request Kerberos tickets for service accounts in order to
perform offline password cracking attacks commonly known as Kerberoasting or other Kerberos ticket abuse
techniques like silver ticket attacks.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Dllhost.EXE Execution Anomaly
properties.description: Detects a "dllhost" process spawning with no commandline arguments which is very rare to happen and could indicate process injection activity or malware mimicking similar system processes.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Findstr Launching .lnk File
properties.description: Detects usage of findstr to identify and execute a lnk file as seen within the HHS redirect attack
properties.author: Trent Liffick

properties.name: DeviceCredentialDeployment Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of DeviceCredentialDeployment to hide a process from view.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execute Arbitrary PowerShell Code
properties.description: Executes arbitrary PowerShell code using SyncAppvPublishingServer.exe.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Microsoft Office Child Process
properties.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from one of the Microsoft Office suite products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio, etc.)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, FPT.EagleEye Team, Vadim Khrykov, Cyb3rEng, Michael Haag, Christopher Peacock @securepeacock, @scythe_io

properties.name: File Download with Headless Browser
properties.description: Detects execution of chromium based browser in headless mode using the "dump-dom" command line to download files
properties.author: Sreeman, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Covenant PowerShell Launcher
properties.description: Detects suspicious command lines used in Covenant luanchers
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspect Svchost Activity
properties.description: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.
properties.author: David Burkett, @signalblur

properties.name: PUA- IOX Tunneling Tool Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of IOX - a tool for port forwarding and intranet proxy purposes
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious High IntegrityLevel Conhost Legacy Option
properties.description: ForceV1 asks for information directly from the kernel space. Conhost connects to the console application. High IntegrityLevel means the process is running with elevated privileges, such as an Administrator context.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Audio Capture via PowerShell
properties.description: Detects audio capture via PowerShell Cmdlet.
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Cloudflared Tunnel Connections Cleanup
properties.description: Detects execution of the "cloudflared" tool with the tunnel "cleanup" flag in order to cleanup tunnel connections.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Advanced Port Scanner Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of Advanced Port Scanner.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Rebuild Performance Counter Values Via Lodctr.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of "lodctr.exe" to rebuild the performance counter registry values. This can be abused by attackers by providing a malicious config file to overwrite performance counter configuration to confuse and evade monitoring and security solutions.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Active Directory Database Snapshot Via ADExplorer
properties.description: Detects the execution of Sysinternals ADExplorer with the "-snapshot" flag in order to save a local copy of the active directory database. This can be used by attackers to extract data for Bloodhound, usernames for password spraying or use the meta data for social engineering. The snapshot doesn't contain password hashes but there have been cases, where administrators put passwords in the comment field.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Remote Command Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a system command via the ScreenConnect RMM service.
properties.author: Ali Alwashali

properties.name: Renamed AutoIt Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of a renamed AutoIt2.exe or AutoIt3.exe.
AutoIt is a scripting language and automation tool for Windows systems. While primarily used for legitimate automation tasks, it can be misused in cyber attacks.
Attackers can leverage AutoIt to create and distribute malware, including keyloggers, spyware, and botnets. A renamed AutoIt executable is particularly suspicious.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Over Permissive Permissions Granted Using Dsacls.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of Dsacls to grant over permissive permissions
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: RegAsm.EXE Execution Without CommandLine Flags or Files
properties.description:
Detects the execution of "RegAsm.exe" without a commandline flag or file, which might indicate potential process injection activity.
Usually "RegAsm.exe" should point to a dedicated DLL file or call the help with the "/?" flag.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Use of Wfc.exe
properties.description: The Workflow Command-line Compiler can be used for AWL bypass and is listed in Microsoft's recommended block rules.
properties.author: Christopher Peacock @SecurePeacock, SCYTHE @scythe_io

properties.name: Remote Code Execute via Winrm.vbs
properties.description: Detects an attempt to execute code or create service on remote host via winrm.vbs.
properties.author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - RURAT Execution From Unusual Location
properties.description: Detects execution of Remote Utilities RAT (RURAT) from an unusual location (outside of 'C:\Program Files')
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Firewall Configuration Discovery Via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems
properties.author: frack113, Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE '@scythe_io'

properties.name: Sysinternals PsSuspend Suspicious Execution
properties.description: Detects suspicious execution of Sysinternals PsSuspend, where the utility is used to suspend critical processes such as AV or EDR to bypass defenses
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Data Stealing Via Chromium Headless Debugging
properties.description: Detects chromium based browsers starting in headless and debugging mode and pointing to a user profile. This could be a sign of data stealing or remote control
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: SQLite Firefox Profile Data DB Access
properties.description: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Firefox and other Gecko-based browsers for potential data stealing.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Hiding Files with Attrib.exe
properties.description: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.
properties.author: Sami Ruohonen

properties.name: New Remote Desktop Connection Initiated Via Mstsc.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the usage of "mstsc.exe" with the "/v" flag to initiate a connection to a remote server.
Adversaries may use valid accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious UltraVNC Execution
properties.description: Detects suspicious UltraVNC command line flag combination that indicate a auto reconnect upon execution, e.g. startup (as seen being used by Gamaredon threat group)
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Suspicious Scan Loop Network
properties.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of other systems by IP address, hostname, or other logical identifier on a network that may be used for Lateral Movement from the current system
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - Impacket Tools Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of different compiled Windows binaries of the impacket toolset (based on names or part of their names - could lead to false positives)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Plink Port Forwarding
properties.description: Detects suspicious Plink tunnel port forwarding to a local port
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Arbitrary Command Execution Via FTP.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "ftp.exe" script with the "-s" or "/s" flag and any child processes ran by "ftp.exe".
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community

properties.name: Forfiles Command Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of "forfiles" with the "/c" flag.
While this is an expected behavior of the tool, it can be abused in order to proxy execution through it with any binary.
Can be used to bypass application whitelisting.
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic, E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious JWT Token Search Via CLI
properties.description:
Detects potentially suspicious search for JWT tokens via CLI by looking for the string "eyJ0eX" or "eyJhbG".
JWT tokens are often used for access-tokens across various applications and services like Microsoft 365, Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, and others.
Threat actors may search for these tokens to steal them for lateral movement or privilege escalation.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), kagebunsher

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using Disk Cleanup
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using scheduled tasks and variable expansion of cleanmgr.exe (UACMe 34)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Desktop Background Change Using Reg.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the execution of "reg.exe" to alter registry keys that would replace the user's desktop background.
This is a common technique used by malware to change the desktop background to a ransom note or other image.
properties.author: Stephen Lincoln @slincoln-aiq (AttackIQ)

properties.name: Rundll32 Spawned Via Explorer.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "rundll32.exe" with a parent process of Explorer.exe. This has been observed by variants of Raspberry Robin, as first reported by Red Canary.
properties.author: CD_ROM_

properties.name: RestrictedAdminMode Registry Value Tampering - ProcCreation
properties.description:
Detects changes to the "DisableRestrictedAdmin" registry value in order to disable or enable RestrictedAdmin mode.
RestrictedAdmin mode prevents the transmission of reusable credentials to the remote system to which you connect using Remote Desktop.
This prevents your credentials from being harvested during the initial connection process if the remote server has been compromise
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Query Usage To Exfil Data
properties.description: Detects usage of "query.exe" a system binary to exfil information such as "sessions" and "processes" for later use
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Kernel Driver Via SC.EXE
properties.description: Detects creation of a new service (kernel driver) with the type "kernel"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Download From File Sharing Domain Via Curl.EXE
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious file download from file sharing domains using curl.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Script Change Permission Via Set-Acl
properties.description: Detects PowerShell execution to set the ACL of a file or a folder
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DSInternals Suspicious PowerShell Cmdlets
properties.description:
Detects execution and usage of the DSInternals PowerShell module. Which can be used to perform what might be considered as suspicious activity such as dumping DPAPI backup keys or manipulating NTDS.DIT files.
The DSInternals PowerShell Module exposes several internal features of Active Directory and Azure Active Directory. These include FIDO2 and NGC key auditing, offline ntds.dit file manipulation, password auditing, DC recovery from IFM backups and password hash calculation.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Nounou Mbeiri

properties.name: File Decryption Using Gpg4win
properties.description: Detects usage of Gpg4win to decrypt files
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Reconnaissance Activity Via GatherNetworkInfo.VBS
properties.description: Detects execution of the built-in script located in "C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs". Which can be used to gather information about the target machine
properties.author: blueteamer8699

properties.name: PUA - Chisel Tunneling Tool Execution
properties.description: Detects usage of the Chisel tunneling tool via the commandline arguments
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious CodePage Switch Via CHCP
properties.description: Detects a code page switch in command line or batch scripts to a rare language
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious AddinUtil.EXE CommandLine Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) with suspicious Addinroot or Pipelineroot paths. An adversary may execute AddinUtil.exe with uncommon Addinroot/Pipelineroot paths that point to the adversaries Addins.Store payload.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Michael McKinley (@McKinleyMike), Tony Latteri (@TheLatteri)

properties.name: HackTool - Inveigh Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of Inveigh a cross-platform .NET IPv4/IPv6 machine-in-the-middle tool
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed PingCastle Binary Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "PingCastle" binary based on the PE metadata fields.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Copy From VolumeShadowCopy Via Cmd.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of the builtin "copy" command that targets a shadow copy (sometimes used to copy registry hives that are in use)
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Defender Threat Severity Default Action Set to 'Allow' or 'NoAction'
properties.description:
Detects the use of PowerShell to execute the 'Set-MpPreference' cmdlet to configure Windows Defender's threat severity default action to 'Allow' (value '6') or 'NoAction' (value '9').
This is a highly suspicious configuration change that effectively disables Defender's ability to automatically mitigate threats of a certain severity level.
An attacker might use this technique via the command line to bypass defenses before executing payloads.
properties.author: Matt Anderson (Huntress)

properties.name: Mshtml.DLL RunHTMLApplication Suspicious Usage
properties.description: Detects execution of commands that leverage the "mshtml.dll" RunHTMLApplication export to run arbitrary code via different protocol handlers (vbscript, javascript, file, http...)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems),  Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Josh Nickels, frack113, Zaw Min Htun (ZETA)

properties.name: Bypass UAC via CMSTP
properties.description: Detect commandline usage of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer (cmstp.exe) to install specially formatted local .INF files
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

properties.name: Remote XSL Execution Via Msxsl.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of the "msxsl" binary with an "http" keyword in the command line. This might indicate a potential remote execution of XSL files.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Shell Process Spawned by Java.EXE
properties.description: Detects shell spawned from Java host process, which could be a sign of exploitation (e.g. log4j exploitation)
properties.author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades), Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Renamed BOINC Client Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed BOINC binary.
properties.author: Matt Anderson (Huntress)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation
properties.description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the following code block
properties.author: Daniel Bohannon (@Mandiant/@FireEye), oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity Via GatherNetworkInfo.VBS
properties.description: Detects execution of the built-in script located in "C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs". Which can be used to gather information about the target machine
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Control Panel Items
properties.description: Detects the malicious use of a control panel item
properties.author: Kyaw Min Thein, Furkan Caliskan (@caliskanfurkan_)

properties.name: HackTool - TruffleSnout Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of TruffleSnout.exe an iterative AD discovery toolkit for offensive operators, situational awareness and targeted low noise enumeration.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Elevated System Shell Spawned From Uncommon Parent Location
properties.description: Detects when a shell program such as the Windows command prompt or PowerShell is launched with system privileges from a uncommon parent location.
properties.author: frack113, Tim Shelton (update fp)

properties.name: Potential Binary Proxy Execution Via Cdb.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of "cdb.exe" to launch arbitrary processes or commands from a debugger script file
properties.author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Compressed File Extraction Via Tar.EXE
properties.description:
Detects execution of "tar.exe" in order to extract compressed file.
Adversaries may abuse various utilities in order to decompress data to avoid detection.
properties.author: AdmU3

properties.name: DLL Sideloading by VMware Xfer Utility
properties.description: Detects execution of VMware Xfer utility (VMwareXferlogs.exe) from the non-default directory which may be an attempt to sideload arbitrary DLL
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CodePage Modification Via MODE.COM To Russian Language
properties.description:
Detects a CodePage modification using the "mode.com" utility to Russian language.
This behavior has been used by threat actors behind Dharma ransomware.
properties.author: Joseliyo Sanchez, @Joseliyo_Jstnk

properties.name: Suspicious HWP Sub Processes
properties.description: Detects suspicious Hangul Word Processor (Hanword) sub processes that could indicate an exploitation
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Malicious Base64 Encoded PowerShell Keywords in Command Lines
properties.description: Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines
properties.author: John Lambert (rule)

properties.name: Potential Credential Dumping Attempt Using New NetworkProvider - CLI
properties.description: Detects when an attacker tries to add a new network provider in order to dump clear text credentials, similar to how the NPPSpy tool does it
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Interactive AT Job
properties.description: Detects an interactive AT job, which may be used as a form of privilege escalation.
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

properties.name: New Root Certificate Installed Via CertMgr.EXE
properties.description:
Detects execution of "certmgr" with the "add" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system.
Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.
properties.author: oscd.community, @redcanary, Zach Stanford @svch0st

properties.name: Schtasks From Suspicious Folders
properties.description: Detects scheduled task creations that have suspicious action command and folder combinations
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - PCHunter Execution
properties.description: Detects suspicious use of PCHunter, a tool like Process Hacker to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level stuff
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: HackTool - LaZagne Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of the LaZagne. A utility used to retrieve multiple types of passwords stored on a local computer.
LaZagne has been leveraged multiple times by threat actors in order to dump credentials.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious AgentExecutor PowerShell Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of the AgentExecutor.exe binary. Which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute powershell scripts with the ExecutionPolicy "Bypass" or any binary named "powershell.exe" located in the path provided by 6th positional argument
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), memory-shards

properties.name: Potential LethalHTA Technique Execution
properties.description: Detects potential LethalHTA technique where the "mshta.exe" is spawned by an "svchost.exe" process
properties.author: Markus Neis

properties.name: Delete Important Scheduled Task
properties.description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by deleting their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Cscript/Wscript Uncommon Script Extension Execution
properties.description: Detects Wscript/Cscript executing a file with an uncommon (i.e. non-script) extension
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell IEX Execution Patterns
properties.description: Detects suspicious ways to run Invoke-Execution using IEX alias
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Webshell Tool Reconnaissance Activity
properties.description: Detects processes spawned from web servers (PHP, Tomcat, IIS, etc.) that perform reconnaissance looking for the existence of popular scripting tools (perl, python, wget) on the system via the help commands
properties.author: Cian Heasley, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Powershell Search Order Hijacking - Task
properties.description: Detects suspicious powershell execution via a schedule task where the command ends with an suspicious flags to hide the powershell instance instead of executeing scripts or commands. This could be a sign of persistence via PowerShell "Get-Variable" technique as seen being used in Colibri Loader
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Wab Execution From Non Default Location
properties.description: Detects execution of wab.exe (Windows Contacts) and Wabmig.exe (Microsoft Address Book Import Tool) from non default locations as seen with bumblebee activity
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disable Windows Defender AV Security Monitoring
properties.description: Detects attackers attempting to disable Windows Defender using Powershell
properties.author: ok @securonix invrep-de, oscd.community, frack113

properties.name: Regsvr32 Execution From Highly Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects execution of regsvr32 where the DLL is located in a highly suspicious locations
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Mshta.EXE Execution Patterns
properties.description: Detects suspicious mshta process execution patterns
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential CobaltStrike Process Patterns
properties.description: Detects potential process patterns related to Cobalt Strike beacon activity
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Execution of Systeminfo
properties.description: Detects usage of the "systeminfo" command to retrieve information
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
properties.description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

properties.name: Suspicious Child Process of AspNetCompiler
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "aspnet_compiler.exe".
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Encoded PowerShell Command Line
properties.description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

properties.name: Potential Regsvr32 Commandline Flag Anomaly
properties.description: Detects a potential command line flag anomaly related to "regsvr32" in which the "/i" flag is used without the "/n" which should be uncommon.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: User Added to Local Administrators Group
properties.description: Detects addition of users to the local administrator group via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Script Proxy Execution Via CL_Mutexverifiers.ps1
properties.description: Detects the use of the Microsoft signed script "CL_mutexverifiers" to proxy the execution of additional PowerShell script commands
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova, frack113

properties.name: Abusing Print Executable
properties.description: Attackers can use print.exe for remote file copy
properties.author: Furkan CALISKAN, @caliskanfurkan_, @oscd_initiative

properties.name: AADInternals PowerShell Cmdlets Execution - ProccessCreation
properties.description: Detects ADDInternals Cmdlet execution. A tool for administering Azure AD and Office 365. Which can be abused by threat actors to attack Azure AD or Office 365.
properties.author: Austin Songer (@austinsonger), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: IE ZoneMap Setting Downgraded To MyComputer Zone For HTTP Protocols Via CLI
properties.description: Detects changes to Internet Explorer's (IE / Windows Internet properties) ZoneMap configuration of the "HTTP" and "HTTPS" protocols to point to the "My Computer" zone. This allows downloaded files from the Internet to be granted the same level of trust as files stored locally.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: User Added to Remote Desktop Users Group
properties.description: Detects addition of users to the local Remote Desktop Users group via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation via Masqueraded XML File
properties.description: Detects the creation of a scheduled task using the "-XML" flag with a file without the '.xml' extension. This behavior could be indicative of potential defense evasion attempt during persistence
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Logged-On User Password Change Via Ksetup.EXE
properties.description: Detects password change for the logged-on user's via "ksetup.exe"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Registry Modification From ADS Via Regini.EXE
properties.description: Detects the import of an alternate data stream with regini.exe, regini.exe can be used to modify registry keys.
properties.author: Eli Salem, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Cabinet File Expansion
properties.description: Detects the expansion or decompression of cabinet files from potentially suspicious or uncommon locations, e.g. seen in Iranian MeteorExpress related attacks
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj, X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CMSTP Execution Process Creation
properties.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
properties.author: Nik Seetharaman

properties.name: Suspicious Copy From or To System Directory
properties.description:
Detects a suspicious copy operation that tries to copy a program from system (System32, SysWOW64, WinSxS) directories to another on disk.
Often used to move LOLBINs such as 'certutil' or 'desktopimgdownldr' to a different location with a different name in order to bypass detections based on locations.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Tim Shelton (HAWK.IO), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Browser Data Stealing
properties.description:
Adversaries may acquire credentials from web browsers by reading files specific to the target browser.
Web browsers commonly save credentials such as website usernames and passwords so that they do not need to be entered manually in the future.
Web browsers typically store the credentials in an encrypted format within a credential store.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Ping/Del Command Combination
properties.description: Detects a method often used by ransomware. Which combines the "ping" to wait a couple of seconds and then "del" to delete the file in question. Its used to hide the file responsible for the initial infection for example
properties.author: Ilya Krestinichev

properties.name: Base64 Encoded PowerShell Command Detected
properties.description: Detects usage of the "FromBase64String" function in the commandline which is used to decode a base64 encoded string
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Sensitive File Access Via Volume Shadow Copy Backup
properties.description: Detects a command that accesses the VolumeShadowCopy in order to extract sensitive files such as the Security or SAM registry hives or the AD database (ntds.dit)
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Existing Service Tampering
properties.description: Detects the modification of an existing service in order to execute an arbitrary payload when the service is started or killed as a potential method for persistence.
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: Windows Admin Share Mount Via Net.EXE
properties.description: Detects when an admin share is mounted using net.exe
properties.author: oscd.community, Teymur Kheirkhabarov @HeirhabarovT, Zach Stanford @svch0st, wagga

properties.name: Suspicious IIS Module Registration
properties.description: Detects a suspicious IIS module registration as described in Microsoft threat report on IIS backdoors
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Microsoft (idea)

properties.name: File Download Via Bitsadmin To An Uncommon Target Folder
properties.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file to uncommon target folder
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Radmin Viewer Utility Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of Radmin which can be abused by an adversary to remotely control Windows machines
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Remote File Download Via Desktopimgdownldr Utility
properties.description: Detects the desktopimgdownldr utility being used to download a remote file. An adversary may use desktopimgdownldr to download arbitrary files as an alternative to certutil.
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Invoke Keyword
properties.description: Detects UTF-8 and UTF-16 Base64 encoded powershell 'Invoke-' calls
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems), Harjot Singh, @cyb3rjy0t

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of Regsvr32
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "regsvr32.exe".
properties.author: elhoim, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Empire PowerShell UAC Bypass
properties.description: Detects some Empire PowerShell UAC bypass methods
properties.author: Ecco

properties.name: Suspicious Execution From Outlook Temporary Folder
properties.description: Detects a suspicious program execution in Outlook temp folder
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - MeshAgent Command Execution via MeshCentral
properties.description:
Detects the use of MeshAgent to execute commands on the target host, particularly when threat actors might abuse it to execute commands directly.
MeshAgent can execute commands on the target host by leveraging win-console to obscure their activities and win-dispatcher to run malicious code through IPC with child processes.
properties.author: @Kostastsale

properties.name: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings
properties.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Query of MachineGUID
properties.description: Use of reg to get MachineGuid information
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Wab/Wabmig Unusual Parent Or Child Processes
properties.description: Detects unusual parent or children of the wab.exe (Windows Contacts) and Wabmig.exe (Microsoft Address Book Import Tool) processes as seen being used with bumblebee activity
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - Anydesk Execution From Suspicious Folder
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Execution of Shutdown to Log Out
properties.description: Detects the rare use of the command line tool shutdown to logoff a user
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Use of VSIISExeLauncher.exe
properties.description: The "VSIISExeLauncher.exe" binary part of the Visual Studio/VS Code can be used to execute arbitrary binaries
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious TSCON Start as SYSTEM
properties.description: Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ManageEngine Endpoint Central Dctask64.EXE Potential Abuse
properties.description:
Detects the execution of "dctask64.exe", a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation part of ManageEngine Endpoint Central.
This binary can be abused for DLL injection, arbitrary command and process execution.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Group Membership Reconnaissance Via Whoami.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of whoami.exe with the /group command line flag to show group membership for the current user, account type, security identifiers (SID), and attributes.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Workstation Locking via Rundll32
properties.description: Detects a suspicious call to the user32.dll function that locks the user workstation
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Excel.EXE DCOM Lateral Movement Via ActivateMicrosoftApp
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes of Excel which could be an indicator of lateral movement leveraging the "ActivateMicrosoftApp" Excel DCOM object.
properties.author: Aaron Stratton

properties.name: HackTool - GMER Rootkit Detector and Remover Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution GMER tool based on image and hash fields.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Download From IP Based URL Via CertOC.EXE
properties.description: Detects when a user downloads a file from an IP based URL using CertOC.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Powershell Inline Execution From A File
properties.description: Detects inline execution of PowerShell code from a file
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - CrackMapExec Execution Patterns
properties.description: Detects various execution patterns of the CrackMapExec pentesting framework
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Download and Execute Pattern
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download patterns that are often used in malicious scripts, stagers or downloaders (make sure that your backend applies the strings case-insensitive)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Uninstall of Windows Defender Feature via PowerShell
properties.description: Detects the use of PowerShell with Uninstall-WindowsFeature or Remove-WindowsFeature cmdlets to disable or remove the Windows Defender GUI feature, a common technique used by adversaries to evade defenses.
properties.author: yxinmiracle

properties.name: CreateDump Process Dump
properties.description: Detects uses of the createdump.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Child Process Of Veeam Dabatase
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the Veeam service process. This could indicate potential RCE or SQL Injection.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Remote Child Process From Outlook
properties.description: Detects a suspicious child process spawning from Outlook where the image is located in a remote location (SMB/WebDav shares).
properties.author: Markus Neis, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: XSL Script Execution Via WMIC.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the execution of WMIC with the "format" flag to potentially load XSL files.
Adversaries abuse this functionality to execute arbitrary files while potentially bypassing application whitelisting defenses.
Extensible Stylesheet Language (XSL) files are commonly used to describe the processing and rendering of data within XML files.
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Suspicious Electron Application Child Processes
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes of electron apps (teams, discord, slack, etc.). This could be a potential sign of ".asar" file tampering (See reference section for more information) or binary execution proxy through specific CLI arguments (see related rule)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Bypass UAC via WSReset.exe
properties.description: Detects use of WSReset.exe to bypass User Account Control (UAC). Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Tony Lambert), oscd.community, Florian Roth

properties.name: Greedy File Deletion Using Del
properties.description: Detects execution of the "del" builtin command to remove files using greedy/wildcard expression. This is often used by malware to delete content of folders that perhaps contains the initial malware infection or to delete evidence.
properties.author: frack113 , X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Double Extension File Execution
properties.description: Detects suspicious use of an .exe extension after a non-executable file extension like .pdf.exe, a set of spaces or underlines to cloak the executable file in spear phishing campaigns
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), @blu3_team (idea), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Enable LM Hash Storage - ProcCreation
properties.description:
Detects changes to the "NoLMHash" registry value in order to allow Windows to store LM Hashes.
By setting this registry value to "0" (DWORD), Windows will be allowed to store a LAN manager hash of your password in Active Directory and local SAM databases.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Cloudflared Tunnel Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of the "cloudflared" tool to connect back to a tunnel. This was seen used by threat actors to maintain persistence and remote access to compromised networks.
properties.author: Janantha Marasinghe, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using PkgMgr and DISM
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using pkgmgr.exe and dism.exe (UACMe 23)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Inline JavaScript Execution via NodeJS Binary
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious inline JavaScript execution using Node.js with specific keywords in the command line.
properties.author: Microsoft (idea), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Defense Evasion Via Right-to-Left Override
properties.description:
Detects the presence of the "u202+E" character, which causes a terminal, browser, or operating system to render text in a right-to-left sequence.
This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques.
properties.author: Micah Babinski, @micahbabinski, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Child Process Of Conhost.EXE
properties.description: Detects uncommon "conhost" child processes. This could be a sign of "conhost" usage as a LOLBIN or potential process injection activity.
properties.author: omkar72

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Mailbox Export to Share
properties.description: Detects usage of the powerShell New-MailboxExportRequest Cmdlet to exports a mailbox to a remote or local share, as used in ProxyShell exploitations
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Regsvr32 HTTP/FTP Pattern
properties.description: Detects regsvr32 execution to download/install/register new DLLs that are hosted on Web or FTP servers.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Defender Definition Files Removed
properties.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by removing Windows Defender Definition Files
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: C# IL Code Compilation Via Ilasm.EXE
properties.description: Detects the use of "Ilasm.EXE" in order to compile C# intermediate (IL) code to EXE or DLL.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Start Windows Service Via Net.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of the "net.exe" command to start a service using the "start" flag
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious DLL Registered Via Odbcconf.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "REGSVR" action where the DLL in question doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. Which is often used as a method to evade defenses.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Schtasks Execution AppData Folder
properties.description: Detects the creation of a schtask that executes a file from C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Regsvr32 Execution From Potential Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects execution of regsvr32 where the DLL is located in a potentially suspicious location.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
