properties.name: LOLBIN Execution From Abnormal Drive
properties.description: Detects LOLBINs executing from an abnormal or uncommon drive such as a mounted ISO.
properties.author: Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE '@scythe_io', Angelo Violetti - SEC Consult '@angelo_violetti', Aaron Herman

properties.name: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Diskshadow Script Mode - Uncommon Script Extension Execution
properties.description:
Detects execution of "Diskshadow.exe" in script mode to execute an script with a potentially uncommon extension.
Initial baselining of the allowed extension list is required.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Arbitrary File Download Via IMEWDBLD.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of "IMEWDBLD.exe" to download arbitrary files
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious File Download From File Sharing Domain Via PowerShell.EXE
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads from file sharing domains using PowerShell.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Python Inline Command Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of python using the "-c" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live python code.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Hidden Powershell in Link File Pattern
properties.description: Detects events that appear when a user click on a link file with a powershell command in it
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Diskshadow Script Mode - Execution From Potential Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects execution of "Diskshadow.exe" in script mode using the "/s" flag where the script is located in a potentially suspicious location.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential NTLM Coercion Via Certutil.EXE
properties.description: Detects possible NTLM coercion via certutil using the 'syncwithWU' flag
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Recon Activity Via Nltest.EXE
properties.description: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery
properties.author: Craig Young, oscd.community, Georg Lauenstein

properties.name: Potential SPN Enumeration Via Setspn.EXE
properties.description: Detects service principal name (SPN) enumeration used for Kerberoasting
properties.author: Markus Neis, keepwatch

properties.name: HKTL - SharpSuccessor Privilege Escalation Tool Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of SharpSuccessor, a tool used to exploit the BadSuccessor attack for privilege escalation in WinServer 2025 Active Directory environments.
Successful usage of this tool can let the attackers gain the domain admin privileges by exploiting the BadSuccessor vulnerability.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Computer Discovery And Export Via Get-ADComputer Cmdlet
properties.description: Detects usage of the Get-ADComputer cmdlet to collect computer information and output it to a file
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HH.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of "hh.exe" to open ".chm" files.
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Dan Beavin), oscd.community

properties.name: Potential Arbitrary File Download Using Office Application
properties.description: Detects potential arbitrary file download using a Microsoft Office application
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Beyu Denis, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious New Service Creation
properties.description: Detects creation of a new service via "sc" command or the powershell "new-service" cmdlet with suspicious binary paths
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Service Path Modification
properties.description: Detects service path modification via the "sc" binary to a suspicious command or path
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Use of FSharp Interpreters
properties.description:
Detects the execution of FSharp Interpreters "FsiAnyCpu.exe" and "FSi.exe"
Both can be used for AWL bypass and to execute F# code via scripts or inline.
properties.author: Christopher Peacock @SecurePeacock, SCYTHE @scythe_io

properties.name: Firewall Rule Update Via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of netsh with the "advfirewall" and the "set" option in order to set new values for properties of a existing rule
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Script Event Consumer Spawning Process
properties.description: Detects a suspicious child process of Script Event Consumer (scrcons.exe).
properties.author: Sittikorn S

properties.name: HTML Help HH.EXE Suspicious Child Process
properties.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help (HH.exe)
properties.author: Maxim Pavlunin, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - CsExec Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of the lesser known remote execution tool named CsExec a PsExec alternative
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Characteristics Due to Missing Fields
properties.description: Detects Executables in the Downloads folder without FileVersion,Description,Product,Company likely created with py2exe
properties.author: Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing

properties.name: Computer Password Change Via Ksetup.EXE
properties.description: Detects password change for the computer's domain account or host principal via "ksetup.exe"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon FileSystem Load Attempt By Format.com
properties.description: Detects the execution of format.com with an uncommon filesystem selection that could indicate a defense evasion activity in which "format.com" is used to load malicious DLL files or other programs.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Download from Office Domain
properties.description: Detects suspicious ways to download files from Microsoft domains that are used to store attachments in Emails or OneNote documents
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Esentutl Gather Credentials
properties.description: Conti recommendation to its affiliates to use esentutl to access NTDS dumped file. Trickbot also uses this utilities to get MSEdge info via its module pwgrab.
properties.author: sam0x90

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Encoded Command Patterns
properties.description: Detects PowerShell command line patterns in combincation with encoded commands that often appear in malware infection chains
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Audio Capture via SoundRecorder
properties.description: Detect attacker collecting audio via SoundRecorder application.
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

properties.name: Obfuscated IP Via CLI
properties.description: Detects usage of an encoded/obfuscated version of an IP address (hex, octal, etc.) via command line
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Setup16.EXE Execution With Custom .Lst File
properties.description:
Detects the execution of "Setup16.EXE" and old installation utility with a custom ".lst" file.
These ".lst" file can contain references to external program that "Setup16.EXE" will execute.
Attackers and adversaries might leverage this as a living of the land utility.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Regedit as Trusted Installer
properties.description: Detects a regedit started with TrustedInstaller privileges or by ProcessHacker.exe
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Child Process Of Manage Engine ServiceDesk
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the "Manage Engine ServiceDesk Plus" Java web service
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Suspicious ActiveDirectory Enumeration Via AdFind.EXE
properties.description: Detects active directory enumeration activity using known AdFind CLI flags
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: New Process Created Via Taskmgr.EXE
properties.description: Detects the creation of a process via the Windows task manager. This might be an attempt to bypass UAC
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Gpscript Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the LOLBIN gpscript, which executes logon or startup scripts configured in Group Policy
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Replace.exe Usage
properties.description: Detects the use of Replace.exe which can be used to replace file with another file
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Sdclt Child Processes
properties.description: A General detection for sdclt spawning new processes. This could be an indicator of sdclt being used for bypass UAC techniques.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: HackTool - Rubeus Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the hacktool Rubeus via PE information of command line parameters
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass via ICMLuaUtil
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using ICMLuaUtil Elevated COM interface
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Elastic (idea)

properties.name: AWL Bypass with Winrm.vbs and Malicious WsmPty.xsl/WsmTxt.xsl
properties.description: Detects execution of attacker-controlled WsmPty.xsl or WsmTxt.xsl via winrm.vbs and copied cscript.exe (can be renamed)
properties.author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community

properties.name: Browser Execution In Headless Mode
properties.description: Detects execution of Chromium based browser in headless mode
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Chromium Browser Instance Executed With Custom Extension
properties.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning a Chromium based browser process with the 'load-extension' flag to start an instance with a custom extension
properties.author: Aedan Russell, frack113, X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Debugger Registration Cmdline
properties.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Jonhnathan Ribeiro

properties.name: Suspicious Redirection to Local Admin Share
properties.description: Detects a suspicious output redirection to the local admins share, this technique is often found in malicious scripts or hacktool stagers
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Firewall Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Detects the addition of a new rule to the Windows firewall via netsh
properties.author: Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing

properties.name: Potential Data Exfiltration Activity Via CommandLine Tools
properties.description: Detects the use of various CLI utilities exfiltrating data via web requests
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Execution of InstallUtil Without Log
properties.description: Uses the .NET InstallUtil.exe application in order to execute image without log
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Browser Started with Remote Debugging
properties.description: Detects browsers starting with the remote debugging flags. Which is a technique often used to perform browser injection attacks
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Weak or Abused Passwords In CLI
properties.description:
Detects weak passwords or often abused passwords (seen used by threat actors) via the CLI.
An example would be a threat actor creating a new user via the net command and providing the password inline
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Run Keys Using Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Detection of PowerShell Execution via Sqlps.exe
properties.description:
This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqlps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the MSSQL Server.
Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.
properties.author: Agro (@agro_sev) oscd.community

properties.name: Potential File Overwrite Via Sysinternals SDelete
properties.description: Detects the use of SDelete to erase a file not the free space
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Renamed BrowserCore.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects process creation with a renamed BrowserCore.exe (used to extract Azure tokens)
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: System Disk And Volume Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description:
An adversary might use WMI to discover information about the system, such as the volume name, size,
free space, and other disk information. This can be done using the 'wmic' command-line utility and has been
observed being used by threat actors such as Volt Typhoon.
properties.author: Stephen Lincoln '@slincoln-aiq' (AttackIQ)

properties.name: Privilege Escalation via Named Pipe Impersonation
properties.description: Detects a remote file copy attempt to a hidden network share. This may indicate lateral movement or data staging activity.
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Visual Studio NodejsTools PressAnyKey Renamed Execution
properties.description: Detects renamed execution of "Microsoft.NodejsTools.PressAnyKey.exe", which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute arbitrary binaries
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DLL Loaded via CertOC.EXE
properties.description: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to loads the target DLL file.
properties.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger

properties.name: Sysprep on AppData Folder
properties.description: Detects suspicious sysprep process start with AppData folder as target (as used by Trojan Syndicasec in Thrip report by Symantec)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Quarks PwDump Execution
properties.description: Detects usage of the Quarks PwDump tool via commandline arguments
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Direct Autorun Keys Modification
properties.description: Detects direct modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry using reg.exe.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential COM Objects Download Cradles Usage - Process Creation
properties.description: Detects usage of COM objects that can be abused to download files in PowerShell by CLSID
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via WCHAR/CHAR
properties.description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Extrac32 Execution
properties.description: Download or Copy file with Extrac32
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious File Execution From Internet Hosted WebDav Share
properties.description: Detects the execution of the "net use" command to mount a WebDAV server and then immediately execute some content in it. As seen being used in malicious LNK files
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Dumping of Sensitive Hives Via Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" in order to dump sensitive registry hives. This includes SAM, SYSTEM and SECURITY hives.
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Endgame, JHasenbusch, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community, frack113

properties.name: NodeJS Execution of JavaScript File
properties.description:
Detects execution of JavaScript or JSC files using NodeJs binary node.exe, that could be potentially suspicious.
Node.js is a popular open-source JavaScript runtime that runs code outside browsers and is widely used for both frontend and backend development.
Adversaries have been observed abusing Node.js to disguise malware as legitimate processes, evade security defenses, and maintain persistence within target systems.
Because Node.js is commonly used, this rule may generate false positives in some environments. However, if such activity is unusual in your environment, it is highly suspicious and warrants immediate investigation.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential CommandLine Obfuscation Using Unicode Characters From Suspicious Image
properties.description:
Detects potential commandline obfuscation using unicode characters.
Adversaries may attempt to make an executable or file difficult to discover or analyze by encrypting, encoding, or otherwise obfuscating its contents on the system or in transit.
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Josh Nickels

properties.name: Renamed Cloudflared.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "cloudflared" binary.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Terminal Service Process Spawn
properties.description: Detects a process spawned by the terminal service server process (this could be an indicator for an exploitation of CVE-2019-0708)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Hacktool - EDR-Freeze Execution
properties.description:
Detects execution of EDR-Freeze, a tool that exploits the MiniDumpWriteDump function and WerFaultSecure.exe to suspend EDR and Antivirus processes on Windows.
EDR-Freeze leverages a race-condition attack to put security processes into a dormant state by suspending WerFaultSecure at the moment it freezes the target process.
This technique does not require kernel-level exploits or BYOVD, but instead abuses user-mode functionality to temporarily disable monitoring by EDR or Antimalware solutions.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Add Potential Suspicious New Download Source To Winget
properties.description: Detects usage of winget to add new potentially suspicious download sources
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Visual Studio Code Tunnel Execution
properties.description: Detects Visual Studio Code tunnel execution. Attackers can abuse this functionality to establish a C2 channel
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), citron_ninja

properties.name: Enumerate All Information With Whoami.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of "whoami.exe" with the "/all" flag
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: TrustedPath UAC Bypass Pattern
properties.description: Detects indicators of a UAC bypass method by mocking directories
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Service Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description:
An adversary might use WMI to check if a certain remote service is running on a remote device.
When the test completes, a service information will be displayed on the screen if it exists.
A common feedback message is that "No instance(s) Available" if the service queried is not running.
A common error message is "Node - (provided IP or default) ERROR Description =The RPC server is unavailable" if the provided remote host is unreachable
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uninstall Crowdstrike Falcon Sensor
properties.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by uninstalling Crowdstrike Falcon
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Cloudflared Quick Tunnel Execution
properties.description:
Detects creation of an ad-hoc Cloudflare Quick Tunnel, which can be used to tunnel local services such as HTTP, RDP, SSH and SMB.
The free TryCloudflare Quick Tunnel will generate a random subdomain on trycloudflare[.]com, following a call to api[.]trycloudflare[.]com.
The tool has been observed in use by threat groups including Akira ransomware.
properties.author: Sajid Nawaz Khan

properties.name: Renamed Office Binary Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed office binary
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Backup Deleted Via Wbadmin.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the deletion of backups or system state backups via "wbadmin.exe".
This technique is used by numerous ransomware families and actors.
This may only be successful on server platforms that have Windows Backup enabled.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Reg Add Suspicious Paths
properties.description: Detects when an adversary uses the reg.exe utility to add or modify new keys or subkeys
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Name As GUID
properties.description: Detects creation of a scheduled task with a GUID like name
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Microsoft IIS Connection Strings Decryption
properties.description: Detects use of aspnet_regiis to decrypt Microsoft IIS connection strings. An attacker with Microsoft IIS web server access via a webshell or alike can decrypt and dump any hardcoded connection strings, such as the MSSQL service account password using aspnet_regiis command.
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific - ProcessCreation
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - CreateMiniDump Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of CreateMiniDump hack tool used to dump the LSASS process memory for credential extraction on the attacker's machine
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Time Travel Debugging Utility Usage
properties.description: Detects usage of Time Travel Debugging Utility. Adversaries can execute malicious processes and dump processes, such as lsass.exe, via tttracer.exe.
properties.author: Ensar amil, @sblmsrsn, @oscd_initiative

properties.name: Imports Registry Key From a File
properties.description: Detects the import of the specified file to the registry with regedit.exe.
properties.author: Oddvar Moe, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Rundll32 Invoking Inline VBScript
properties.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that invokes inline VBScript as seen being used by UNC2452
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Spool Service Child Process
properties.description: Detects suspicious print spool service (spoolsv.exe) child processes.
properties.author: Justin C. (@endisphotic), @dreadphones (detection), Thomas Patzke (Sigma rule)

properties.name: Deletion of Volume Shadow Copies via WMI with PowerShell
properties.description: Detects deletion of Windows Volume Shadow Copies with PowerShell code and Get-WMIObject. This technique is used by numerous ransomware families such as Sodinokibi/REvil
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Type With High Privileges
properties.description: Detects scheduled task creations or modification to be run with high privileges on a suspicious schedule type
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disable Windows IIS HTTP Logging
properties.description: Disables HTTP logging on a Windows IIS web server as seen by Threat Group 3390 (Bronze Union)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Fsutil Drive Enumeration
properties.description: Attackers may leverage fsutil to enumerated connected drives.
properties.author: Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE '@scythe_io'

properties.name: Visual Studio Code Tunnel Shell Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a shell (powershell, bash, wsl...) via Visual Studio Code tunnel. Attackers can abuse this functionality to establish a C2 channel and execute arbitrary commands on the system.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: User Discovery And Export Via Get-ADUser Cmdlet
properties.description: Detects usage of the Get-ADUser cmdlet to collect user information and output it to a file
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Service Started/Stopped Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of wmic to start or stop a service
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Download From Direct IP Via Bitsadmin
properties.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file using an URL that contains an IP
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Permission Check Via Accesschk.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of the "Accesschk" utility, an access and privilege audit tool developed by SysInternal and often being abused by attacker to verify process privileges
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Mangatas Tondang, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Calculator Usage
properties.description: Detects suspicious use of 'calc.exe' with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Rundll32 Execution With DLL Stored In ADS
properties.description: Detects execution of rundll32 where the DLL being called is stored in an Alternate Data Stream (ADS).
properties.author: Harjot Singh, '@cyb3rjy0t'

properties.name: Directory Removal Via Rmdir
properties.description:
Detects execution of the builtin "rmdir" command in order to delete directories.
Adversaries may delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity.
Malware, tools, or other non-native files dropped or created on a system by an adversary may leave traces to indicate to what was done within a network and how.
Removal of these files can occur during an intrusion, or as part of a post-intrusion process to minimize the adversary's footprint.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Renamed Plink Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed version of the Plink binary
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Download Via Bitsadmin
properties.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file
properties.author: Michael Haag, FPT.EagleEye

properties.name: Potential WinAPI Calls Via CommandLine
properties.description: Detects the use of WinAPI Functions via the commandline. As seen used by threat actors via the tool winapiexec
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - TacticalRMM Agent Registration to Potentially Attacker-Controlled Server
properties.description:
Detects TacticalRMM agent installations where the --api, --auth, and related flags are used on the command line.
These parameters configure the agent to connect to a specific RMM server with authentication, client ID, and site ID.
This technique could indicate a threat actor attempting to register the agent with an attacker-controlled RMM infrastructure silently.
properties.author: Ahmed Nosir (@egycondor)

properties.name: Windows Recall Feature Enabled Via Reg.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the enabling of the Windows Recall feature via registry manipulation.
Windows Recall can be enabled by deleting the existing "DisableAIDataAnalysis" value, or setting it to 0.
Adversaries may enable Windows Recall as part of post-exploitation discovery and collection activities.
This rule assumes that Recall is already explicitly disabled on the host, and subsequently enabled by the adversary.
properties.author: Sajid Nawaz Khan

properties.name: Use of UltraVNC Remote Access Software
properties.description: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software,to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious WebDAV LNK Execution
properties.description: Detects possible execution via LNK file accessed on a WebDAV server.
properties.author: Micah Babinski

properties.name: Renamed FTP.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "ftp.exe" binary based on the PE metadata fields
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community

properties.name: Potential PowerShell Console History Access Attempt via History File
properties.description:
Detects potential access attempts to the PowerShell console history directly via history file (ConsoleHost_history.txt).
This can give access to plaintext passwords used in PowerShell commands or used for general reconnaissance.
properties.author: Luc Gnaux

properties.name: Suspicious Explorer Process with Whitespace Padding - ClickFix/FileFix
properties.description:
Detects process creation with suspicious whitespace padding followed by a '#' character, which may indicate ClickFix or FileFix techniques used to conceal malicious commands from visual inspection.
ClickFix and FileFix are social engineering attack techniques where adversaries distribute phishing documents or malicious links that deceive users into opening the Windows Run dialog box or File Explorer search bar.
The victims are then instructed to paste commands from their clipboard, which contain extensive whitespace padding using various Unicode space characters to push the actual malicious command far to the right, effectively hiding it from immediate view.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Process Masquerading As SvcHost.EXE
properties.description:
Detects a suspicious process that is masquerading as the legitimate "svchost.exe" by naming its binary "svchost.exe" and executing from an uncommon location.
Adversaries often disguise their malicious binaries by naming them after legitimate system processes like "svchost.exe" to evade detection.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Phishing Pattern ISO in Archive
properties.description: Detects cases in which an ISO files is opend within an archiver like 7Zip or Winrar, which is a sign of phishing as threat actors put small ISO files in archives as email attachments to bypass certain filters and protective measures (mark of web)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Screen Capture Activity Via Psr.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of Windows Problem Steps Recorder (psr.exe), a utility used to record the user screen and clicks.
properties.author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of ClickOnce Application
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of a ClickOnce deployment application
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Install New Package Via Winget Local Manifest
properties.description:
Detects usage of winget to install applications via manifest file. Adversaries can abuse winget to download payloads remotely and execute them.
The manifest option enables you to install an application by passing in a YAML file directly to the client.
Winget can be used to download and install exe, msi or msix files later.
properties.author: Sreeman, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Dynamic .NET Compilation Via Csc.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "csc.exe" to compile .NET code. Attackers often leverage this to compile code on the fly and use it in other stages.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Cloudflared Portable Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the "cloudflared" binary from a non standard location.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Outlook Child Process
properties.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from an Outlook process.
properties.author: Michael Haag, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Elastic, FPT.EagleEye Team

properties.name: Suspicious WebDav Client Execution Via Rundll32.EXE
properties.description: Detects "svchost.exe" spawning "rundll32.exe" with command arguments like C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie. This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on WebDav Server) or potentially a sign of exploitation of CVE-2023-23397
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Credential Dumping Via WER
properties.description: Detects potential credential dumping via Windows Error Reporting LSASS Shtinkering technique which uses the Windows Error Reporting to dump lsass
properties.author: @pbssubhash , Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Renamed AdFind Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of a renamed Adfind.exe. AdFind continues to be seen across majority of breaches. It is used to domain trust discovery to plan out subsequent steps in the attack chain.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Automated Collection Command Prompt
properties.description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Certificate Exported Via PowerShell
properties.description: Detects calls to cmdlets that are used to export certificates from the local certificate store. Threat actors were seen abusing this to steal private keys from compromised machines.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed Visual Studio Code Tunnel Execution
properties.description: Detects renamed Visual Studio Code tunnel execution. Attackers can abuse this functionality to establish a C2 channel
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Encryption Using Gpg4win
properties.description: Detects usage of Gpg4win to encrypt files
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Detected Windows Software Discovery
properties.description: Adversaries may attempt to enumerate software for a variety of reasons, such as figuring out what security measures are present or if the compromised system has a version of software that is vulnerable.
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Insecure Proxy/DOH Transfer Via Curl.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "insecure" flag over proxy or DOH.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Suspicious Activity Using SeCEdit
properties.description: Detects potential suspicious behaviour using secedit.exe. Such as exporting or modifying the security policy
properties.author: Janantha Marasinghe

properties.name: Service Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on services registry key. Often used by attacker to remove AV software services
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Wsudo Suspicious Execution
properties.description: Detects usage of wsudo (Windows Sudo Utility). Which is a tool that let the user execute programs with different permissions (System, Trusted Installer, Administrator...etc)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Dropper Script Execution Via WScript/CScript
properties.description: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories
properties.author: Margaritis Dimitrios (idea), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Types
properties.description: Detects scheduled task creations or modification on a suspicious schedule type
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - LocalPotato Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of the LocalPotato POC based on basic PE metadata information and default CLI examples
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Homoglyph Attack Using Lookalike Characters
properties.description:
Detects the presence of unicode characters which are homoglyphs, or identical in appearance, to ASCII letter characters.
This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques. Only "perfect" homoglyphs are included; these are characters that
are indistinguishable from ASCII characters and thus may make excellent candidates for homoglyph attack characters.
properties.author: Micah Babinski, @micahbabinski

properties.name: Program Executed Using Proxy/Local Command Via SSH.EXE
properties.description: Detect usage of the "ssh.exe" binary as a proxy to launch other programs.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Wlrmdr.EXE Uncommon Argument Or Child Process
properties.description:
Detects the execution of "Wlrmdr.exe" with the "-u" command line flag which allows anything passed to it to be an argument of the ShellExecute API, which would allow an attacker to execute arbitrary binaries.
This detection also focuses on any uncommon child processes spawned from "Wlrmdr.exe" as a supplement for those that posses "ParentImage" telemetry.
properties.author: frack113, manasmbellani

properties.name: Domain Trust Discovery Via Dsquery
properties.description: Detects execution of "dsquery.exe" for domain trust discovery
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus, Tony Lambert, oscd.community, omkar72

properties.name: Suspicious Modification Of Scheduled Tasks
properties.description:
Detects when an attacker tries to modify an already existing scheduled tasks to run from a suspicious location
Attackers can create a simple looking task in order to avoid detection on creation as it's often the most focused on
Instead they modify the task after creation to include their malicious payload
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: User Added To Highly Privileged Group
properties.description: Detects addition of users to highly privileged groups via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Nimgrab Execution
properties.description: Detects the usage of nimgrab, a tool bundled with the Nim programming framework and used for downloading files.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Psexec Execution
properties.description: Detects user accept agreement execution in psexec commandline
properties.author: omkar72

properties.name: NtdllPipe Like Activity Execution
properties.description: Detects command that type the content of ntdll.dll to a different file or a pipe in order to evade AV / EDR detection. As seen being used in the POC NtdllPipe
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Notepad Password Files Discovery
properties.description: Detects the execution of Notepad to open a file that has the string "password" which may indicate unauthorized access to credentials or suspicious activity.
properties.author: The DFIR Report

properties.name: RunMRU Registry Key Deletion
properties.description:
Detects deletion of the RunMRU registry key, which stores the history of commands executed via the Run dialog.
In the clickfix techniques, the phishing lures instruct users to open a run dialog through (Win + R) and execute malicious commands.
Adversaries may delete this key to cover their tracks after executing commands.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Execution
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Registry Export of Third-Party Credentials
properties.description:
Detects the use of reg.exe to export registry paths associated with third-party credentials.
Credential stealers have been known to use this technique to extract sensitive information from the registry.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Malicious PE Execution by Microsoft Visual Studio Debugger
properties.description:
There is an option for a MS VS Just-In-Time Debugger "vsjitdebugger.exe" to launch specified executable and attach a debugger.
This option may be used adversaries to execute malicious code by signed verified binary.
The debugger is installed alongside with Microsoft Visual Studio package.
properties.author: Agro (@agro_sev), Ensar amil (@sblmsrsn), oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Shells Spawn by Java Utility Keytool
properties.description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from Java utility keytool process (e.g. adselfservice plus exploitation)
properties.author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of WinRAR.EXE
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of WinRAR.exe.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Wscript Shell Run In CommandLine
properties.description: Detects the presence of the keywords "Wscript", "Shell" and "Run" in the command, which could indicate a suspicious activity
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential AMSI Bypass Via .NET Reflection
properties.description: Detects Request to "amsiInitFailed" that can be used to disable AMSI Scanning
properties.author: Markus Neis, @Kostastsale

properties.name: Rundll32 Execution Without CommandLine Parameters
properties.description: Detects suspicious start of rundll32.exe without any parameters as found in CobaltStrike beacon activity
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Hydra Password Bruteforce Execution
properties.description: Detects command line parameters used by Hydra password guessing hack tool
properties.author: Vasiliy Burov

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Invocation From Script Engines
properties.description: Detects suspicious powershell invocations from interpreters or unusual programs
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential CommandLine Path Traversal Via Cmd.EXE
properties.description: Detects potential path traversal attempt via cmd.exe. Could indicate possible command/argument confusion/hijacking
properties.author: xknow @xknow_infosec, Tim Shelton

properties.name: HackTool - EDRSilencer Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of EDRSilencer, a tool that leverages Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) to block Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents from reporting security events to the server based on PE metadata information.
properties.author: @gott_cyber

properties.name: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command
properties.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Execution From Parent Process In Public Folder
properties.description: Detects a potentially suspicious execution of a parent process located in the "\Users\Public" folder executing a child process containing references to shell or scripting binaries and commandlines.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Msiexec Execute Arbitrary DLL
properties.description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using NTFS Reparse Point - Process
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using NTFS reparse point and wusa.exe DLL hijacking (UACMe 36)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: VMToolsd Suspicious Child Process
properties.description: Detects suspicious child process creations of VMware Tools process which may indicate persistence setup
properties.author: bohops, Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Service StartupType Change Via PowerShell Set-Service
properties.description: Detects the use of the PowerShell "Set-Service" cmdlet to change the startup type of a service to "disabled" or "manual"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Logon Scripts - CommandLine
properties.description: Detects the addition of a new LogonScript to the registry value "UserInitMprLogonScript" for potential persistence
properties.author: Tom Ueltschi (@c_APT_ure)

properties.name: Renamed NirCmd.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "NirCmd.exe" binary based on the PE metadata fields.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Mpclient.DLL Sideloading Via Defender Binaries
properties.description: Detects potential sideloading of "mpclient.dll" by Windows Defender processes ("MpCmdRun" and "NisSrv") from their non-default directory.
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Potential PowerShell Execution Policy Tampering - ProcCreation
properties.description: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy registry key in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution from the CommandLine
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Amazon SSM Agent Hijacking
properties.description: Detects potential Amazon SSM agent hijack attempts as outlined in the Mitiga research report.
properties.author: Muhammad Faisal

properties.name: Local File Read Using Curl.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "file://" protocol handler in order to read local files.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SharpChisel Execution
properties.description: Detects usage of the Sharp Chisel via the commandline arguments
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Network Sniffing Activity Using Network Tools
properties.description:
Detects potential network sniffing via use of network tools such as "tshark", "windump".
Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection.
An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Powershell ReverseShell Connection
properties.description: Detects usage of the "TcpClient" class. Which can be abused to establish remote connections and reverse-shells. As seen used by the Nishang "Invoke-PowerShellTcpOneLine" reverse shell and other.
properties.author: FPT.EagleEye, wagga, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Suspicious Windows Feature Enabled - ProcCreation
properties.description:
Detects usage of the built-in PowerShell cmdlet "Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature" used as a Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool.
Similar to DISM.exe, this cmdlet is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Curl.EXE Download
properties.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Registry Manipulation via WMI Stdregprov
properties.description:
Detects the usage of wmic.exe to manipulate Windows registry via the WMI StdRegProv class.
This behaviour could be potentially suspicious because it uses an alternative method to modify registry keys instead of legitimate registry tools like reg.exe or regedit.exe.
Attackers specifically choose this technique to evade detection and bypass security monitoring focused on traditional registry modification commands.
properties.author: Daniel Koifman (KoifSec)

properties.name: Recon Command Output Piped To Findstr.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the execution of a potential recon command where the results are piped to "findstr". This is meant to trigger on inline calls of "cmd.exe" via the "/c" or "/k" for example.
Attackers often time use this technique to extract specific information they require in their reconnaissance phase.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: PowerShell Script Run in AppData
properties.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that invokes PowerShell with reference to an AppData folder
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Process Launched Without Image Name
properties.description: Detect the use of processes with no name (".exe"), which can be used to evade Image-based detections.
properties.author: Matt Anderson (Huntress)

properties.name: HackTool - CrackMapExec Process Patterns
properties.description: Detects suspicious process patterns found in logs when CrackMapExec is used
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Password Provided In Command Line Of Net.EXE
properties.description: Detects a when net.exe is called with a password in the command line
properties.author: Tim Shelton (HAWK.IO)

properties.name: Suspicious Windows Trace ETW Session Tamper Via Logman.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of "logman" utility in order to disable or delete Windows trace sessions
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed Mavinject.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed version of the "Mavinject" process. Which can be abused to perform process injection using the "/INJECTRUNNING" flag
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth

properties.name: Suspicious File Downloaded From File-Sharing Website Via Certutil.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files from file-sharing websites.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Binary In User Directory Spawned From Office Application
properties.description: Detects an executable in the users directory started from one of the Microsoft Office suite applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio)
properties.author: Jason Lynch

properties.name: HackTool - PPID Spoofing SelectMyParent Tool Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of parent process ID spoofing tools like Didier Stevens tool SelectMyParent
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SharpImpersonation Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of the SharpImpersonation tool. Which can be used to manipulate tokens on a Windows computers remotely (PsExec/WmiExec) or interactively
properties.author: Sai Prashanth Pulisetti @pulisettis, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Data Export From MSSQL Table Via BCP.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the execution of the BCP utility in order to export data from the database.
Attackers were seen saving their malware to a database column or table and then later extracting it via "bcp.exe" into a file.
properties.author: Omar Khaled (@beacon_exe), MahirAli Khan (in/mahiralikhan), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Winrs Local Command Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of Winrs.exe where it is used to execute commands locally.
Commands executed this way are launched under Winrshost.exe and can represent proxy execution used for defense evasion or lateral movement.
properties.author: Liran Ravich, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Esentutl Steals Browser Information
properties.description: One way Qbot steals sensitive information is by extracting browser data from Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge by using the built-in utility esentutl.exe
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PUA - Fast Reverse Proxy (FRP) Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of Fast Reverse Proxy. frp is a fast reverse proxy to help you expose a local server behind a NAT or firewall to the Internet.
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth

properties.name: AgentExecutor PowerShell Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of the AgentExecutor.exe binary. Which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute powershell scripts with the ExecutionPolicy "Bypass" or any binary named "powershell.exe" located in the path provided by 6th positional argument
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), memory-shards

properties.name: Deny Service Access Using Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE
properties.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to deny access to a service that affects critical trustees. This can be used to hide services or make them unstoppable.
properties.author: Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious HH.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects a suspicious execution of a Microsoft HTML Help (HH.exe)
properties.author: Maxim Pavlunin

properties.name: RDP Port Forwarding Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of netsh to configure a port forwarding of port 3389 (RDP) rule
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community

properties.name: MpiExec Lolbin
properties.description: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by mpiexec.exe LOLBIN from HPC pack that can be used to execute any other binary
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Usage Of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe)
properties.description: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe to perform different actions such as restoring snapshots...etc.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SOAPHound Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of SOAPHound, a .NET tool for collecting Active Directory data, using specific command-line arguments that may indicate an attempt to extract sensitive AD information.
properties.author: @kostastsale

properties.name: Findstr GPP Passwords
properties.description: Look for the encrypted cpassword value within Group Policy Preference files on the Domain Controller. This value can be decrypted with gpp-decrypt.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Execution of Sysinternals Tools
properties.description: Detects command lines that contain the 'accepteula' flag which could be a sign of execution of one of the Sysinternals tools
properties.author: Markus Neis

properties.name: Suspicious Process Start Locations
properties.description: Detects suspicious process run from unusual locations
properties.author: juju4, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Obfuscated PowerShell Code
properties.description: Detects suspicious UTF16 and base64 encoded and often obfuscated PowerShell code often used in command lines
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Data Copied To Clipboard Via Clip.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of clip.exe in order to copy data to the clipboard. Adversaries may collect data stored in the clipboard from users copying information within or between applications.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious IIS URL GlobalRules Rewrite Via AppCmd
properties.description: Detects usage of "appcmd" to create new global URL rewrite rules. This behaviour has been observed being used by threat actors to add new rules so they can access their webshells.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: MMC Spawning Windows Shell
properties.description: Detects a Windows command line executable started from MMC
properties.author: Karneades, Swisscom CSIRT

properties.name: Arbitrary File Download Via MSOHTMED.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of "MSOHTMED" to download arbitrary files
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Compressed File Creation Via Tar.EXE
properties.description:
Detects execution of "tar.exe" in order to create a compressed file.
Adversaries may abuse various utilities to compress or encrypt data before exfiltration.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), AdmU3

properties.name: DNS Exfiltration and Tunneling Tools Execution
properties.description: Well-known DNS Exfiltration tools execution
properties.author: Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: Conhost.exe CommandLine Path Traversal
properties.description: detects the usage of path traversal in conhost.exe indicating possible command/argument confusion/hijacking
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Tampering Via Bcdedit.EXE
properties.description: Detects potential malicious and unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe
properties.author: @neu5ron

properties.name: HackTool - Mimikatz Execution
properties.description: Detection well-known mimikatz command line arguments
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community, David ANDRE (additional keywords), Tim Shelton

properties.name: Launch-VsDevShell.PS1 Proxy Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of the 'Launch-VsDevShell.ps1' Microsoft signed script to execute commands.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Remote Desktop Tunneling
properties.description: Detects potential use of an SSH utility to establish RDP over a reverse SSH Tunnel. This can be used by attackers to enable routing of network packets that would otherwise not reach their intended destination.
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Uncommon One Time Only Scheduled Task At 00:00
properties.description: Detects scheduled task creation events that include suspicious actions, and is run once at 00:00
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Schtasks Creation Or Modification With SYSTEM Privileges
properties.description: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Driver Install by pnputil.exe
properties.description: Detects when a possible suspicious driver is being installed via pnputil.exe lolbin
properties.author: Hai Vaknin @LuxNoBulIshit, Avihay eldad  @aloneliassaf, Austin Songer @austinsonger

properties.name: REGISTER_APP.VBS Proxy Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of a Microsoft signed script 'REGISTER_APP.VBS' to register a VSS/VDS Provider as a COM+ application.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Ie4uinit Lolbin Use From Invalid Path
properties.description: Detect use of ie4uinit.exe to execute commands from a specially prepared ie4uinit.inf file from a directory other than the usual directories
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: AddinUtil.EXE Execution From Uncommon Directory
properties.description: Detects execution of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) from a non-standard directory.
properties.author: Michael McKinley (@McKinleyMike), Tony Latteri (@TheLatteri)

properties.name: Potential Reconnaissance For Cached Credentials Via Cmdkey.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials on the system
properties.author: jmallette, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Dumpert Process Dumper Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of Dumpert process dumper, which dumps the lsass.exe process memory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using IDiagnostic Profile
properties.description: Detects the "IDiagnosticProfileUAC" UAC bypass technique
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential PowerShell Downgrade Attack
properties.description: Detects PowerShell downgrade attack by comparing the host versions with the actually used engine version 2.0
properties.author: Harish Segar (rule)

properties.name: File Download via CertOC.EXE
properties.description: Detects when a user downloads a file by using CertOC.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - Potential MeshAgent Execution - Windows
properties.description:
Detects potential execution of MeshAgent which is a tool used for remote access.
Historical data shows that threat actors rename MeshAgent binary to evade detection.
Matching command lines with the '--meshServiceName' argument can indicate that the MeshAgent is being used for remote access.
properties.author: Norbert Janiewicz (AlphaSOC)

properties.name: Netsh Allow Group Policy on Microsoft Defender Firewall
properties.description: Adversaries may modify system firewalls in order to bypass controls limiting network usage
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets
properties.description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via CommandLine
properties.author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573, Endgame, JHasenbusch, oscd.community, Austin Songer @austinsonger

properties.name: Potential Defense Evasion Via Rename Of Highly Relevant Binaries
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.
properties.author: Matthew Green - @mgreen27, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - Simple Help Execution
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Tampering With RDP Related Registry Keys Via Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of "reg.exe" for enabling/disabling the RDP service on the host by tampering with the 'CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server' values
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems), @Kostastsale, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: Scheduled Task Executing Encoded Payload from Registry
properties.description: Detects the creation of a schtask that potentially executes a base64 encoded payload stored in the Windows Registry using PowerShell.
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems), @Kostastsale, TheDFIRReport, X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Service Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE
properties.description: Detection of sc.exe utility adding a new service with special permission which hides that service.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Virtualbox Driver Installation or Starting of VMs
properties.description: Adversaries can carry out malicious operations using a virtual instance to avoid detection. This rule is built to detect the registration of the Virtualbox driver or start of a Virtualbox VM.
properties.author: Janantha Marasinghe

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Command Targeting Teams Sensitive Files
properties.description:
Detects a commandline containing references to the Microsoft Teams database or cookies files from a process other than Teams.
The database might contain authentication tokens and other sensitive information about the logged in accounts.
properties.author: @SerkinValery

properties.name: Process Memory Dump Via Comsvcs.DLL
properties.description: Detects a process memory dump via "comsvcs.dll" using rundll32, covering multiple different techniques (ordinal, minidump function, etc.)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Modexp, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Htran/NATBypass Execution
properties.description: Detects executable names or flags used by Htran or Htran-like tools (e.g. NATBypass)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - UACMe Akagi Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of UACMe, a tool used for UAC bypasses, via default PE metadata
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Firewall Rule Deleted Via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Detects the removal of a port or application rule in the Windows Firewall configuration using netsh
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PowerShell SAM Copy
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell scripts accessing SAM hives
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Bad Opsec Defaults Sacrificial Processes With Improper Arguments
properties.description:
Detects attackers using tooling with bad opsec defaults.
E.g. spawning a sacrificial process to inject a capability into the process without taking into account how the process is normally run.
One trivial example of this is using rundll32.exe without arguments as a sacrificial process (default in CS, now highlighted by c2lint), running WerFault without arguments (Kraken - credit am0nsec), and other examples.
properties.author: Oleg Kolesnikov @securonix invrep_de, oscd.community, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious NTLM Authentication on the Printer Spooler Service
properties.description: Detects a privilege elevation attempt by coercing NTLM authentication on the Printer Spooler service
properties.author: Elastic (idea), Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious RunAs-Like Flag Combination
properties.description: Detects suspicious command line flags that let the user set a target user and command as e.g. seen in PsExec-like tools
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via Microsoft Compatibility Appraiser
properties.description:
Detects manual execution of the "Microsoft Compatibility Appraiser" task via schtasks.
In order to trigger persistence stored in the "\AppCompatFlags\TelemetryController" registry key.
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: Suspicious Windows Defender Registry Key Tampering Via Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Always Install Elevated MSI Spawned Cmd And Powershell
properties.description: Detects Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) spawning "cmd" or "powershell"
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Mangatas Tondang (rule), oscd.community

properties.name: File Explorer Folder Opened Using Explorer Folder Shortcut Via Shell
properties.description: Detects the initial execution of "cmd.exe" which spawns "explorer.exe" with the appropriate command line arguments for opening the "My Computer" folder.
properties.author: @Kostastsale

properties.name: Suspicious Process Execution From Fake Recycle.Bin Folder
properties.description: Detects process execution from a fake recycle bin folder, often used to avoid security solution.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: RunDLL32 Spawning Explorer
properties.description: Detects RunDLL32.exe spawning explorer.exe as child, which is very uncommon, often observes Gamarue spawning the explorer.exe process in an unusual way
properties.author: elhoim, CD_ROM_

properties.name: Writing Of Malicious Files To The Fonts Folder
properties.description: Monitors for the hiding possible malicious files in the C:\Windows\Fonts\ location. This folder doesn't require admin privillege to be written and executed from.
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: Process Access via TrolleyExpress Exclusion
properties.description: Detects a possible process memory dump that uses the white-listed Citrix TrolleyExpress.exe filename as a way to dump the lsass process memory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Mstsc.EXE Execution With Local RDP File
properties.description: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file located in suspicious locations.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential SSH Tunnel Persistence Install Using A Scheduled Task
properties.description: Detects the creation of new scheduled tasks via commandline, using Schtasks.exe. This rule detects tasks creating that call OpenSSH, which may indicate the creation of reverse SSH tunnel to the attacker's server.
properties.author: Rory Duncan

properties.name: Use of Remote.exe
properties.description: Remote.exe is part of WinDbg in the Windows SDK and can be used for AWL bypass and running remote files.
properties.author: Christopher Peacock @SecurePeacock, SCYTHE @scythe_io

properties.name: PsExec Service Execution
properties.description: Detects launch of the PSEXESVC service, which means that this system was the target of a psexec remote execution
properties.author: Thomas Patzke, Romaissa Adjailia, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Network Trace Capture Started Via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of netsh with the "trace" flag in order to start a network capture
properties.author: Kutepov Anton, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Reg Add Open Command
properties.description: Threat actors performed dumping of SAM, SECURITY and SYSTEM registry hives using DelegateExecute key
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PsExec/PAExec Escalation to LOCAL SYSTEM
properties.description: Detects suspicious commandline flags used by PsExec and PAExec to escalate a command line to LOCAL_SYSTEM rights
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Net WebClient Casing Anomalies
properties.description: Detects PowerShell command line contents that include a suspicious abnormal casing in the Net.Webclient (e.g. nEt.WEbCliEnT) string as used in obfuscation techniques
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential PowerShell Command Line Obfuscation
properties.description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton (fp)

properties.name: Uncommon Userinit Child Process
properties.description: Detects uncommon "userinit.exe" child processes, which could be a sign of uncommon shells or login scripts used for persistence.
properties.author: Tom Ueltschi (@c_APT_ure), Tim Shelton

properties.name: Security Privileges Enumeration Via Whoami.EXE
properties.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed with the /priv command line flag instructing the tool to show all current user privileges. This is often used after a privilege escalation attempt.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious CMD Shell Output Redirect
properties.description:
Detects inline Windows shell commands redirecting output via the ">" symbol to a suspicious location.
This technique is sometimes used by malicious actors in order to redirect the output of reconnaissance commands such as "hostname" and "dir" to files for future exfiltration.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Sysinternals PsSuspend Execution
properties.description: Detects usage of Sysinternals PsSuspend which can be abused to suspend critical processes
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Hardware Model Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of WMIC with the "csproduct" which is used to obtain information such as hardware models and vendor information
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Fake Instance Of Hxtsr.EXE Executed
properties.description:
HxTsr.exe is a Microsoft compressed executable file called Microsoft Outlook Communications.
HxTsr.exe is part of Outlook apps, because it resides in a hidden "WindowsApps" subfolder of "C:\Program Files".
Any instances of hxtsr.exe not in this folder may be malware camouflaging itself as HxTsr.exe
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: Fsutil Suspicious Invocation
properties.description:
Detects suspicious parameters of fsutil (deleting USN journal, configuring it with small size, etc).
Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others).
properties.author: Ecco, E.M. Anhaus, oscd.community

properties.name: Active Directory Structure Export Via Ldifde.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of "ldifde.exe" in order to export organizational Active Directory structure.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Adidnsdump Execution
properties.description:
This tool enables enumeration and exporting of all DNS records in the zone for recon purposes of internal networks Python 3 and python.exe must be installed,
Usee to Query/modify DNS records for Active Directory integrated DNS via LDAP
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Process Created Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects WMIC executing "process call create" with suspicious calls to processes such as "rundll32", "regsrv32", etc.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed PAExec Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of renamed version of PAExec. Often used by attackers
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jason Lynch

properties.name: Winrar Compressing Dump Files
properties.description: Detects execution of WinRAR in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Windows Defender AV Bypass Via Dump64.EXE Rename
properties.description:
Detects when a user is potentially trying to bypass the Windows Defender AV by renaming a tool to dump64.exe and placing it in the Visual Studio folder.
Currently the rule is covering only usage of procdump but other utilities can be added in order to increase coverage.
properties.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - NimScan Execution
properties.description:
Detects usage of NimScan, a portscanner utility.
In early 2025, adversaries were observed using this utility to scan for open ports on remote hosts in a compromised environment.
This rule identifies the execution of NimScan based on the process image name and specific hash values associated with different versions of the tool.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Credential Manager Access via VaultCmd
properties.description: List credentials currently stored in Windows Credential Manager via the native Windows utility vaultcmd.exe
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Ruby Inline Command Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of ruby using the "-e" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live ruby code.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Add SafeBoot Keys Via Reg Utility
properties.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "add" or "copy" flags on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to allow the ransomware to work in safe mode as some security products do not
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: LOL-Binary Copied From System Directory
