properties.description: Detects a suspicious copy operation that tries to copy a known LOLBIN from system (System32, SysWOW64, WinSxS) directories to another on disk in order to bypass detections based on locations.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass WSReset
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass via WSReset usable by default sysmon-config
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Rundll32.EXE Execution of UDL File
properties.description:
Detects the execution of rundll32.exe with the oledb32.dll library to open a UDL file.
Threat actors can abuse this technique as a phishing vector to capture authentication credentials or other sensitive data.
properties.author: @kostastsale

properties.name: Suspicious Network Command
properties.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems
properties.author: frack113, Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE '@scythe_io'

properties.name: Potential Signing Bypass Via Windows Developer Features
properties.description: Detects when a user enable developer features such as "Developer Mode" or "Application Sideloading". Which allows the user to install untrusted packages.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: System Network Connections Discovery Via Net.EXE
properties.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of network connections to or from the compromised system they are currently accessing or from remote systems by querying for information over the network.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: MSExchange Transport Agent Installation
properties.description: Detects the Installation of a Exchange Transport Agent
properties.author: Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious SYSVOL Domain Group Policy Access
properties.description: Detects Access to Domain Group Policies stored in SYSVOL
properties.author: Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: New DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Installed Via Dnscmd.EXE
properties.description: Detects the installation of a DNS plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Sysmon Configuration Update
properties.description: Detects updates to Sysmon's configuration. Attackers might update or replace the Sysmon configuration with a bare bone one to avoid monitoring without shutting down the service completely
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Kernel Dump Using Dtrace
properties.description: Detects suspicious way to dump the kernel on Windows systems using dtrace.exe, which is available on Windows systems since Windows 10 19H1
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: SQLite Chromium Profile Data DB Access
properties.description: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Chromium-based browsers for potential data stealing.
properties.author: TropChaud

properties.name: HackTool - WinPwn Execution
properties.description: Detects commandline keywords indicative of potential usge of the tool WinPwn. A tool for Windows and Active Directory reconnaissance and exploitation.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: File Download From Browser Process Via Inline URL
properties.description: Detects execution of a browser process with a URL argument pointing to a file with a potentially interesting extension. This can be abused to download arbitrary files or to hide from the user for example by launching the browser in a minimized state.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential ShellDispatch.DLL Functionality Abuse
properties.description: Detects potential "ShellDispatch.dll" functionality abuse to execute arbitrary binaries via "ShellExecute"
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Execute Pcwrun.EXE To Leverage Follina
properties.description: Detects indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant "pcwrun.exe" leveraging the follina (CVE-2022-30190) vulnerability
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Usage Of Qemu
properties.description:
Detects potentially suspicious execution of the Qemu utility in a Windows environment.
Threat actors have leveraged this utility and this technique for achieving network access as reported by Kaspersky.
properties.author: Muhammad Faisal (@faisalusuf), Hunter Juhan (@threatHNTR)

properties.name: Suspicious Persistence Via VMwareToolBoxCmd.EXE VM State Change Script
properties.description: Detects execution of the "VMwareToolBoxCmd.exe" with the "script" and "set" flag to setup a specific script that's located in a potentially suspicious location to run for a specific VM state
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Stop Windows Service Via Sc.EXE
properties.description: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the "sc.exe" utility
properties.author: Jakob Weinzettl, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Base64 Encoded IEX Cmdlet
properties.description: Detects usage of a base64 encoded "IEX" cmdlet in a process command line
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - KrbRelay Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of KrbRelay, a Kerberos relaying tool
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Control Panel DLL Load
properties.description: Detects suspicious Rundll32 execution from control.exe as used by Equation Group and Exploit Kits
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: XBAP Execution From Uncommon Locations Via PresentationHost.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of ".xbap" (Browser Applications) files via PresentationHost.EXE from an uncommon location. These files can be abused to run malicious ".xbap" files any bypass AWL
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - NPS Tunneling Tool Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of NPS, a port forwarding and intranet penetration proxy server
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Application Terminated Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects calls to the "terminate" function via wmic in order to kill an application
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - UltraViewer Execution
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Compress Data and Lock With Password for Exfiltration With 7-ZIP
properties.description: An adversary may compress or encrypt data that is collected prior to exfiltration using 3rd party utilities
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - DInjector PowerShell Cradle Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of the Dinject PowerShell cradle based on the specific flags
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Rundll32 Activity Invoking Sys File
properties.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that includes a *.sys file as seen being used by UNC2452
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Execute Code with Pester.bat as Parent
properties.description: Detects code execution via Pester.bat (Pester - Powershell Modulte for testing)
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Proxy Execution via Vshadow
properties.description:
Detects the invocation of vshadow.exe with the -exec parameter that executes a specified script or command after the shadow copies are created but before the VShadow tool exits.
VShadow is a command-line tool that you can use to create and manage volume shadow copies. While legitimate backup or administrative scripts may use this flag,
attackers can leverage this parameter to proxy the execution of malware.
properties.author: David Faiss

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Piped Password Via CLI
properties.description: Detects piping the password to an anydesk instance via CMD and the '--set-password' flag.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Dropping Of Password Filter DLL
properties.description: Detects dropping of dll files in system32 that may be used to retrieve user credentials from LSASS
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: PUA - Crassus Execution
properties.description: Detects Crassus, a Windows privilege escalation discovery tool, based on PE metadata characteristics.
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Rundll32 UNC Path Execution
properties.description: Detects rundll32 execution where the DLL is located on a remote location (share)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Modify Group Policy Settings
properties.description: Detect malicious GPO modifications can be used to implement many other malicious behaviors.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Arbitrary File Download Via ConfigSecurityPolicy.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the execution of "ConfigSecurityPolicy.EXE", a binary part of Windows Defender used to manage settings in Windows Defender.
Users can configure different pilot collections for each of the co-management workloads.
It can be abused by attackers in order to upload or download files.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Copy .DMP/.DUMP Files From Remote Share Via Cmd.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of the copy builtin cmd command to copy files with the ".dmp"/".dump" extension from a remote share
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Bloodhound/Sharphound Execution
properties.description: Detects command line parameters used by Bloodhound and Sharphound hack tools
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Scheduled Task Executing Payload from Registry
properties.description: Detects the creation of a schtasks that potentially executes a payload stored in the Windows Registry using PowerShell.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Persistence Via VMwareToolBoxCmd.EXE VM State Change Script
properties.description: Detects execution of the "VMwareToolBoxCmd.exe" with the "script" and "set" flag to setup a specific script to run for a specific VM state
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell MSI Install via WindowsInstaller COM From Remote Location
properties.description:
Detects the execution of PowerShell commands that attempt to install MSI packages via the
Windows Installer COM object (`WindowsInstaller.Installer`) hosted remotely.
This could be indication of malicious software deployment or lateral movement attempts using Windows Installer functionality.
And the usage of WindowsInstaller COM object rather than msiexec could be an attempt to bypass the detection.
properties.author: Meroujan Antonyan (vx3r)

properties.name: Network Reconnaissance Activity
properties.description: Detects a set of suspicious network related commands often used in recon stages
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Outlook EnableUnsafeClientMailRules Setting Enabled
properties.description: Detects an attacker trying to enable the outlook security setting "EnableUnsafeClientMailRules" which allows outlook to run applications or execute macros
properties.author: Markus Neis, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed Gpg.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "gpg.exe". Often used by ransomware and loaders to decrypt/encrypt data.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Suspicious MsiExec Embedding Parent
properties.description: Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy the execution of malicious payloads
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - SharpView Execution
properties.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Privilege Escalation Using Symlink Between Osk and Cmd
properties.description: Detects the creation of a symbolic link between "cmd.exe" and the accessibility on-screen keyboard binary (osk.exe) using "mklink". This technique provides an elevated command prompt to the user from the login screen without the need to log in.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: DLL Execution via Rasautou.exe
properties.description: Detects using Rasautou.exe for loading arbitrary .DLL specified in -d option and executes the export specified in -p.
properties.author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community

properties.name: HackTool - SharpDPAPI Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of the SharpDPAPI tool based on CommandLine flags and PE metadata.
SharpDPAPI is a C# port of some DPAPI functionality from the Mimikatz project.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Process Execution From A Potentially Suspicious Folder
properties.description: Detects a potentially suspicious execution from an uncommon folder.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

properties.name: Suspicious Process Patterns NTDS.DIT Exfil
properties.description: Detects suspicious process patterns used in NTDS.DIT exfiltration
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: AspNetCompiler Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of "aspnet_compiler.exe" which can be abused to compile and execute C# code.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PUA - Netcat Suspicious Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of Netcat. Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed CreateDump Utility Execution
properties.description: Detects uses of a renamed legitimate createdump.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Arbitrary MSI Download Via Devinit.EXE
properties.description: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by "devinit.exe", which can be abused as a LOLBIN to download arbitrary MSI packages on a Windows system
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed ZOHO Dctask64 Execution
properties.description:
Detects a renamed "dctask64.exe" execution, a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation part of ManageEngine Endpoint Central.
This binary can be abused for DLL injection, arbitrary command and process execution.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Python Function Execution Security Warning Disabled In Excel
properties.description:
Detects changes to the registry value "PythonFunctionWarnings" that would prevent any warnings or alerts from showing when Python functions are about to be executed.
Threat actors could run malicious code through the new Microsoft Excel feature that allows Python to run within the spreadsheet.
properties.author: @Kostastsale

properties.name: Suspicious Service Binary Directory
properties.description: Detects a service binary running in a suspicious directory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Security Service Disabled Via Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" to disable security services such as Windows Defender.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), John Lambert (idea), elhoim

properties.name: Rar Usage with Password and Compression Level
properties.description: Detects the use of rar.exe, on the command line, to create an archive with password protection or with a specific compression level. This is pretty indicative of malicious actions.
properties.author: @ROxPinTeddy

properties.name: Suspicious Processes Spawned by WinRM
properties.description: Detects suspicious processes including shells spawnd from WinRM host process
properties.author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades), Markus Neis

properties.name: Non-privileged Usage of Reg or Powershell
properties.description: Search for usage of reg or Powershell by non-privileged users to modify service configuration in registry
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Ryan Plas (rule), oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious MSHTA Child Process
properties.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from an "mshta.exe" process, which could be indicative of a malicious HTA script execution
properties.author: Michael Haag

properties.name: Potential Privilege Escalation To LOCAL SYSTEM
properties.description: Detects unknown program using commandline flags usually used by tools such as PsExec and PAExec to start programs with SYSTEM Privileges
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential DLL Injection Via AccCheckConsole
properties.description:
Detects the execution "AccCheckConsole" a command-line tool for verifying the accessibility implementation of an application's UI.
One of the tests that this checker can run are called "verification routine", which tests for things like Consistency, Navigation, etc.
The tool allows a user to provide a DLL that can contain a custom "verification routine". An attacker can build such DLLs and pass it via the CLI, which would then be loaded in the context of the "AccCheckConsole" utility.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Regsvr32 Execution From Remote Share
properties.description: Detects REGSVR32.exe to execute DLL hosted on remote shares
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Registry Modification Attempt Via VBScript
properties.description:
Detects attempts to modify the registry using VBScript's CreateObject("Wscript.shell") and RegWrite methods via common LOLBINs.
It could be an attempt to modify the registry for persistence without using straightforward methods like regedit.exe, reg.exe, or PowerShell.
Threat Actors may use this technique to evade detection by security solutions that monitor for direct registry modifications through traditional tools.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Regsvr32 DLL Execution With Uncommon Extension
properties.description: Detects a "regsvr32" execution where the DLL doesn't contain a common file extension.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Mavinject Inject DLL Into Running Process
properties.description: Detects process injection using the signed Windows tool "Mavinject" via the "INJECTRUNNING" flag
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth

properties.name: Potential Lateral Movement via Windows Remote Shell
properties.description: Detects a child process spawned by 'winrshost.exe', which suggests remote command execution through Windows Remote Shell (WinRs) and may indicate potential lateral movement activity.
properties.author: Liran Ravich

properties.name: File Download Via InstallUtil.EXE
properties.description: Detects use of .NET InstallUtil.exe in order to download arbitrary files. The files will be written to "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\INetCache\IE\"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

properties.name: PUA - WebBrowserPassView Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of WebBrowserPassView.exe. A password recovery tool that reveals the passwords stored by the following Web browsers, Internet Explorer (Version 4.0 - 11.0), Mozilla Firefox (All Versions), Google Chrome, Safari, and Opera
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Copying Sensitive Files with Credential Data
properties.description: Files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) copying
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: Delete All Scheduled Tasks
properties.description: Detects the usage of schtasks with the delete flag and the asterisk symbol to delete all tasks from the schedule of the local computer, including tasks scheduled by other users.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Child Processes Of SndVol.exe
properties.description: Detects potentially uncommon child processes of SndVol.exe (the Windows volume mixer)
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Security Event Logging Disabled via MiniNt Registry Key - Process
properties.description:
Detects attempts to disable security event logging by adding the `MiniNt` registry key.
This key is used to disable the Windows Event Log service, which collects and stores event logs from the operating system and applications.
Adversaries may want to disable this service to prevent logging of security events that could be used to detect their activities.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SharpUp PrivEsc Tool Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of SharpUp, a tool for local privilege escalation
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: MSHTA Execution with Suspicious File Extensions
properties.description:
Detects execution of mshta.exe with file types that looks like they do not typically represent HTA (HTML Application) content,
such as .png, .jpg, .zip, .pdf, and others, which are often polyglots. MSHTA is a legitimate Windows utility for executing HTML Applications
containing VBScript or JScript. Threat actors often abuse this lolbin utility to download and
execute malicious scripts disguised as benign files or hosted under misleading extensions to evade detection.
properties.author: Diego Perez (@darkquassar), Markus Neis, Swisscom (Improve Rule), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SharpEvtMute Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of SharpEvtHook, a tool that tampers with the Windows event logs
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Recon Activity Using DriverQuery.EXE
properties.description: Detect usage of the "driverquery" utility to perform reconnaissance on installed drivers
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Lolbin Runexehelper Use As Proxy
properties.description: Detect usage of the "runexehelper.exe" binary as a proxy to launch other programs
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Monitoring For Persistence Via BITS
properties.description:
BITS will allow you to schedule a command to execute after a successful download to notify you that the job is finished.
When the job runs on the system the command specified in the BITS job will be executed.
This can be abused by actors to create a backdoor within the system and for persistence.
It will be chained in a BITS job to schedule the download of malware/additional binaries and execute the program after being downloaded.
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: Suspicious XOR Encoded PowerShell Command
properties.description: Detects presence of a potentially xor encoded powershell command
properties.author: Sami Ruohonen, Harish Segar, Tim Shelton, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Vasiliy Burov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Suspicious FromBase64String Usage On Gzip Archive - Process Creation
properties.description: Detects attempts of decoding a base64 Gzip archive via PowerShell. This technique is often used as a method to load malicious content into memory afterward.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: PUA - PingCastle Execution From Potentially Suspicious Parent
properties.description: Detects the execution of PingCastle, a tool designed to quickly assess the Active Directory security level via a script located in a potentially suspicious or uncommon location.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: System File Execution Location Anomaly
properties.description: Detects the execution of a Windows system binary that is usually located in the system folder from an uncommon location.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Patrick Bareiss, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Diantz Download and Compress Into a CAB File
properties.description: Download and compress a remote file and store it in a cab file on local machine.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Renamed PsExec Service Execution
properties.description: Detects suspicious launch of a renamed version of the PSEXESVC service with, which is not often used by legitimate administrators
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Arbitrary Binary Execution Using GUP Utility
properties.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater (gup) to launch other commands or executables
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential SysInternals ProcDump Evasion
properties.description: Detects uses of the SysInternals ProcDump utility in which ProcDump or its output get renamed, or a dump file is moved or copied to a different name
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Tap Installer Execution
properties.description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunneling techniques
properties.author: Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Ian Davis, oscd.community

properties.name: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Execution
properties.description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), @twjackomo, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Run PowerShell Script from ADS
properties.description: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)
properties.author: Sergey Soldatov, Kaspersky Lab, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Recursive Takeown
properties.description: Adversaries can interact with the DACLs using built-in Windows commands takeown which can grant adversaries higher permissions on specific files and folders
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: SyncAppvPublishingServer VBS Execute Arbitrary PowerShell Code
properties.description: Executes arbitrary PowerShell code using SyncAppvPublishingServer.vbs
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Splwow64 Without Params
properties.description: Detects suspicious Splwow64.exe process without any command line parameters
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Forfiles.EXE Child Process Masquerading
properties.description: Detects the execution of "forfiles" from a non-default location, in order to potentially spawn a custom "cmd.exe" from the current working directory.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Anish Bogati

properties.name: File Recovery From Backup Via Wbadmin.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the recovery of files from backups via "wbadmin.exe".
Attackers can restore sensitive files such as NTDS.DIT or Registry Hives from backups in order to potentially extract credentials.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Renamed Whoami Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of whoami that has been renamed to a different name to avoid detection
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Tor Client/Browser Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of Tor or Tor-Browser to connect to onion routing networks
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Renamed AutoHotkey.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of a renamed autohotkey.exe binary based on PE metadata fields
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Binary Proxy Execution Via Dotnet-Trace.EXE
properties.description: Detects commandline arguments for executing a child process via dotnet-trace.exe
properties.author: Jimmy Bayne (@bohops)

properties.name: Suspicious Invoke-WebRequest Execution With DirectIP
properties.description: Detects calls to PowerShell with Invoke-WebRequest cmdlet using direct IP access
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Firewall Disabled via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Detects netsh commands that turns off the Windows firewall
properties.author: Fatih Sirin

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - Process
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Sysmon Driver Unloaded Via Fltmc.EXE
properties.description: Detects possible Sysmon filter driver unloaded via fltmc.exe
properties.author: Kirill Kiryanov, oscd.community

properties.name: DirLister Execution
properties.description: Detect the usage of "DirLister.exe" a utility for quickly listing folder or drive contents. It was seen used by BlackCat ransomware to create a list of accessible directories and files.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Windows Update Agent Empty Cmdline
properties.description: Detects suspicious Windows Update Agent activity in which a wuauclt.exe process command line doesn't contain any command line flags
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Suspicious Registry File Imported Via Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects the import of '.reg' files from suspicious paths using the 'reg.exe' utility
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Arbitrary DLL or Csproj Code Execution Via Dotnet.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of arbitrary DLLs or unsigned code via a ".csproj" files via Dotnet.EXE.
properties.author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community

properties.name: Renamed SysInternals DebugView Execution
properties.description: Detects suspicious renamed SysInternals DebugView execution
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New ActiveScriptEventConsumer Created Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects WMIC executions in which an event consumer gets created. This could be used to establish persistence
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Processes Suspicious Parent Directory
properties.description: Detect suspicious parent processes of well-known Windows processes
properties.author: vburov

properties.name: Suspicious MSDT Parent Process
properties.description: Detects msdt.exe executed by a suspicious parent as seen in CVE-2022-30190 / Follina exploitation
properties.author: Nextron Systems

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - LogMeIn Execution
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Microsoft OneNote Child Process
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the Microsoft OneNote application. This may indicate an attempt to execute malicious embedded objects from a .one file.
properties.author: Tim Rauch (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Arbitrary File Download Via MSEDGE_PROXY.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of "msedge_proxy.exe" to download arbitrary files
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Suspicious SysAidServer Child
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes of SysAidServer (as seen in MERCURY threat actor intrusions)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Cscript/Wscript Potentially Suspicious Child Process
properties.description:
Detects potentially suspicious child processes of Wscript/Cscript. These include processes such as rundll32 with uncommon exports or PowerShell spawning rundll32 or regsvr32.
Malware such as Pikabot and Qakbot were seen using similar techniques as well as many others.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Alejandro Houspanossian ('@lekz86')

properties.name: Potential Commandline Obfuscation Using Escape Characters
properties.description: Detects potential commandline obfuscation using known escape characters
properties.author: juju4

properties.name: File Download And Execution Via IEExec.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of the IEExec utility to download and execute files
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - PingCastle Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of PingCastle, a tool designed to quickly assess the Active Directory security level.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113

properties.name: Use Icacls to Hide File to Everyone
properties.description: Detect use of icacls to deny access for everyone in Users folder sometimes used to hide malicious files
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - Hashcat Password Cracker Execution
properties.description: Execute Hashcat.exe with provided SAM file from registry of Windows and Password list to crack against
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - Jlaive In-Memory Assembly Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of Jlaive to execute assemblies in a copied PowerShell
properties.author: Jose Luis Sanchez Martinez (@Joseliyo_Jstnk)

properties.name: Suspicious WMIC Execution Via Office Process
properties.description: Office application called wmic to proxye execution through a LOLBIN process. This is often used to break suspicious parent-child chain (Office app spawns LOLBin).
properties.author: Vadim Khrykov, Cyb3rEng

properties.name: Microsoft IIS Service Account Password Dumped
properties.description: Detects the Internet Information Services (IIS) command-line tool, AppCmd, being used to list passwords
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Janantha Marasinghe, Elastic (original idea)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious NTFS Symlink Behavior Modification
properties.description: Detects the modification of NTFS symbolic link behavior using fsutil, which could be used to enable remote to local or remote to remote symlinks for potential attacks.
properties.author: frack113, The DFIR Report

properties.name: WMIC Remote Command Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of WMIC to query information on a remote system
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invocation of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe)
properties.description: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe, which can be used for various attacks against the NTDS database (NTDS.DIT)
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: UAC Bypass Using DismHost
properties.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using DismHost DLL hijacking (UACMe 63)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Proxy Execution Via Wuauclt.EXE
properties.description: Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) for proxy execution.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Sreeman, FPT.EagleEye Team

properties.name: Renamed NetSupport RAT Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "client32.exe" (NetSupport RAT) via Imphash, Product and OriginalFileName strings
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Child Process Of Appvlp.EXE
properties.description:
Detects uncommon child processes of Appvlp.EXE
Appvlp or the Application Virtualization Utility is included with Microsoft Office. Attackers are able to abuse "AppVLP" to execute shell commands.
Normally, this binary is used for Application Virtualization, but it can also be abused to circumvent the ASR file path rule folder
or to mark a file as a system file.
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: New Port Forwarding Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of netsh commands that configure a new port forwarding (PortProxy) rule
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), omkar72, oscd.community, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Files Added To An Archive Using Rar.EXE
properties.description: Detects usage of "rar" to add files to an archive for potential compression. An adversary may compress data (e.g. sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, E.M. Anhaus, oscd.community

properties.name: PUA - RunXCmd Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of the RunXCmd tool to execute commands with System or TrustedInstaller accounts
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Certipy Execution
properties.description: Detects Certipy execution, a tool for Active Directory Certificate Services enumeration and abuse based on PE metadata characteristics and common command line arguments.
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems), Sittikorn Sangrattanapitak

properties.name: Obfuscated IP Download Activity
properties.description: Detects use of an encoded/obfuscated version of an IP address (hex, octal...) in an URL combined with a download command
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious VBoxDrvInst.exe Parameters
properties.description:
Detect VBoxDrvInst.exe run with parameters allowing processing INF file.
This allows to create values in the registry and install drivers.
For example one could use this technique to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys
properties.author: Konstantin Grishchenko, oscd.community

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious GoogleUpdate Child Process
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "GoogleUpdate.exe"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Python Spawning Pretty TTY on Windows
properties.description: Detects python spawning a pretty tty
properties.author: Nextron Systems

properties.name: HackTool - Sliver C2 Implant Activity Pattern
properties.description: Detects process activity patterns as seen being used by Sliver C2 framework implants
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Provlaunch.EXE Child Process
properties.description: Detects suspicious child processes of "provlaunch.exe" which might indicate potential abuse to proxy execution.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - Stracciatella Execution
properties.description: Detects Stracciatella which executes a Powershell runspace from within C# (aka SharpPick technique) with AMSI, ETW and Script Block Logging disabled based on PE metadata characteristics.
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UAC Bypass Tools Using ComputerDefaults
properties.description: Detects tools such as UACMe used to bypass UAC with computerdefaults.exe (UACMe 59)
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Add New Download Source To Winget
properties.description: Detects usage of winget to add new additional download sources
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed Schtasks Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of renamed schtasks.exe binary, which is a legitimate Windows utility used for scheduling tasks.
One of the very common persistence techniques is schedule malicious tasks using schtasks.exe.
Since, it is heavily abused, it is also heavily monitored by security products. To evade detection, threat actors may rename the schtasks.exe binary to schedule their malicious tasks.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Mftrace.EXE Abuse
properties.description: Detects child processes of the "Trace log generation tool for Media Foundation Tools" (Mftrace.exe) which can abused to execute arbitrary binaries.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Child Process Of Wermgr.EXE
properties.description: Detects suspicious Windows Error Reporting manager (wermgr.exe) child process
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DumpMinitool Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of "DumpMinitool.exe" a tool that allows the dump of process memory via the use of the "MiniDumpWriteDump"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Use of VisualUiaVerifyNative.exe
properties.description: VisualUiaVerifyNative.exe is a Windows SDK that can be used for AWL bypass and is listed in Microsoft's recommended block rules.
properties.author: Christopher Peacock @SecurePeacock, SCYTHE @scythe_io

properties.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Via DeviceEnroller.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the use of the PhoneDeepLink parameter to potentially sideload a DLL file that does not exist. This non-existent DLL file is named "ShellChromeAPI.dll".
Adversaries can drop their own renamed DLL and execute it via DeviceEnroller.exe using this parameter
properties.author: @gott_cyber

properties.name: LSA PPL Protection Disabled Via Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of the "reg.exe" utility to disable PPL protection on the LSA process
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Manage-bde.wsf Abuse To Proxy Execution
properties.description: Detects potential abuse of the "manage-bde.wsf" script as a LOLBIN to proxy execution
properties.author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Child Process Of Defaultpack.EXE
properties.description: Detects uncommon child processes of "DefaultPack.EXE" binary as a proxy to launch other programs
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential DLL Injection Or Execution Using Tracker.exe
properties.description: Detects potential DLL injection and execution using "Tracker.exe"
properties.author: Avneet Singh @v3t0_, oscd.community

properties.name: Shadow Copies Creation Using Operating Systems Utilities
properties.description: Shadow Copies creation using operating systems utilities, possible credential access
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: PUA - Process Hacker Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of Process Hacker based on binary metadata information (Image, Hash, Imphash, etc).
Process Hacker is a tool to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level options.
Threat actors abused older vulnerable versions to manipulate system processes.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Interesting Service Enumeration Via Sc.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the enumeration and query of interesting and in some cases sensitive services on the system via "sc.exe".
Attackers often try to enumerate the services currently running on a system in order to find different attack vectors.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Suspicious Usage Of ShellExec_RunDLL
properties.description: Detects suspicious usage of the ShellExec_RunDLL function to launch other commands as seen in the the raspberry-robin attack
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Disabling Windows Defender WMI Autologger Session via Reg.exe
properties.description:
Detects the use of reg.exe to disable the Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) Autologger session for Windows Defender API and Audit events.
By setting the 'Start' value to '0' for the 'DefenderApiLogger' or 'DefenderAuditLogger' session, an attacker can prevent these critical security events
from being logged, effectively blinding monitoring tools that rely on this data. This is a powerful defense evasion technique.
properties.author: Matt Anderson (Huntress)

properties.name: Suspicious Vsls-Agent Command With AgentExtensionPath Load
properties.description: Detects Microsoft Visual Studio vsls-agent.exe lolbin execution with a suspicious library load using the --agentExtensionPath parameter
properties.author: bohops

properties.name: HackTool - HandleKatz LSASS Dumper Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of HandleKatz, a tool that demonstrates the usage of cloned handles to Lsass in order to create an obfuscated memory dump of the same
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Download From IP Via Wget.EXE
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads directly from IP addresses using Wget.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Msbuild Execution By Uncommon Parent Process
properties.description: Detects suspicious execution of 'Msbuild.exe' by a uncommon parent process
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious EventLog Recon Activity Using Log Query Utilities
properties.description:
Detects execution of different log query utilities and commands to search and dump the content of specific event logs or look for specific event IDs.
This technique is used by threat actors in order to extract sensitive information from events logs such as usernames, IP addresses, hostnames, etc.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Rundll32 Setupapi.dll Activity
properties.description: setupapi.dll library provide InstallHinfSection function for processing INF files. INF file may contain instructions allowing to create values in the registry, modify files and install drivers. This technique could be used to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys, run process or use other DLLs chain calls (see references) InstallHinfSection function in setupapi.dll calls runonce.exe executable regardless of actual content of INF file.
properties.author: Konstantin Grishchenko, oscd.community

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Rundll32 Activity
properties.description: Detects suspicious execution of rundll32, with specific calls to some DLLs with known LOLBIN functionalities
properties.author: juju4, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Potential Suspicious Remote Command Execution
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes launched via the ScreenConnect client service.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), @Kostastsale

properties.name: Nltest.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery
properties.author: Arun Chauhan

properties.name: PUA - AdFind.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of Adfind.exe utility, which can be used for reconnaissance in an Active Directory environment
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Chromium Browser Headless Execution To Mockbin Like Site
properties.description: Detects the execution of a Chromium based browser process with the "headless" flag and a URL pointing to the mockbin.org service (which can be used to exfiltrate data).
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Insensitive Subfolder Search Via Findstr.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of findstr with the "s" and "i" flags for a "subfolder" and "insensitive" search respectively. Attackers sometimes leverage this built-in utility to search the system for interesting files or filter through results of commands.
properties.author: Furkan CALISKAN, @caliskanfurkan_, @oscd_initiative, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Use of W32tm as Timer
properties.description: When configured with suitable command line arguments, w32tm can act as a delay mechanism
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Process Injection Via Msra.EXE
properties.description: Detects potential process injection via Microsoft Remote Asssistance (Msra.exe) by looking at suspicious child processes spawned from the aforementioned process. It has been a target used by many threat actors and used for discovery and persistence tactics
properties.author: Alexander McDonald

properties.name: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via Reversed Commands
properties.description: Detects the presence of reversed PowerShell commands in the CommandLine. This is often used as a method of obfuscation by attackers
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

properties.name: Rundll32 Registered COM Objects
properties.description: load malicious registered COM objects
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Bypass UAC via Fodhelper.exe
properties.description: Identifies use of Fodhelper.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Tony Lambert), oscd.community

properties.name: Use of Pcalua For Execution
properties.description: Detects execition of commands and binaries from the context of The program compatibility assistant (Pcalua.exe). This can be used as a LOLBIN in order to bypass application whitelisting.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - GoToAssist Execution
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Explorer NOUACCHECK Flag
properties.description: Detects suspicious starts of explorer.exe that use the /NOUACCHECK flag that allows to run all sub processes of that newly started explorer.exe without any UAC checks
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential LSASS Process Dump Via Procdump
properties.description:
Detects potential credential harvesting attempts through LSASS memory dumps using ProcDump.
This rule identifies suspicious command-line patterns that combine memory dump flags (-ma, -mm, -mp) with LSASS-related process markers.
LSASS (Local Security Authority Subsystem Service) contains sensitive authentication data including plaintext passwords, NTLM hashes, and Kerberos tickets in memory.
Attackers commonly dump LSASS memory to extract credentials for lateral movement and privilege escalation.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Powershell Base64 Encoded MpPreference Cmdlet
properties.description: Detects base64 encoded "MpPreference" PowerShell cmdlet code that tries to modifies or tamper with Windows Defender AV
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Process Created Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects new process creation using WMIC via the "process call create" flag
properties.author: Michael Haag, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), juju4, oscd.community

properties.name: Node Process Executions
properties.description: Detects the execution of other scripts using the Node executable packaged with Adobe Creative Cloud
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Use of Scriptrunner.exe
properties.description: The "ScriptRunner.exe" binary can be abused to proxy execution through it and bypass possible whitelisting
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Operator Bloopers Cobalt Strike Modules
properties.description: Detects Cobalt Strike module/commands accidentally entered in CMD shell
properties.author: _pete_0, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: New Service Creation Using PowerShell
properties.description: Detects the creation of a new service using powershell.
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: Run PowerShell Script from Redirected Input Stream
properties.description: Detects PowerShell script execution via input stream redirect
properties.author: Moriarty Meng (idea), Anton Kutepov (rule), oscd.community

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Execution
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - WSASS Execution
properties.description:
Detects execution of WSASS, a tool used to dump LSASS memory on Windows systems by leveraging WER's
(Windows Error Reporting) WerFaultSecure.EXE to bypass PPL (Protected Process Light) protections.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Pubprn.vbs Proxy Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of the 'Pubprn.vbs' Microsoft signed script to execute commands.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Abused Debug Privilege by Arbitrary Parent Processes
properties.description: Detection of unusual child processes by different system processes
properties.author: Semanur Guneysu @semanurtg, oscd.community

properties.name: Scheduled Task Creation Via Schtasks.EXE
properties.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Unquoted Service Path Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects known WMI recon method to look for unquoted service paths using wmic. Often used by pentester and attacker enumeration scripts
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Dism Remove Online Package
properties.description: Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool. DISM is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Webshell Detection With Command Line Keywords
properties.description: Detects certain command line parameters often used during reconnaissance activity via web shells
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community, Chad Hudson, Matt Anderson

properties.name: IIS WebServer Log Deletion via CommandLine Utilities
properties.description:
Detects attempts to delete Internet Information Services (IIS) log files via command line utilities, which is a common defense evasion technique used by attackers to cover their tracks.
Threat actors often abuse vulnerabilities in web applications hosted on IIS servers to gain initial access and later delete IIS logs to evade detection.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious File Download From IP Via Wget.EXE - Paths
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads directly from IP addresses and stored in suspicious locations using Wget.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool - SecurityXploded Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of SecurityXploded Tools
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Child Process Of Setres.EXE
properties.description:
Detects uncommon child process of Setres.EXE.
Setres.EXE is a Windows server only process and tool that can be used to set the screen resolution.
It can potentially be abused in order to launch any arbitrary file with a name containing the word "choice" from the current execution path.
properties.author: @gott_cyber, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: LSASS Dump Keyword In CommandLine
properties.description: Detects the presence of the keywords "lsass" and ".dmp" in the commandline, which could indicate a potential attempt to dump or create a dump of the lsass process.
properties.author: E.M. Anhaus, Tony Lambert, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Download/Upload Activity Using Type Command
properties.description: Detects usage of the "type" command to download/upload data from WebDAV server
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Raccine Uninstall
properties.description: Detects commands that indicate a Raccine removal from an end system. Raccine is a free ransomware protection tool.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer
properties.description: Detects WMI script event consumers
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: Potential Suspicious Browser Launch From Document Reader Process
properties.description: Detects when a browser process or browser tab is launched from an application that handles document files such as Adobe, Microsoft Office, etc. And connects to a web application over http(s), this could indicate a possible phishing attempt.
properties.author: Joseph Kamau

properties.name: Port Forwarding Activity Via SSH.EXE
properties.description: Detects port forwarding activity via SSH.exe
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Write Protect For Storage Disabled
properties.description:
Detects applications trying to modify the registry in order to disable any write-protect property for storage devices.
This could be a precursor to a ransomware attack and has been an observed technique used by cypherpunk group.
properties.author: Sreeman

properties.name: IIS Native-Code Module Command Line Installation
properties.description: Detects suspicious IIS native-code module installations via command line
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: File Download Using ProtocolHandler.exe
properties.description: Detects usage of "ProtocolHandler" to download files. Downloaded files will be located in the cache folder (for example - %LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\INetCache\IE)
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: CMSTP UAC Bypass via COM Object Access
properties.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects (e.g. UACMe ID of 41, 43, 58 or 65)
properties.author: Nik Seetharaman, Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Loaded Module Enumeration Via Tasklist.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the enumeration of a specific DLL or EXE being used by a binary via "tasklist.exe".
This is often used by attackers in order to find the specific process identifier (PID) that is using the DLL in question.
In order to dump the process memory or perform other nefarious actions.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Suspicious ScreenSave Change by Reg.exe
properties.description:
Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by user inactivity.
Screensavers are programs that execute after a configurable time of user inactivity and consist of Portable Executable (PE) files with a .scr file extension
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: SafeBoot Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to prevent safeboot execution of security products
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

properties.name: WSL Child Process Anomaly
properties.description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes spawning from a WSL process. This could indicate an attempt to evade parent/child relationship detections or persistence attempts via cron using WSL
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential AMSI Bypass Using NULL Bits
properties.description: Detects usage of special strings/null bits in order to potentially bypass AMSI functionalities
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - AdvancedRun Suspicious Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of AdvancedRun utility in the context of the TrustedInstaller, SYSTEM, Local Service or Network Service accounts
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: UtilityFunctions.ps1 Proxy Dll
properties.description: Detects the use of a Microsoft signed script executing a managed DLL with PowerShell.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Stop Windows Service Via Net.EXE
properties.description: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the "net" utility.
properties.author: Jakob Weinzettl, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - CleanWipe Execution
properties.description: Detects the use of CleanWipe a tool usually used to delete Symantec antivirus.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: COM Object Execution via Xwizard.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the execution of Xwizard tool with the "RunWizard" flag and a GUID like argument.
This utility can be abused in order to run custom COM object created in the registry.
properties.author: Ensar amil, @sblmsrsn, @oscd_initiative, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Use of OpenConsole
properties.description: Detects usage of OpenConsole binary as a LOLBIN to launch other binaries to bypass application Whitelisting
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Event Viewer Child Process
properties.description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes of "eventvwr.exe" which might indicate a UAC bypass attempt
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Svchost Command Line Parameter
properties.description:
Detects instances of svchost.exe running with an unusual or uncommon command line parameter by excluding known legitimate or common patterns.
This could point at a file masquerading as svchost, a process injection, or hollowing of a legitimate svchost instance.
properties.author: Liran Ravich

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Office Document Executed From Trusted Location
properties.description: Detects the execution of an Office application that points to a document that is located in a trusted location. Attackers often used this to avoid macro security and execute their malicious code.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Runscripthelper.exe
properties.description: Detects execution of powershell scripts via Runscripthelper.exe
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community

properties.name: WinRAR Execution in Non-Standard Folder
properties.description: Detects a suspicious WinRAR execution in a folder which is not the default installation folder
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tigzy

properties.name: HackTool - CrackMapExec Execution
properties.description: This rule detect common flag combinations used by CrackMapExec in order to detect its use even if the binary has been replaced.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Firewall Disabled via PowerShell
properties.description: Detects attempts to disable the Windows Firewall using PowerShell
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Windows App Activity
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious child process of applications launched from inside the WindowsApps directory. This could be a sign of a rogue ".appx" package installation/execution
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed Microsoft Teams Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed Microsoft Teams binary.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE
properties.description: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Call To Win32_NTEventlogFile Class
properties.description: Detects usage of the WMI class "Win32_NTEventlogFile" in a potentially suspicious way (delete, backup, change permissions, etc.) from a PowerShell script
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Eventlog Clearing or Configuration Change Activity
properties.description:
Detects the clearing or configuration tampering of EventLog using utilities such as "wevtutil", "powershell" and "wmic".
This technique were seen used by threat actors and ransomware strains in order to evade defenses.
properties.author: Ecco, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community, D3F7A5105, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed Msdt.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "Msdt.exe" binary
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Changing Existing Service ImagePath Value Via Reg.EXE
properties.description:
Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the Registry entries used by services.
Adversaries may use flaws in the permissions for registry to redirect from the originally specified executable to one that they control, in order to launch their own code at Service start.
Windows stores local service configuration information in the Registry under HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Rundll32 InstallScreenSaver Execution
properties.description: An attacker may execute an application as a SCR File using rundll32.exe desk.cpl,InstallScreenSaver
properties.author: Christopher Peacock @securepeacock, SCYTHE @scythe_io, TactiKoolSec

properties.name: Process Proxy Execution Via Squirrel.EXE
properties.description: Detects the usage of the "Squirrel.exe" binary to execute arbitrary processes. This binary is part of multiple Electron based software installations (Slack, Teams, Discord, etc.)
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Karneades / Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

properties.name: Potential Crypto Mining Activity
properties.description: Detects command line parameters or strings often used by crypto miners
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: VeeamBackup Database Credentials Dump Via Sqlcmd.EXE
properties.description: Detects dump of credentials in VeeamBackup dbo
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Arbitrary File Download Via GfxDownloadWrapper.EXE
properties.description: Detects execution of GfxDownloadWrapper.exe with a URL as an argument to download file.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community

properties.name: Execution of Powershell Script in Public Folder
properties.description: This rule detects execution of PowerShell scripts located in the "C:\Users\Public" folder
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Set-Acl On Windows Folder
properties.description: Detects PowerShell scripts to set the ACL to a file in the Windows folder
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Active Directory Database Snapshot Via ADExplorer
properties.description: Detects the execution of Sysinternals ADExplorer with the "-snapshot" flag in order to save a local copy of the active directory database to a suspicious directory. This can be used by attackers to extract data for Bloodhound, usernames for password spraying or use the meta data for social engineering. The snapshot doesn't contain password hashes but there have been cases, where administrators put passwords in the comment field.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Product Class Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the execution of WMIC in order to get a list of firewall, antivirus and antispywware products.
Adversaries often enumerate security products installed on a system to identify security controls and potential ways to evade detection or disable protection mechanisms.
This information helps them plan their next attack steps and choose appropriate techniques to bypass security measures.
properties.author: Michael Haag, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), juju4, oscd.community, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Possible Privilege Escalation via Weak Service Permissions
properties.description: Detection of sc.exe utility spawning by user with Medium integrity level to change service ImagePath or FailureCommand
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov

properties.name: UEFI Persistence Via Wpbbin - ProcessCreation
properties.description: Detects execution of the binary "wpbbin" which is used as part of the UEFI based persistence method described in the reference section
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious GrpConv Execution
properties.description: Detects the suspicious execution of a utility to convert Windows 3.x .grp files or for persistence purposes by malicious software or actors
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Private Keys Reconnaissance Via CommandLine Tools
properties.description: Adversaries may search for private key certificate files on compromised systems for insecurely stored credential
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - Team Viewer Session Started On Windows Host
properties.description:
Detects the command line executed when TeamViewer starts a session started by a remote host.
Once a connection has been started, an investigator can verify the connection details by viewing the "incoming_connections.txt" log file in the TeamViewer folder.
properties.author: Josh Nickels, Qi Nan

properties.name: Potential PowerShell Execution Via DLL
properties.description:
Detects potential PowerShell execution from a DLL instead of the usual PowerShell process as seen used in PowerShdll.
This detection assumes that PowerShell commands are passed via the CommandLine.
properties.author: Markus Neis, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Use Of The SFTP.EXE Binary As A LOLBIN
properties.description: Detects the usage of the "sftp.exe" binary as a LOLBIN by abusing the "-D" flag
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Execution Of PDQDeployRunner
properties.description: Detects suspicious execution of "PDQDeployRunner" which is part of the PDQDeploy service stack that is responsible for executing commands and packages on a remote machines
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Execute Code with Pester.bat
properties.description: Detects code execution via Pester.bat (Pester - Powershell Modulte for testing)
properties.author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community

properties.name: Unsigned AppX Installation Attempt Using Add-AppxPackage
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Add-AppxPackage" or it's alias "Add-AppPackage" to install unsigned AppX packages
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Windows Default Domain GPO Modification via GPME
properties.description:
Detects the use of the Group Policy Management Editor (GPME) to modify Default Domain or Default Domain Controllers Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
Adversaries may leverage GPME to make stealthy changes in these default GPOs to deploy malicious GPOs configurations across the domain without raising suspicion.
properties.author: TropChaud

properties.name: Execution via WorkFolders.exe
properties.description: Detects using WorkFolders.exe to execute an arbitrary control.exe
properties.author: Maxime Thiebaut (@0xThiebaut)

properties.name: Suspicious Rundll32 Execution With Image Extension
properties.description: Detects the execution of Rundll32.exe with DLL files masquerading as image files
properties.author: Hieu Tran

properties.name: Scheduled Task Creation with Curl and PowerShell Execution Combo
properties.description:
Detects the creation of a scheduled task using schtasks.exe, potentially in combination with curl for downloading payloads and PowerShell for executing them.
This facilitates executing malicious payloads or connecting with C&C server persistently without dropping the malware sample on the host.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Permission Misconfiguration Reconnaissance Via Findstr.EXE
properties.description:
Detects usage of findstr with the "EVERYONE" or "BUILTIN" keywords.
This was seen being used in combination with "icacls" and other utilities to spot misconfigured files or folders permissions.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PDQ Deploy Remote Adminstartion Tool Execution
properties.description: Detect use of PDQ Deploy remote admin tool
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Process Execution Proxy Via CL_Invocation.ps1
properties.description: Detects calls to "SyncInvoke" that is part of the "CL_Invocation.ps1" script to proxy execution using "System.Diagnostics.Process"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova

properties.name: Suspicious Process By Web Server Process
properties.description: Detects potentially suspicious processes being spawned by a web server process which could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or exploitation
properties.author: Thomas Patzke, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Zach Stanford @svch0st, Tim Shelton, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Kernel Memory Dump Via LiveKD
properties.description: Detects execution of LiveKD with the "-m" flag to potentially dump the kernel memory
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Get-Process LSASS
properties.description: Detects a "Get-Process" cmdlet and it's aliases on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Enumeration for Credentials in Registry
properties.description:
Adversaries may search the Registry on compromised systems for insecurely stored credentials.
The Windows Registry stores configuration information that can be used by the system or other programs.
Adversaries may query the Registry looking for credentials and passwords that have been stored for use by other programs or services
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Git Clone
properties.description: Detects execution of "git" in order to clone a remote repository that contain suspicious keywords which might be suspicious
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Execution of Suspicious File Type Extension
properties.description:
Detects whether the image specified in a process creation event doesn't refer to an ".exe" (or other known executable extension) file. This can be caused by process ghosting or other unorthodox methods to start a process.
This rule might require some initial baselining to align with some third party tooling in the user environment.
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Unusual Parent Process For Cmd.EXE
properties.description: Detects suspicious parent process for cmd.exe
properties.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

properties.name: Powershell Defender Exclusion
properties.description: Detects requests to exclude files, folders or processes from Antivirus scanning using PowerShell cmdlets
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed Vmnat.exe Execution
properties.description: Detects renamed vmnat.exe or portable version that can be used for DLL side-loading
properties.author: elhoim

properties.name: Gpresult Display Group Policy Information
