properties.description: Detects cases in which a user uses the built-in Windows utility gpresult to display the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) information
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious GUP Usage
properties.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater in a suspicious directory, which is often used in DLL side-loading attacks
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential UAC Bypass Via Sdclt.EXE
properties.description: A General detection for sdclt being spawned as an elevated process. This could be an indicator of sdclt being used for bypass UAC techniques.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Suspicious Encoded And Obfuscated Reflection Assembly Load Function Call
properties.description: Detects suspicious base64 encoded and obfuscated "LOAD" keyword used in .NET "reflection.assembly"
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Active Directory Enumeration Using AD Module - ProcCreation
properties.description: Detects usage of the "Import-Module" cmdlet to load the "Microsoft.ActiveDirectory.Management.dl" DLL. Which is often used by attackers to perform AD enumeration.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Console CodePage Lookup Via CHCP
properties.description: Detects use of chcp to look up the system locale value as part of host discovery
properties.author: _pete_0, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: HackTool - HollowReaper Execution
properties.description:
Detects usage of HollowReaper, a process hollowing shellcode launcher used for stealth payload execution through process hollowing.
It replaces the memory of a legitimate process with custom shellcode, allowing the attacker to execute payloads under the guise of trusted binaries.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Change Default File Association Via Assoc
properties.description:
Detects file association changes using the builtin "assoc" command.
When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Potential Provlaunch.EXE Binary Proxy Execution Abuse
properties.description: Detects child processes of "provlaunch.exe" which might indicate potential abuse to proxy execution.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

properties.name: Execute Files with Msdeploy.exe
properties.description: Detects file execution using the msdeploy.exe lolbin
properties.author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community

properties.name: Scripting/CommandLine Process Spawned Regsvr32
properties.description: Detects various command line and scripting engines/processes such as "PowerShell", "Wscript", "Cmd", etc. spawning a "regsvr32" instance.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Renamed CURL.EXE Execution
properties.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "CURL.exe" binary based on the PE metadata fields
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Webshell Hacking Activity Patterns
properties.description: Detects certain parent child patterns found in cases in which a web shell is used to perform certain credential dumping or exfiltration activities on a compromised system
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious PowerShell Parameter Substring
properties.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

properties.name: File In Suspicious Location Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64 where the files are located in potentially suspicious locations
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Hiding User Account Via SpecialAccounts Registry Key - CommandLine
properties.description: Detects changes to the registry key "HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\Userlist" where the value is set to "0" in order to hide user account from being listed on the logon screen.
properties.author: @Kostastsale, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: New User Created Via Net.EXE With Never Expire Option
properties.description: Detects creation of local users via the net.exe command with the option "never expire"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Dumping Process via Sqldumper.exe
properties.description: Detects process dump via legitimate sqldumper.exe binary
properties.author: Kirill Kiryanov, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Process Parents
properties.description: Detects suspicious parent processes that should not have any children or should only have a single possible child program
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PsExec Service Child Process Execution as LOCAL SYSTEM
properties.description: Detects suspicious launch of the PSEXESVC service on this system and a sub process run as LOCAL_SYSTEM (-s), which means that someone remotely started a command on this system running it with highest privileges and not only the privileges of the login user account (e.g. the administrator account)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Capture Session Launched Via DXCap.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of "DXCap.EXE" with the "-c" flag, which allows a user to launch any arbitrary binary or windows package through DXCap itself. This can be abused to potentially bypass application whitelisting.
properties.author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Recon Information for Export with Command Prompt
properties.description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: HackTool - WinRM Access Via Evil-WinRM
properties.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Use NTFS Short Name in Image
properties.description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid Image based detection
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Restic Backup Tool Execution
properties.description:
Detects the execution of the Restic backup tool, which can be used for data exfiltration.
Threat actors may leverage Restic to back up and exfiltrate sensitive data to remote storage locations, including cloud services.
If not legitimately used in the enterprise environment, its presence may indicate malicious activity.
properties.author: Nounou Mbeiri, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Unmount Share Via Net.EXE
properties.description: Detects when when a mounted share is removed. Adversaries may remove share connections that are no longer useful in order to clean up traces of their operation
properties.author: oscd.community, @redcanary, Zach Stanford @svch0st

properties.name: File And SubFolder Enumeration Via Dir Command
properties.description: Detects usage of the "dir" command part of Windows CMD with the "/S" command line flag in order to enumerate files in a specified directory and all subdirectories.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Product Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
properties.description: Detects the execution of WMIC in order to get a list of firewall and antivirus products
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: PUA - NirCmd Execution As LOCAL SYSTEM
properties.description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution as SYSTEM user
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Potential PE Metadata Tamper Using Rcedit
properties.description: Detects the use of rcedit to potentially alter executable PE metadata properties, which could conceal efforts to rename system utilities for defense evasion.
properties.author: Micah Babinski

properties.name: Suspicious Use of PsLogList
properties.description: Detects usage of the PsLogList utility to dump event log in order to extract admin accounts and perform account discovery or delete events logs
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Rclone Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of RClone utility for exfiltration as used by various ransomwares strains like REvil, Conti, FiveHands, etc
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj, Sittikorn S, Aaron Greetham (@beardofbinary) - NCC Group

properties.name: Potential Arbitrary DLL Load Using Winword
properties.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading using the Microsoft Office winword process via the '/l' flag.
properties.author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community

properties.name: Vulnerable HackSys Extreme Vulnerable Driver Load
properties.description: Detects the load of HackSys Extreme Vulnerable Driver which is an intentionally vulnerable Windows driver developed for security enthusiasts to learn and polish their exploitation skills at Kernel level and often abused by threat actors
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Malicious Driver Load
properties.description: Detects loading of known malicious drivers via their hash.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Vulnerable WinRing0 Driver Load
properties.description: Detects the load of a signed WinRing0 driver often used by threat actors, crypto miners (XMRIG) or malware for privilege escalation
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: WinDivert Driver Load
properties.description: Detects the load of the Windiver driver, a powerful user-mode capture/sniffing/modification/blocking/re-injection package for Windows
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Vulnerable Driver Load By Name
properties.description: Detects the load of known vulnerable drivers via the file name of the drivers.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Vulnerable Driver Load
properties.description: Detects loading of known vulnerable drivers via their hash.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Malicious Driver Load By Name
properties.description: Detects loading of known malicious drivers via the file name of the drivers.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Driver Load From A Temporary Directory
properties.description: Detects a driver load from a temporary directory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - Process Hacker Driver Load
properties.description: Detects driver load of the Process Hacker tool
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PUA - System Informer Driver Load
properties.description: Detects driver load of the System Informer tool
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Sysmon File Executable Creation Detected
properties.description: Triggers on any Sysmon "FileExecutableDetected" event, which triggers every time a PE that is monitored by the config is created.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Sysmon Configuration Modification
properties.description: Detects when an attacker tries to hide from Sysmon by disabling or stopping it
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Sysmon Blocked Executable
properties.description: Triggers on any Sysmon "FileBlockExecutable" event, which indicates a violation of the configured block policy
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Sysmon Configuration Change
properties.description: Detects a Sysmon configuration change, which could be the result of a legitimate reconfiguration or someone trying manipulate the configuration
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Sysmon Blocked File Shredding
properties.description: Triggers on any Sysmon "FileBlockShredding" event, which indicates a violation of the configured shredding policy.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Sysmon Configuration Error
properties.description: Detects when an adversary is trying to hide it's action from Sysmon logging based on error messages
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Mimikatz Use
properties.description: This method detects mimikatz keywords in different Eventlogs (some of them only appear in older Mimikatz version that are however still used by different threat groups)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), David ANDRE (additional keywords)

properties.name: HybridConnectionManager Service Running
properties.description: Rule to detect the Hybrid Connection Manager service running on an endpoint.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Certificate Exported From Local Certificate Store
properties.description: Detects when an application exports a certificate (and potentially the private key as well) from the local Windows certificate store.
properties.author: Zach Mathis

properties.name: File Was Not Allowed To Run
properties.description: Detect run not allowed files. Applocker is a very useful tool, especially on servers where unprivileged users have access. For example terminal servers. You need configure applocker and log collect to receive these events.
properties.author: Pushkarev Dmitry

properties.name: Windows Firewall Settings Have Been Changed
properties.description: Detects activity when the settings of the Windows firewall have been changed
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Firewall Rule Added In Windows Firewall Exception List Via WmiPrvSE.EXE
properties.description:
Detects the addition of a new "Allow" firewall rule by the WMI process (WmiPrvSE.EXE).
This can occur if an attacker leverages PowerShell cmdlets such as "New-NetFirewallRule", or directly uses WMI CIM classes such as "MSFT_NetFirewallRule".
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Firewall Rule Added In Windows Firewall Exception List For Potential Suspicious Application
properties.description: Detects the addition of a new rule to the Windows Firewall exception list for an application located in a potentially suspicious location.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: A Rule Has Been Deleted From The Windows Firewall Exception List
properties.description: Detects when a single rules or all of the rules have been deleted from the Windows Defender Firewall
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Uncommon New Firewall Rule Added In Windows Firewall Exception List
properties.description: Detects when a rule has been added to the Windows Firewall exception list
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Windows Defender Firewall Has Been Reset To Its Default Configuration
properties.description: Detects activity when Windows Defender Firewall has been reset to its default configuration
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: The Windows Defender Firewall Service Failed To Load Group Policy
properties.description: Detects activity when The Windows Defender Firewall service failed to load Group Policy
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: All Rules Have Been Deleted From The Windows Firewall Configuration
properties.description: Detects when a all the rules have been deleted from the Windows Defender Firewall configuration
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Scheduled Task Executed Uncommon LOLBIN
properties.description: Detects the execution of Scheduled Tasks where the program being run is located in a suspicious location or where it is an unusual program to be run from a Scheduled Task
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Scheduled Task Executed From A Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects the execution of Scheduled Tasks where the Program being run is located in a suspicious location or it's an unusale program to be run from a Scheduled Task
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Important Scheduled Task Deleted
properties.description: Detects when adversaries try to stop system services or processes by deleting their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Unsigned or Unencrypted SMB Connection to Share Established
properties.description:
Detects SMB server connections to shares without signing or encryption enabled.
This could indicate potential lateral movement activity using unsecured SMB shares.
properties.author: Mohamed Abdelghani

properties.name: Suspicious Digital Signature Of AppX Package
properties.description: Detects execution of AppX packages with known suspicious or malicious signature
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Certificate Private Key Acquired
properties.description: Detects when an application acquires a certificate private key
properties.author: Zach Mathis

properties.name: Failed DNS Zone Transfer
properties.description: Detects when a DNS zone transfer failed.
properties.author: Zach Mathis

properties.name: DNS Server Error Failed Loading the ServerLevelPluginDLL
properties.description: Detects a DNS server error in which a specified plugin DLL (in registry) could not be loaded
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Possible Shadow Credentials Added
properties.description: Detects possible addition of shadow credentials to an active directory object.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Elastic (idea)

properties.name: New or Renamed User Account with '$' Character
properties.description: Detects the creation of a user with the "$" character. This can be used by attackers to hide a user or trick detection systems that lack the parsing mechanisms.
properties.author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community

properties.name: User Added to Local Administrator Group
properties.description: Detects the addition of a new member to the local administrator group, which could be legitimate activity or a sign of privilege escalation activity
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Hidden Local User Creation
properties.description: Detects the creation of a local hidden user account which should not happen for event ID 4720.
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Service Registry Key Read Access Request
properties.description:
Detects "read access" requests on the services registry key.
Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the Registry entries used by services.
Adversaries may use flaws in the permissions for Registry keys related to services to redirect from the originally specified executable to one that they control, in order to launch their own code when a service starts.
properties.author: Center for Threat Informed Defense (CTID) Summiting the Pyramid Team

properties.name: Active Directory Replication from Non Machine Account
properties.description: Detects potential abuse of Active Directory Replication Service (ADRS) from a non machine account to request credentials.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Windows Defender Exclusion Registry Key - Write Access Requested
properties.description: Detects write access requests to the Windows Defender exclusions registry keys. This could be an indication of an attacker trying to request a handle or access the object to write new exclusions in order to bypass security.
properties.author: @BarryShooshooga, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: SysKey Registry Keys Access
properties.description: Detects handle requests and access operations to specific registry keys to calculate the SysKey
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Replay Attack Detected
properties.description: Detects possible Kerberos Replay Attack on the domain controllers when "KRB_AP_ERR_REPEAT" Kerberos response is sent to the client
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Remote Access Tool Services Have Been Installed - Security
properties.description: Detects service installation of different remote access tools software. These software are often abused by threat actors to perform
properties.author: Connor Martin, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Locked Workstation
properties.description: Detects locked workstation session events that occur automatically after a standard period of inactivity.
properties.author: Alexandr Yampolskyi, SOC Prime

properties.name: Meterpreter or Cobalt Strike Getsystem Service Installation - Security
properties.description: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service installation
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Ecco, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Metasploit SMB Authentication
properties.description: Alerts on Metasploit host's authentications on the domain.
properties.author: Chakib Gzenayi (@Chak092), Hosni Mribah

properties.name: Remote Service Activity via SVCCTL Named Pipe
properties.description: Detects remote service activity via remote access to the svcctl named pipe
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: Persistence and Execution at Scale via GPO Scheduled Task
properties.description: Detect lateral movement using GPO scheduled task, usually used to deploy ransomware at scale
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: Suspicious Teams Application Related ObjectAcess Event
properties.description: Detects an access to authentication tokens and accounts of Microsoft Teams desktop application.
properties.author: @SerkinValery

properties.name: Tap Driver Installation - Security
properties.description: Detects the installation of a well-known TAP driver service. This could be a sign of potential preparation for data exfiltration using tunnelling techniques.
properties.author: Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Ian Davis, oscd.community

properties.name: Unauthorized System Time Modification
properties.description: Detect scenarios where a potentially unauthorized application or user is modifying the system time.
properties.author: @neu5ron

properties.name: Windows Network Access Suspicious desktop.ini Action
properties.description: Detects unusual processes accessing desktop.ini remotely over network share, which can be leveraged to alter how Explorer displays a folder's content (i.e. renaming files) without changing them on disk.
properties.author: Tim Shelton (HAWK.IO)

properties.name: SMB Create Remote File Admin Share
properties.description: Look for non-system accounts SMB accessing a file with write (0x2) access mask via administrative share (i.e C$).
properties.author: Jose Rodriguez (@Cyb3rPandaH), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher - Security
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Add or Remove Computer from DC
properties.description: Detects the creation or removal of a computer. Can be used to detect attacks such as DCShadow via the creation of a new SPN.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: File Access Of Signal Desktop Sensitive Data
properties.description:
Detects access to Signal Desktop's sensitive data files: db.sqlite and config.json.
The db.sqlite file in Signal Desktop stores all locally saved messages in an encrypted SQLite database, while the config.json contains the decryption key needed to access that data.
Since the key is stored in plain text, a threat actor who gains access to both files can decrypt and read sensitive messages without needing the users credentials.
Currently the rule only covers the default Signal installation path in AppData\Roaming. Signal Portable installations may use different paths based on user configuration. Additional paths can be added to the selection as needed.
properties.author: Andreas Braathen (mnemonic.io)

properties.name: T1047 Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
properties.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `wbemcomn.dll` in the `C:\Windows\System32\wbem\` directory over the network for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR)

properties.name: WCE wceaux.dll Access
properties.description: Detects wceaux.dll access while WCE pass-the-hash remote command execution on source host
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32 - Security
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: DPAPI Domain Backup Key Extraction
properties.description: Detects tools extracting LSA secret DPAPI domain backup key from Domain Controllers
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Potential Kerberos Coercion by Spoofing SPNs via DNS Manipulation
properties.description:
Detects modifications to DNS records in Active Directory where the Distinguished Name (DN) contains a base64-encoded blob
matching the pattern "1UWhRCAAAAA...BAAAA". This pattern corresponds to a marshaled CREDENTIAL_TARGET_INFORMATION structure,
commonly used in Kerberos coercion attacks. Adversaries may exploit this to coerce victim systems into authenticating to
attacker-controlled hosts by spoofing SPNs via DNS. It is one of the strong indicators of a Kerberos coercion attack,.
where adversaries manipulate DNS records to spoof Service Principal Names (SPNs) and redirect authentication requests like CVE-2025-33073.
Please investigate the user account that made the changes, as it is likely a low-privileged account that has been compromised.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Register new Logon Process by Rubeus
properties.description: Detects potential use of Rubeus via registered new trusted logon process
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (source), Ilyas Ochkov (rule), oscd.community

properties.name: Azure AD Health Monitoring Agent Registry Keys Access
properties.description:
This detection uses Windows security events to detect suspicious access attempts to the registry key of Azure AD Health monitoring agent.
This detection requires an access control entry (ACE) on the system access control list (SACL) of the following securable object HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Online\Reporting\MonitoringAgent.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research), MSTIC

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation - Security
properties.description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the code block linked in the references
properties.author: Daniel Bohannon (@Mandiant/@FireEye), oscd.community

properties.name: AD Object WriteDAC Access
properties.description: Detects WRITE_DAC access to a domain object
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Denied Access To Remote Desktop
properties.description:
This event is generated when an authenticated user who is not allowed to log on remotely attempts to connect to this computer through Remote Desktop.
Often, this event can be generated by attackers when searching for available windows servers in the network.
properties.author: Pushkarev Dmitry

properties.name: DCOM InternetExplorer.Application Iertutil DLL Hijack - Security
properties.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `iertutil.dll` in the `C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\` directory over the network for a DCOM InternetExplorer DLL Hijack scenario.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR)

properties.name: SCM Database Handle Failure
properties.description: Detects non-system users failing to get a handle of the SCM database.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Windows Defender Exclusion List Modified
properties.description: Detects modifications to the Windows Defender exclusion registry key. This could indicate a potentially suspicious or even malicious activity by an attacker trying to add a new exclusion in order to bypass security.
properties.author: @BarryShooshooga

properties.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation
properties.description: Detects suspicious scheduled task creation events. Based on attributes such as paths, commands line flags, etc.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
properties.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask and object type SAM_DOMAIN
properties.author: sigma

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious AccessMask Requested From LSASS
properties.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Dimitrios Slamaris, Mark Russinovich, Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community (update)

properties.name: Mimikatz DC Sync
properties.description: Detects Mimikatz DC sync security events
properties.author: Benjamin Delpy, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Scott Dermott, Sorina Ionescu

properties.name: Group Policy Abuse for Privilege Addition
properties.description: Detects the first occurrence of a modification to Group Policy Object Attributes to add privileges to user accounts or use them to add users as local admins.
properties.author: Elastic, Josh Nickels, Marius Rothenbcher

properties.name: Metasploit Or Impacket Service Installation Via SMB PsExec
properties.description: Detects usage of Metasploit SMB PsExec (exploit/windows/smb/psexec) and Impacket psexec.py by triggering on specific service installation
properties.author: Bartlomiej Czyz, Relativity

properties.name: A New Trust Was Created To A Domain
properties.description: Addition of domains is seldom and should be verified for legitimacy.
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: WMI Persistence - Security
properties.description: Detects suspicious WMI event filter and command line event consumer based on WMI and Security Logs.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin oscd.community

properties.name: DCERPC SMB Spoolss Named Pipe
properties.description: Detects the use of the spoolss named pipe over SMB. This can be used to trigger the authentication via NTLM of any machine that has the spoolservice enabled.
properties.author: OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Win Susp Computer Name Containing Samtheadmin
properties.description: Detects suspicious computer name samtheadmin-{1..100}$ generated by hacktool
properties.author: elhoim

properties.name: Windows Event Auditing Disabled
properties.description:
Detects scenarios where system auditing (i.e.: Windows event log auditing) is disabled.
This may be used in a scenario where an entity would want to bypass local logging to evade detection when Windows event logging is enabled and reviewed.
Also, it is recommended to turn off "Local Group Policy Object Processing" via GPO, which will make sure that Active Directory GPOs take precedence over local/edited computer policies via something such as "gpedit.msc".
Please note, that disabling "Local Group Policy Object Processing" may cause an issue in scenarios of one off specific GPO modifications - however, it is recommended to perform these modifications in Active Directory anyways.
properties.author: @neu5ron, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Password Protected ZIP File Opened (Email Attachment)
properties.description: Detects the extraction of password protected ZIP archives. See the filename variable for more details on which file has been opened.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Security Eventlog Cleared
properties.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION - Security
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: ADCS Certificate Template Configuration Vulnerability with Risky EKU
properties.description: Detects certificate creation with template allowing risk permission subject and risky EKU
properties.author: Orlinum , BlueDefenZer

properties.name: Potential Privileged System Service Operation - SeLoadDriverPrivilege
properties.description:
Detects the usage of the 'SeLoadDriverPrivilege' privilege. This privilege is required to load or unload a device driver.
With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode.
This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers.
If you exclude privileged users/admins and processes, which are allowed to do so, you are maybe left with bad programs trying to load malicious kernel drivers.
This will detect Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs) and the usage of Sysinternals and various other tools. So you have to work with a whitelist to find the bad stuff.
properties.author: xknow (@xknow_infosec), xorxes (@xor_xes)

properties.name: Suspicious LDAP-Attributes Used
properties.description: Detects the usage of particular AttributeLDAPDisplayNames, which are known for data exchange via LDAP by the tool LDAPFragger and are additionally not commonly used in companies.
properties.author: xknow @xknow_infosec

properties.name: Important Windows Event Auditing Disabled
properties.description: Detects scenarios where system auditing for important events such as "Process Creation" or "Logon" events is disabled.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Processes Accessing the Microphone and Webcam
properties.description: Potential adversaries accessing the microphone and webcam in an endpoint.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Protected Storage Service Access
properties.description: Detects access to a protected_storage service over the network. Potential abuse of DPAPI to extract domain backup keys from Domain Controllers
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Failed Code Integrity Checks
properties.description: Detects code integrity failures such as missing page hashes or corrupted drivers due unauthorized modification. This could be a sign of tampered binaries.

properties.name: Password Policy Enumerated
properties.description: Detects when the password policy is enumerated.
properties.author: Zach Mathis

properties.name: HybridConnectionManager Service Installation
properties.description: Rule to detect the Hybrid Connection Manager service installation.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Remote PowerShell Sessions Network Connections (WinRM)
properties.description: Detects basic PowerShell Remoting (WinRM) by monitoring for network inbound connections to ports 5985 OR 5986
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Hacktool Ruler
properties.description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Account Tampering - Suspicious Failed Logon Reasons
properties.description: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Possible PetitPotam Coerce Authentication Attempt
properties.description: Detect PetitPotam coerced authentication activity.
properties.author: Mauricio Velazco, Michael Haag

properties.name: Suspicious Windows ANONYMOUS LOGON Local Account Created
properties.description: Detects the creation of suspicious accounts similar to ANONYMOUS LOGON, such as using additional spaces. Created as an covering detection for exclusion of Logon Type 3 from ANONYMOUS LOGON accounts.
properties.author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573

properties.name: ADCS Certificate Template Configuration Vulnerability
properties.description: Detects certificate creation with template allowing risk permission subject
properties.author: Orlinum , BlueDefenZer

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher - Security
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Impacket PsExec Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of Impacket's psexec.py.

properties.name: Suspicious Remote Logon with Explicit Credentials
properties.description: Detects suspicious processes logging on with explicit credentials
properties.author: oscd.community, Teymur Kheirkhabarov @HeirhabarovT, Zach Stanford @svch0st, Tim Shelton

properties.name: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe
properties.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: Windows Default Domain GPO Modification
properties.description:
Detects modifications to Default Domain or Default Domain Controllers Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
Adversaries may modify these default GPOs to deploy malicious configurations across the domain.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ISO Image Mounted
properties.description: Detects the mount of an ISO image on an endpoint
properties.author: Syed Hasan (@syedhasan009)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin - Security
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Kerberos RC4 Ticket Encryption
properties.description: Detects service ticket requests using RC4 encryption type
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Reconnaissance Activity
properties.description: Detects activity as "net user administrator /domain" and "net group domain admins /domain"
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jack Croock (method), Jonhnathan Ribeiro (improvements), oscd.community

properties.name: PowerShell Scripts Installed as Services - Security
properties.description: Detects powershell script installed as a Service
properties.author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova

properties.name: Service Installed By Unusual Client - Security
properties.description: Detects a service installed by a client which has PID 0 or whose parent has PID 0

properties.name: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe
properties.description: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: ETW Logging Disabled In .NET Processes - Registry
properties.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Suspicious PsExec Execution
properties.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: SAM Registry Hive Handle Request
properties.description: Detects handles requested to SAM registry hive
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION - Security
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Powerview Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync AD Extend Right
properties.description: Backdooring domain object to grant the rights associated with DCSync to a regular user or machine account using Powerview\Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync Extended Right cmdlet, will allow to re-obtain the pwd hashes of any user/computer
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden, Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, Maxence Fossat

properties.name: Kerberoasting Activity - Initial Query
properties.description:
This rule will collect the data needed to start looking into possible kerberoasting activity.
Further analysis or computation within the query is needed focusing on requests from one specific host/IP towards multiple service names within a time period of 5 seconds.
You can then set a threshold for the number of requests and time between the requests to turn this into an alert.
properties.author: @kostastsale

properties.name: Local User Creation
properties.description: Detects local user creation on Windows servers, which shouldn't happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your Windows server logs and not on your DC logs.
properties.author: Patrick Bareiss

properties.name: Kerberos Manipulation
properties.description: Detects failed Kerberos TGT issue operation. This can be a sign of manipulations of TGT messages by an attacker.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: NetNTLM Downgrade Attack
properties.description: Detects NetNTLM downgrade attack
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), wagga

properties.name: External Disk Drive Or USB Storage Device Was Recognized By The System
properties.description: Detects external disk drives or plugged-in USB devices.
properties.author: Keith Wright

properties.name: Password Protected ZIP File Opened (Suspicious Filenames)
properties.description: Detects the extraction of password protected ZIP archives with suspicious file names. See the filename variable for more details on which file has been opened.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Startup/Logon Script Added to Group Policy Object
properties.description: Detects the modification of Group Policy Objects (GPO) to add a startup/logon script to users or computer objects.
properties.author: Elastic, Josh Nickels, Marius Rothenbcher

properties.name: Addition of SID History to Active Directory Object
properties.description: An attacker can use the SID history attribute to gain additional privileges.
properties.author: Thomas Patzke, @atc_project (improvements)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher - Security
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: Credential Dumping Tools Service Execution - Security
properties.description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: Password Protected ZIP File Opened
properties.description: Detects the extraction of password protected ZIP archives. See the filename variable for more details on which file has been opened.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Active Directory User Backdoors
properties.description: Detects scenarios where one can control another users or computers account without having to use their credentials.
properties.author: @neu5ron

properties.name: User Logoff Event
properties.description: Detects a user log-off activity. Could be used for example to correlate information during forensic investigations
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Secure Deletion with SDelete
properties.description: Detects files that have extensions commonly seen while SDelete is used to wipe files.
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: VSSAudit Security Event Source Registration
properties.description: Detects the registration of the security event source VSSAudit. It would usually trigger when volume shadow copy operations happen.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR)

properties.name: AD Privileged Users or Groups Reconnaissance
properties.description: Detect priv users or groups recon based on 4661 eventid and known privileged users or groups SIDs
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: Weak Encryption Enabled and Kerberoast
properties.description: Detects scenario where weak encryption is enabled for a user profile which could be used for hash/password cracking.
properties.author: @neu5ron

properties.name: User Couldn't Call a Privileged Service 'LsaRegisterLogonProcess'
properties.description: The 'LsaRegisterLogonProcess' function verifies that the application making the function call is a logon process by checking that it has the SeTcbPrivilege privilege set. Possible Rubeus tries to get a handle to LSA.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (source), Ilyas Ochkov (rule), oscd.community

properties.name: Azure AD Health Service Agents Registry Keys Access
properties.description:
This detection uses Windows security events to detect suspicious access attempts to the registry key values and sub-keys of Azure AD Health service agents (e.g AD FS).
Information from AD Health service agents can be used to potentially abuse some of the features provided by those services in the cloud (e.g. Federation).
This detection requires an access control entry (ACE) on the system access control list (SACL) of the following securable object: HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\ADHealthAgent.
Make sure you set the SACL to propagate to its sub-keys.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research), MSTIC

properties.name: HackTool - NoFilter Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of NoFilter, a tool for abusing the Windows Filtering Platform for privilege escalation via hardcoded policy name indicators
properties.author: Stamatis Chatzimangou (st0pp3r)

properties.name: HackTool - EDRSilencer Execution - Filter Added
properties.description: Detects execution of EDRSilencer, a tool that abuses the Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) to block the outbound traffic of running EDR agents based on specific hardcoded filter names.
properties.author: Thodoris Polyzos (@SmoothDeploy)

properties.name: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares
properties.description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community

properties.name: RDP over Reverse SSH Tunnel WFP
properties.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account
properties.description:
Detects potential attempts made to set the Directory Services Restore Mode administrator password.
The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers.
Attackers may change the password in order to obtain persistence.
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: SCM Database Privileged Operation
properties.description: Detects non-system users performing privileged operation os the SCM database
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Tim Shelton

properties.name: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity
properties.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden, wagga

properties.name: LSASS Access From Non System Account
properties.description: Detects potential mimikatz-like tools accessing LSASS from non system account
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Device Installation Blocked
properties.description: Detects an installation of a device that is forbidden by the system policy
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Access to Sensitive File Extensions
properties.description: Detects known sensitive file extensions accessed on a network share
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: Enabled User Right in AD to Control User Objects
properties.description: Detects scenario where if a user is assigned the SeEnableDelegationPrivilege right in Active Directory it would allow control of other AD user objects.
properties.author: @neu5ron

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip - Security
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Possible DC Shadow Attack
properties.description: Detects DCShadow via create new SPN
properties.author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community, Chakib Gzenayi (@Chak092), Hosni Mribah

properties.name: Uncommon Outbound Kerberos Connection - Security
properties.description: Detects uncommon outbound network activity via Kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.
properties.author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community

properties.name: PetitPotam Suspicious Kerberos TGT Request
properties.description:
Detect suspicious Kerberos TGT requests.
Once an attacer obtains a computer certificate by abusing Active Directory Certificate Services in combination with PetitPotam, the next step would be to leverage the certificate for malicious purposes.
One way of doing this is to request a Kerberos Ticket Granting Ticket using a tool like Rubeus.
This request will generate a 4768 event with some unusual fields depending on the environment.
This analytic will require tuning, we recommend filtering Account_Name to the Domain Controller computer accounts.
properties.author: Mauricio Velazco, Michael Haag

properties.name: Access To ADMIN$ Network Share
properties.description: Detects access to ADMIN$ network share
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Pcap Drivers
properties.description: Detects Windows Pcap driver installation based on a list of associated .sys files.
properties.author: Cian Heasley

properties.name: Potential AS-REP Roasting via Kerberos TGT Requests
properties.description:
Detects suspicious Kerberos TGT requests with pre-authentication disabled (Pre-Authentication Type = 0) and Ticket Encryption Type (0x17) i.e, RC4-HMAC.
This may indicate an AS-REP Roasting attack, where attackers request AS-REP messages for accounts without pre-authentication and attempt to crack the encrypted ticket offline to recover user passwords.
properties.author: ANosir

properties.name: DPAPI Domain Master Key Backup Attempt
properties.description: Detects anyone attempting a backup for the DPAPI Master Key. This events gets generated at the source and not the Domain Controller.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER - Security
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Update
properties.description: Detects update to a scheduled task event that contain suspicious keywords.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Important Scheduled Task Deleted/Disabled
properties.description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by deleting or disabling their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential AD User Enumeration From Non-Machine Account
properties.description: Detects read access to a domain user from a non-machine account
properties.author: Maxime Thiebaut (@0xThiebaut)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA - Security
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: CobaltStrike Service Installations - Security
properties.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Wojciech Lesicki

properties.name: Sysmon Channel Reference Deletion
properties.description: Potential threat actor tampering with Sysmon manifest and eventually disabling it
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Potential Privilege Escalation via Local Kerberos Relay over LDAP
properties.description:
Detects a suspicious local successful logon event where the Logon Package is Kerberos, the remote address is set to localhost, and the target user SID is the built-in local Administrator account.
This may indicate an attempt to leverage a Kerberos relay attack variant that can be used to elevate privilege locally from a domain joined limited user to local System privileges.
properties.author: Elastic, @SBousseaden

properties.name: DiagTrackEoP Default Login Username
properties.description: Detects the default "UserName" used by the DiagTrackEoP POC
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: RDP Login from Localhost
properties.description: RDP login with localhost source address may be a tunnelled login
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: A Security-Enabled Global Group Was Deleted
properties.description: Detects activity when a security-enabled global group is deleted
properties.author: Alexandr Yampolskyi, SOC Prime

properties.name: External Remote SMB Logon from Public IP
properties.description: Detects successful logon from public IP address via SMB. This can indicate a publicly-exposed SMB port.
properties.author: Micah Babinski (@micahbabinski), Zach Mathis (@yamatosecurity)

properties.name: RottenPotato Like Attack Pattern
properties.description: Detects logon events that have characteristics of events generated during an attack with RottenPotato and the like
properties.author: @SBousseaden, Florian Roth

properties.name: Outgoing Logon with New Credentials
properties.description: Detects logon events that specify new credentials

properties.name: External Remote RDP Logon from Public IP

properties.author: Micah Babinski (@micahbabinski), Zach Mathis (@yamatosecurity)

properties.name: Failed Logon From Public IP

properties.name: Successful Account Login Via WMI
