properties.name: Pass the Hash Activity 2
properties.description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network
properties.author: Dave Kennedy, Jeff Warren (method) / David Vassallo (rule)

properties.name: A Member Was Removed From a Security-Enabled Global Group
properties.description: Detects activity when a member is removed from a security-enabled global group
properties.author: Alexandr Yampolskyi, SOC Prime

properties.name: Potential Access Token Abuse
properties.description: Detects potential token impersonation and theft. Example, when using "DuplicateToken(Ex)" and "ImpersonateLoggedOnUser" with the "LOGON32_LOGON_NEW_CREDENTIALS flag".
properties.author: Michaela Adams, Zach Mathis

properties.name: A Member Was Added to a Security-Enabled Global Group
properties.description: Detects activity when a member is added to a security-enabled global group
properties.author: Alexandr Yampolskyi, SOC Prime

properties.name: Successful Overpass the Hash Attempt
properties.description: Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz's sekurlsa::pth module.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (source), Dominik Schaudel (rule)

properties.name: Admin User Remote Logon
properties.description: Detect remote login by Administrator user (depending on internal pattern).
properties.author: juju4

properties.name: Windows Filtering Platform Blocked Connection From EDR Agent Binary
properties.description:
Detects a Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) blocked connection event involving common Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents.
Adversaries may use WFP filters to prevent Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents from reporting security events.
properties.author: @gott_cyber

properties.name: WMI Persistence
properties.description: Detects suspicious WMI event filter and command line event consumer based on WMI and Security Logs.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin oscd.community

properties.name: BITS Transfer Job Downloading File Potential Suspicious Extension
properties.description: Detects new BITS transfer job saving local files with potential suspicious extensions
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: BITS Transfer Job Download To Potential Suspicious Folder
properties.description: Detects new BITS transfer job where the LocalName/Saved file is stored in a potentially suspicious location
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: BITS Transfer Job Download From Direct IP
properties.description: Detects a BITS transfer job downloading file(s) from a direct IP address.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New BITS Job Created Via Bitsadmin
properties.description: Detects the creation of a new bits job by Bitsadmin
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: New BITS Job Created Via PowerShell
properties.description: Detects the creation of a new bits job by PowerShell
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: BITS Transfer Job With Uncommon Or Suspicious Remote TLD
properties.description: Detects a suspicious download using the BITS client from a FQDN that is unusual. Adversaries may abuse BITS jobs to persistently execute or clean up after malicious payloads.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: BITS Transfer Job Download From File Sharing Domains
properties.description: Detects BITS transfer job downloading files from a file sharing domain.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Module Module Added To IIS Server
properties.description: Detects the addition of a new module to an IIS server.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Previously Installed IIS Module Was Removed
properties.description: Detects the removal of a previously installed IIS module.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: HTTP Logging Disabled On IIS Server
properties.description: Detects changes to of the IIS server configuration in order to disable HTTP logging for successful requests.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: ETW Logging/Processing Option Disabled On IIS Server
properties.description: Detects changes to of the IIS server configuration in order to disable/remove the ETW logging/processing option.
properties.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: NTLM Logon
properties.description: Detects logons using NTLM, which could be caused by a legacy source or attackers
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Remote Desktop Connection to Non-Domain Host
properties.description: Detects logons using NTLM to hosts that are potentially not part of the domain.
properties.author: James Pemberton

properties.name: NTLM Brute Force
properties.description: Detects common NTLM brute force device names
properties.author: Jerry Shockley '@jsh0x'

properties.name: Potential Active Directory Reconnaissance/Enumeration Via LDAP
properties.description: Detects potential Active Directory enumeration via LDAP
properties.author: Adeem Mawani

properties.name: OpenSSH Server Listening On Socket
properties.description: Detects scenarios where an attacker enables the OpenSSH server and server starts to listening on SSH socket.
properties.author: mdecrevoisier

properties.name: Microsoft Defender Blocked from Loading Unsigned DLL
properties.description: Detects Code Integrity (CI) engine blocking Microsoft Defender's processes (MpCmdRun and NisSrv) from loading unsigned DLLs which may be an attempt to sideload arbitrary DLL
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Unsigned Binary Loaded From Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects Code Integrity (CI) engine blocking processes from loading unsigned DLLs residing in suspicious locations
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Application Installed
properties.description: Detects suspicious application installed by looking at the added shortcut to the app resolver cache
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Ngrok Usage with Remote Desktop Service
properties.description: Detects cases in which ngrok, a reverse proxy tool, forwards events to the local RDP port, which could be a sign of malicious behaviour
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Sysinternals Tools AppX Versions Execution
properties.description: Detects execution of Sysinternals tools via an AppX package. Attackers could install the Sysinternals Suite to get access to tools such as psexec and procdump to avoid detection based on System paths
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Crash Dump Created By Operating System
properties.description: Detects "BugCheck" errors indicating the system rebooted due to a crash, capturing the bugcheck code, dump file path, and report ID.
properties.author: Jason Mull

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA - System
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Windows Defender Threat Detection Service Disabled
properties.description: Detects when the "Windows Defender Threat Protection" service is disabled.
properties.author: Jn Trenansk, frack113

properties.name: Anydesk Remote Access Software Service Installation
properties.description: Detects the installation of the anydesk software service. Which could be an indication of anydesk abuse if you the software isn't already used.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Service Installation Image Path
properties.description: Detects uncommon service installation commands by looking at suspicious or uncommon image path values containing references to encoded powershell commands, temporary paths, etc.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CobaltStrike Service Installations - System
properties.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Wojciech Lesicki

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER - System
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Remote Utilities Host Service Install
properties.description: Detects Remote Utilities Host service installation on the target system.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: RemCom Service Installation
properties.description: Detects RemCom service installation and execution events
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Service Installation in Suspicious Folder
properties.description: Detects service installation in suspicious folder appdata
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Mesh Agent Service Installation
properties.description: Detects a Mesh Agent service installation. Mesh Agent is used to remotely manage computers
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PsExec Service Installation
properties.description: Detects PsExec service installation and execution events
properties.author: Thomas Patzke

properties.name: Sliver C2 Default Service Installation
properties.description: Detects known malicious service installation that appear in cases in which a Sliver implants execute the PsExec commands
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Service Installation Script
properties.description: Detects suspicious service installation scripts
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ProcessHacker Privilege Elevation
properties.description: Detects a ProcessHacker tool that elevated privileges to a very high level
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: RTCore Suspicious Service Installation
properties.description: Detects the installation of RTCore service. Which could be an indication of Micro-Star MSI Afterburner vulnerable driver abuse
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION - System
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Meterpreter or Cobalt Strike Getsystem Service Installation - System
properties.description: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service installation
properties.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Ecco, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Important Windows Service Terminated With Error
properties.description: Detects important or interesting Windows services that got terminated for whatever reason
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PowerShell Scripts Installed as Services
properties.description: Detects powershell script installed as a Service
properties.author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova

properties.name: Credential Dumping Tools Service Execution - System
properties.description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

properties.name: Service Installation with Suspicious Folder Pattern
properties.description: Detects service installation with suspicious folder patterns
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Service Installation
properties.description: Detects suspicious service installation commands
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher - System
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: HackTool Service Registration or Execution
properties.description: Detects installation or execution of services
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New PDQDeploy Service - Server Side
properties.description:
Detects a PDQDeploy service installation which indicates that PDQDeploy was installed on the machines.
PDQDeploy can be abused by attackers to remotely install packages or execute commands on target machines
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PAExec Service Installation
properties.description: Detects PAExec service installation
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Moriya Rootkit - System
properties.description: Detects the use of Moriya rootkit as described in the securelist's Operation TunnelSnake report
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Tap Driver Installation
properties.description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunnelling techniques
properties.author: Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Ian Davis, oscd.community

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION - System
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER
properties.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

properties.name: Service Installed By Unusual Client - System
properties.description: Detects a service installed by a client which has PID 0 or whose parent has PID 0
properties.author: Tim Rauch (Nextron Systems), Elastic (idea)

properties.name: New PDQDeploy Service - Client Side
properties.description:
Detects PDQDeploy service installation on the target system.
When a package is deployed via PDQDeploy it installs a remote service on the target machine with the name "PDQDeployRunner-X" where "X" is an integer starting from 1
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin - System
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher - System
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: KrbRelayUp Service Installation
properties.description: Detects service creation from KrbRelayUp tool used for privilege escalation in Windows domain environments where LDAP signing is not enforced (the default settings)
properties.author: Sittikorn S, Tim Shelton

properties.name: smbexec.py Service Installation
properties.description: Detects the use of smbexec.py tool by detecting a specific service installation
properties.author: Omer Faruk Celik

properties.name: Important Windows Service Terminated Unexpectedly
properties.description: Detects important or interesting Windows services that got terminated unexpectedly.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation - System
properties.description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the code block linked in the references
properties.author: Daniel Bohannon (@Mandiant/@FireEye), oscd.community

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip - System
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher - System
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell
properties.author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community

properties.name: TacticalRMM Service Installation
properties.description: Detects a TacticalRMM service installation. Tactical RMM is a remote monitoring & management tool.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32 - System
properties.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts
properties.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community

properties.name: NetSupport Manager Service Install
properties.description: Detects NetSupport Manager service installation on the target system.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Service Terminated With Error
properties.description: Detects Windows services that got terminated for whatever reason
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool Services Have Been Installed - System
properties.description: Detects service installation of different remote access tools software. These software are often abused by threat actors to perform
properties.author: Connor Martin, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: CSExec Service Installation
properties.description: Detects CSExec service installation and execution events
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Update Error
properties.description: Detects Windows update errors including installation failures and connection issues. Defenders should observe this in case critical update KBs aren't installed.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Important Windows Eventlog Cleared
properties.description: Detects the clearing of one of the Windows Core Eventlogs. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Eventlog Cleared
properties.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ISATAP Router Address Was Set
properties.description:
Detects the configuration of a new ISATAP router on a Windows host. While ISATAP is a legitimate Microsoft technology for IPv6 transition, unexpected or unauthorized ISATAP router configurations could indicate a potential IPv6 DNS Takeover attack using tools like mitm6.
In such attacks, adversaries advertise themselves as DHCPv6 servers and set malicious ISATAP routers to intercept traffic.
This detection should be correlated with network baselines and known legitimate ISATAP deployments in your environment.
properties.author: hamid

properties.name: Volume Shadow Copy Mount
properties.description: Detects volume shadow copy mount via Windows event log
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR)

properties.name: Zerologon Exploitation Using Well-known Tools
properties.description: This rule is designed to detect attempts to exploit Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472) vulnerability using mimikatz zerologon module or other exploits from machine with "kali" hostname.
properties.author: Demyan Sokolin @_drd0c, Teymur Kheirkhabarov @HeirhabarovT, oscd.community

properties.name: Vulnerable Netlogon Secure Channel Connection Allowed
properties.description: Detects that a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection was allowed, which could be an indicator of CVE-2020-1472.
properties.author: NVISO

properties.name: No Suitable Encryption Key Found For Generating Kerberos Ticket
properties.description:
Detects errors when a target server doesn't have suitable keys for generating kerberos tickets.
This issue can occur for example when a service uses a user account or a computer account that is configured for only DES encryption on a computer that is running Windows 7 which has DES encryption for Kerberos authentication disabled.
properties.author: @SerkinValery

properties.name: Certificate Use With No Strong Mapping
properties.description:
Detects a user certificate that was valid but could not be mapped to a user in a strong way (such as via explicit mapping, key trust mapping, or a SID)
This could be a sign of exploitation of the elevation of privilege vulnerabilities (CVE-2022-34691, CVE-2022-26931, CVE-2022-26923) that can occur when the KDC allows certificate spoofing by not requiring a strong mapping.
Events where the AccountName and CN of the Subject do not match, or where the CN ends in a dollar sign indicating a machine, may indicate certificate spoofing.
properties.author: @br4dy5

properties.name: Local Privilege Escalation Indicator TabTip
properties.description: Detects the invocation of TabTip via CLSID as seen when JuicyPotatoNG is used on a system in brute force mode
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Active Directory Certificate Services Denied Certificate Enrollment Request
properties.description:
Detects denied requests by Active Directory Certificate Services.
Example of these requests denial include issues with permissions on the certificate template or invalid signatures.
properties.author: @SerkinValery

properties.name: Critical Hive In Suspicious Location Access Bits Cleared
properties.description:
Detects events from the Kernel-General ETW indicating that the access bits of a hive with a system like hive name located in the temp directory have been reset.
This occurs when an application tries to access a hive and the hive has not be recognized since the last 7 days (by default).
Registry hive dumping utilities such as QuarksPwDump were seen emitting this behavior.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: NTLMv1 Logon Between Client and Server
properties.description: Detects the reporting of NTLMv1 being used between a client and server. NTLMv1 is insecure as the underlying encryption algorithms can be brute-forced by modern hardware.
properties.author: Tim Shelton, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DHCP Server Error Failed Loading the CallOut DLL
properties.description: This rule detects a DHCP server error in which a specified Callout DLL (in registry) could not be loaded
properties.author: Dimitrios Slamaris, @atc_project (fix)

properties.name: DHCP Server Loaded the CallOut DLL
properties.description: This rule detects a DHCP server in which a specified Callout DLL (in registry) was loaded
properties.author: Dimitrios Slamaris

properties.name: NTFS Vulnerability Exploitation
properties.description: This the exploitation of a NTFS vulnerability as reported without many details via Twitter
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Sysmon Application Crashed
properties.description: Detects application popup reporting a failure of the Sysmon service
properties.author: Tim Shelton

properties.name: Certificate Request Export to Exchange Webserver
properties.description: Detects a write of an Exchange CSR to an untypical directory or with aspx name suffix which can be used to place a webshell
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: MSExchange Transport Agent Installation - Builtin
properties.description: Detects the Installation of a Exchange Transport Agent
properties.author: Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Exchange Set OabVirtualDirectory ExternalUrl Property
properties.description: Rule to detect an adversary setting OabVirtualDirectory External URL property to a script in Exchange Management log
properties.author: Jose Rodriguez @Cyb3rPandaH

properties.name: Failed MSExchange Transport Agent Installation
properties.description: Detects a failed installation of a Exchange Transport Agent
properties.author: Tobias Michalski (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remove Exported Mailbox from Exchange Webserver
properties.description: Detects removal of an exported Exchange mailbox which could be to cover tracks from ProxyShell exploit
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: ProxyLogon MSExchange OabVirtualDirectory
properties.description: Detects specific patterns found after a successful ProxyLogon exploitation in relation to a Commandlet invocation of Set-OabVirtualDirectory
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Mailbox Export to Exchange Webserver
properties.description: Detects a successful export of an Exchange mailbox to untypical directory or with aspx name suffix which can be used to place a webshell or the needed role assignment for it
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Rich Warren, Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Rejected SMB Guest Logon From IP
properties.description: Detect Attempt PrintNightmare (CVE-2021-1675) Remote code execution in Windows Spooler Service
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), KevTheHermit, fuzzyf10w

properties.name: Windows Defender Exploit Guard Tamper
properties.description: Detects when someone is adding or removing applications or folders from exploit guard "ProtectedFolders" or "AllowedApplications"
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Win Defender Restored Quarantine File
properties.description: Detects the restoration of files from the defender quarantine
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: PSExec and WMI Process Creations Block
properties.description: Detects blocking of process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Microsoft Defender Tamper Protection Trigger
properties.description: Detects blocked attempts to change any of Defender's settings such as "Real Time Monitoring" and "Behavior Monitoring"
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj, Nasreddine Bencherchali

properties.name: Windows Defender Grace Period Expired
properties.description: Detects the expiration of the grace period of Windows Defender. This means protection against viruses, spyware, and other potentially unwanted software is disabled.
properties.author: Jn Trenansk, frack113

properties.name: Windows Defender Threat Detected
properties.description: Detects actions taken by Windows Defender malware detection engines
properties.author: Jn Trenansk

properties.name: Windows Defender AMSI Trigger Detected
properties.description: Detects triggering of AMSI by Windows Defender.
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Windows Defender Real-time Protection Disabled
properties.description: Detects disabling of Windows Defender Real-time Protection. As this event doesn't contain a lot of information on who initiated this action you might want to reduce it to a "medium" level if this occurs too many times in your environment
properties.author: Jn Trenansk, frack113

properties.name: LSASS Access Detected via Attack Surface Reduction
properties.description: Detects Access to LSASS Process
properties.author: Markus Neis

properties.name: Windows Defender Real-Time Protection Failure/Restart
properties.description: Detects issues with Windows Defender Real-Time Protection features
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock' (Update)

properties.name: Windows Defender Malware Detection History Deletion
properties.description: Windows Defender logs when the history of detected infections is deleted.
properties.author: Cian Heasley

properties.name: Windows Defender Submit Sample Feature Disabled
properties.description: Detects disabling of the "Automatic Sample Submission" feature of Windows Defender.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Defender Configuration Changes
properties.description: Detects suspicious changes to the Windows Defender configuration
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Defender Virus Scanning Feature Disabled
properties.description: Detects disabling of the Windows Defender virus scanning feature
properties.author: Jn Trenansk, frack113

properties.name: Windows Defender Exclusions Added
properties.description: Detects the Setting of Windows Defender Exclusions
properties.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Windows Defender Malware And PUA Scanning Disabled
properties.description: Detects disabling of the Windows Defender feature of scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software
properties.author: Jn Trenansk, frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing - DNS Client
properties.description: Detects a program that invoked suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Query Tor Onion Address - DNS Client
properties.description: Detects DNS resolution of an .onion address related to Tor routing networks
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DNS Query To Put.io - DNS Client
properties.description: Detects DNS queries for subdomains related to "Put.io" sharing website.
properties.author: Omar Khaled (@beacon_exe)

properties.name: DNS Query for Anonfiles.com Domain - DNS Client
properties.description: Detects DNS queries for anonfiles.com, which is an anonymous file upload platform often used for malicious purposes
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DNS Query To Ufile.io - DNS Client
properties.description: Detects DNS queries to "ufile.io", which was seen abused by malware and threat actors as a method for data exfiltration
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DNS Query To MEGA Hosting Website - DNS Client
properties.description: Detects DNS queries for subdomains related to MEGA sharing website
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Crash
properties.description: This rule detects a suspicious crash of the Microsoft Malware Protection Engine
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Credential Dumping Via WER - Application
properties.description: Detects Windows error reporting event where the process that crashed is lsass. This could be the cause of an intentional crash by techniques such as Lsass-Shtinkering to dump credential
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Audit CVE Event
properties.description:
Detects events generated by user-mode applications when they call the CveEventWrite API when a known vulnerability is trying to be exploited.
MS started using this log in Jan. 2020 with CVE-2020-0601 (a Windows CryptoAPI vulnerability.
Unfortunately, that is about the only instance of CVEs being written to this log.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Zach Mathis

properties.name: Relevant Anti-Virus Signature Keywords In Application Log
properties.description: Detects potentially highly relevant antivirus events in the application log based on known virus signature names and malware keywords.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Arnim Rupp

properties.name: Restricted Software Access By SRP
properties.description: Detects restricted access to applications by the Software Restriction Policies (SRP) policy
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Atera Agent Installation
properties.description: Detects successful installation of Atera Remote Monitoring & Management (RMM) agent as recently found to be used by Conti operators
properties.author: Bhabesh Raj

properties.name: Application Uninstalled
properties.description: An application has been removed. Check if it is critical.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: MSI Installation From Suspicious Locations
properties.description: Detects MSI package installation from suspicious locations
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: MSI Installation From Web
properties.description: Detects installation of a remote msi file from web.
properties.author: Stamatis Chatzimangou

properties.name: MSSQL XPCmdshell Option Change
properties.description: Detects when the MSSQL "xp_cmdshell" stored procedure setting is changed.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: MSSQL Disable Audit Settings
properties.description: Detects when an attacker calls the "ALTER SERVER AUDIT" or "DROP SERVER AUDIT" transaction in order to delete or disable audit logs on the server
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: MSSQL Destructive Query
properties.description: Detects the invocation of MS SQL transactions that are destructive towards table or database data, such as "DROP TABLE" or "DROP DATABASE".
properties.author: Daniel Degasperi '@d4ns4n_'

properties.name: MSSQL Add Account To Sysadmin Role
properties.description: Detects when an attacker tries to backdoor the MSSQL server by adding a backdoor account to the sysadmin fixed server role
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: MSSQL Server Failed Logon
properties.description: Detects failed logon attempts from clients to MSSQL server.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), j4son

properties.name: MSSQL Server Failed Logon From External Network
properties.description: Detects failed logon attempts from clients with external network IP to an MSSQL server. This can be a sign of a bruteforce attack.
properties.author: j4son

properties.name: MSSQL SPProcoption Set
properties.description: Detects when the a stored procedure is set or cleared for automatic execution in MSSQL. A stored procedure that is set to automatic execution runs every time an instance of SQL Server is started
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: MSSQL XPCmdshell Suspicious Execution
properties.description: Detects when the MSSQL "xp_cmdshell" stored procedure is used to execute commands
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Dump Ntds.dit To Suspicious Location
properties.description: Detects potential abuse of ntdsutil to dump ntds.dit database to a suspicious location
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Ntdsutil Abuse
properties.description: Detects potential abuse of ntdsutil to dump ntds.dit database
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Backup Catalog Deleted
properties.description: Detects backup catalog deletions
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tom U. @c_APT_ure (collection)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Command Execution
properties.description: Detects command execution via ScreenConnect RMM
properties.author: Ali Alwashali

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect File Transfer
properties.description: Detects file being transferred via ScreenConnect RMM
properties.author: Ali Alwashali

properties.name: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Crash - WER
properties.description: This rule detects a suspicious crash of the Microsoft Malware Protection Engine
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: USB Device Plugged
properties.description: Detects plugged/unplugged USB devices
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Deployment AppX Package Was Blocked By AppLocker
properties.description: Detects an appx package deployment that was blocked by AppLocker policy
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious AppX Package Locations
properties.description: Detects an appx package added the pipeline of the "to be processed" packages which is located in suspicious locations
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Deployment Of The AppX Package Was Blocked By The Policy
properties.description: Detects an appx package deployment that was blocked by the local computer policy
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Suspicious Remote AppX Package Locations
properties.description: Detects an appx package added to the pipeline of the "to be processed" packages which was downloaded from a suspicious domain.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon AppX Package Locations
properties.description: Detects an appx package added the pipeline of the "to be processed" packages which is located in uncommon locations
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potential Malicious AppX Package Installation Attempts
properties.description: Detects potential installation or installation attempts of known malicious appx packages
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious AppX Package Installation Attempt
properties.description: Detects an appx package installation with the error code "0x80073cff" which indicates that the package didn't meet the signing requirements and could be suspicious
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Standard User In High Privileged Group
properties.description: Detect standard users login that are part of high privileged groups such as the Administrator group
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: CodeIntegrity - Blocked Driver Load With Revoked Certificate
properties.description: Detects blocked load attempts of revoked drivers
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CodeIntegrity - Disallowed File For Protected Processes Has Been Blocked
properties.description: Detects block events for files that are disallowed by code integrity for protected processes
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CodeIntegrity - Blocked Image Load With Revoked Certificate
properties.description: Detects blocked image load events with revoked certificates by code integrity.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CodeIntegrity - Unmet Signing Level Requirements By File Under Validation
properties.description:
Detects attempted file load events that did not meet the signing level requirements. It often means the file's signature is revoked or a signature with the Lifetime Signing EKU has expired.
This event is best correlated with EID 3089 to determine the error of the validation.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CodeIntegrity - Unsigned Image Loaded
properties.description: Detects loaded unsigned image on the system
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CodeIntegrity - Revoked Image Loaded
properties.description: Detects image load events with revoked certificates by code integrity.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CodeIntegrity - Revoked Kernel Driver Loaded
properties.description: Detects the load of a revoked kernel driver
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CodeIntegrity - Unmet WHQL Requirements For Loaded Kernel Module
properties.description: Detects loaded kernel modules that did not meet the WHQL signing requirements.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CodeIntegrity - Unsigned Kernel Module Loaded
properties.description: Detects the presence of a loaded unsigned kernel module on the system.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: CodeIntegrity - Blocked Image/Driver Load For Policy Violation
properties.description: Detects blocked load events that did not meet the authenticode signing level requirements or violated the code integrity policy.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Loading Diagcab Package From Remote Path
properties.description: Detects loading of diagcab packages from a remote path, as seen in DogWalk vulnerability
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DNS Query To Visual Studio Code Tunnels Domain
properties.description: Detects DNS query requests to Visual Studio Code tunnel domains. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.
properties.author: citron_ninja

properties.name: TeamViewer Domain Query By Non-TeamViewer Application
properties.description: Detects DNS queries to a TeamViewer domain only resolved by a TeamViewer client by an image that isn't named TeamViewer (sometimes used by threat actors for obfuscation)
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DNS Query To AzureWebsites.NET By Non-Browser Process
properties.description: Detects a DNS query by a non browser process on the system to "azurewebsites.net". The latter was often used by threat actors as a malware hosting and exfiltration site.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DNS Query Request To OneLaunch Update Service
properties.description:
Detects DNS query requests to "update.onelaunch.com". This domain is associated with the OneLaunch adware application.
When the OneLaunch application is installed it will attempt to get updates from this domain.
properties.author: Josh Nickels

properties.name: DNS Query To Common Malware Hosting and Shortener Services
properties.description:
Detects DNS queries to domains commonly used by threat actors to host malware payloads or redirect through URL shorteners.
These include platforms like Cloudflare Workers, TryCloudflare, InfinityFree, and URL shorteners such as tinyurl and lihi.cc.
Such DNS activity can indicate potential delivery or command-and-control communication attempts.
properties.author: Ahmed Nosir (@egycondor)

properties.name: DNS Query To Devtunnels Domain
properties.description: Detects DNS query requests to Devtunnels domains. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.
properties.author: citron_ninja

properties.name: Cloudflared Tunnels Related DNS Requests
properties.description:
Detects DNS requests to Cloudflared tunnels domains.
Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DNS HybridConnectionManager Service Bus
properties.description: Detects Azure Hybrid Connection Manager services querying the Azure service bus service
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: DNS Query Request By Regsvr32.EXE
properties.description: Detects DNS queries initiated by "Regsvr32.exe"
properties.author: Dmitriy Lifanov, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious DNS Query Indicating Kerberos Coercion via DNS Object SPN Spoofing
properties.description:
Detects DNS queries containing patterns associated with Kerberos coercion attacks via DNS object spoofing.
The pattern "1UWhRCAAAAA..BAAAA" is a base64-encoded signature that corresponds to a marshaled CREDENTIAL_TARGET_INFORMATION structure.
Attackers can use this technique to coerce authentication from victim systems to attacker-controlled hosts.
It is one of the strong indicators of a Kerberos coercion attack, where adversaries manipulate DNS records
to spoof Service Principal Names (SPNs) and redirect authentication requests like CVE-2025-33073.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DNS Query Request By QuickAssist.EXE
properties.description: Detects DNS queries initiated by "QuickAssist.exe" to Microsoft Quick Assist primary endpoint that is used to establish a session.
properties.author: Muhammad Faisal (@faisalusuf)

properties.name: DNS Server Discovery Via LDAP Query
properties.description: Detects DNS server discovery via LDAP query requests from uncommon applications
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: DNS Query for Anonfiles.com Domain - Sysmon
properties.description: Detects DNS queries for "anonfiles.com", which is an anonymous file upload platform often used for malicious purposes
properties.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: DNS Query To Ufile.io
properties.description: Detects DNS queries to "ufile.io", which was seen abused by malware and threat actors as a method for data exfiltration
properties.author: yatinwad, TheDFIRReport

properties.name: Suspicious DNS Query for IP Lookup Service APIs
properties.description: Detects DNS queries for IP lookup services such as "api.ipify.org" originating from a non browser process.
properties.author: Brandon George (blog post), Thomas Patzke

properties.name: DNS Query Tor .Onion Address - Sysmon
properties.description: Detects DNS queries to an ".onion" address related to Tor routing networks
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: AppX Package Installation Attempts Via AppInstaller.EXE
properties.description: Detects DNS queries made by "AppInstaller.EXE". The AppInstaller is the default handler for the "ms-appinstaller" URI. It attempts to load/install a package from the referenced URL
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: DNS Query To MEGA Hosting Website
properties.description: Detects DNS queries for subdomains related to MEGA sharing website
properties.author: Aaron Greetham (@beardofbinary) - NCC Group

properties.name: DNS Query To Remote Access Software Domain From Non-Browser App
properties.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
properties.author: frack113, Connor Martin

properties.name: DNS Query by Finger Utility
properties.description:
Detects DNS queries made by the finger utility, which can be abused by threat actors to retrieve remote commands for execution on Windows devices.
In one ClickFix malware campaign, adversaries leveraged the finger protocol to fetch commands from a remote server.
Since the finger utility is not commonly used in modern Windows environments, its presence already raises suspicion.
Investigating such DNS queries can also help identify potential malicious infrastructure used by threat actors for command and control (C2) communication.
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing - Sysmon
properties.description: Detects a program that invoked suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: New Connection Initiated To Potential Dead Drop Resolver Domain
properties.description:
Detects an executable, which is not an internet browser or known application, initiating network connections to legit popular websites, which were seen to be used as dead drop resolvers in previous attacks.
In this context attackers leverage known websites such as "facebook", "youtube", etc. In order to pass through undetected.
properties.author: Sorina Ionescu, X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Cmstp.EXE
properties.description:
Detects a network connection initiated by Cmstp.EXE
Its uncommon for "cmstp.exe" to initiate an outbound network connection. Investigate the source of such requests to determine if they are malicious.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Uncommon Connection to Active Directory Web Services
properties.description: Detects uncommon network connections to the Active Directory Web Services (ADWS) from processes not typically associated with ADWS management.
properties.author: @kostastsale

properties.name: Uncommon Network Connection Initiated By Certutil.EXE
properties.description:
Detects a network connection initiated by the certutil.exe utility.
Attackers can abuse the utility in order to download malware or additional payloads.
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Wordpad Outbound Connections
properties.description:
Detects a network connection initiated by "wordpad.exe" over uncommon destination ports.
This might indicate potential process injection activity from a beacon or similar mechanisms.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated By AddinUtil.EXE
properties.description:
Detects a network connection initiated by the Add-In deployment cache updating utility "AddInutil.exe".
This could indicate a potential command and control communication as this tool doesn't usually initiate network activity.
properties.author: Michael McKinley (@McKinleyMike), Tony Latteri (@TheLatteri)

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated via Finger.EXE
properties.description:
Detects network connections via finger.exe, which can be abused by threat actors to retrieve remote commands for execution on Windows devices.
In one ClickFix malware campaign, adversaries leveraged the finger protocol to fetch commands from a remote server.
Since the finger utility is not commonly used in modern Windows environments, its presence already raises suspicion.
Investigating such network connections can also help identify potential malicious infrastructure used by threat actors
properties.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated To AzureWebsites.NET By Non-Browser Process
properties.description: Detects an initiated network connection by a non browser process on the system to "azurewebsites.net". The latter was often used by threat actors as a malware hosting and exfiltration site.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated To Mega.nz
properties.description:
Detects a network connection initiated by a binary to "api.mega.co.nz".
Attackers were seen abusing file sharing websites similar to "mega.nz" in order to upload/download additional payloads.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Outbound RDP Connections Over Non-Standard Tools
properties.description:
Detects Non-Standard tools initiating a connection over port 3389 indicating possible lateral movement.
An initial baseline is required before using this utility to exclude third party RDP tooling that you might use.
properties.author: Markus Neis

properties.name: Uncommon Outbound Kerberos Connection
properties.description: Detects uncommon outbound network activity via Kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.
properties.author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community

properties.name: Communication To Ngrok Tunneling Service Initiated
properties.description:
Detects an executable initiating a network connection to "ngrok" tunneling domains.
Attackers were seen using this "ngrok" in order to store their second stage payloads and malware.
While communication with such domains can be legitimate, often times is a sign of either data exfiltration by malicious actors or additional download.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Local Network Connection Initiated By Script Interpreter
properties.description: Detects a script interpreter (Wscript/Cscript) initiating a local network connection to download or execute a script hosted on a shared folder.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated To Cloudflared Tunnels Domains
properties.description:
Detects network connections to Cloudflared tunnels domains initiated by a process on the system.
Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.
properties.author: Kamran Saifullah, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: RDP to HTTP or HTTPS Target Ports
properties.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating to target systems on TCP port 80 or 443
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Malware Callback Communication
properties.description: Detects programs that connect to known malware callback ports based on statistical analysis from two different sandbox system databases
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Network Connection Binary No CommandLine
properties.description: Detects suspicious network connections made by a well-known Windows binary run with no command line parameters
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated By Eqnedt32.EXE
properties.description: Detects network connections from the Equation Editor process "eqnedt32.exe".
properties.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: RegAsm.EXE Initiating Network Connection To Public IP
properties.description: Detects "RegAsm.exe" initiating a network connection to public IP adresses
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Wuauclt Network Connection
properties.description:
Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) to proxy execute code and making network connections.
One could easily make the DLL spawn a new process and inject to it to proxy the network connection and bypass this rule.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)

properties.name: Python Initiated Connection
properties.description: Detects a Python process initiating a network connection. While this often relates to package installation, it can also indicate a potential malicious script communicating with a C&C server.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Office Application Initiated Network Connection Over Uncommon Ports
properties.description: Detects an office suit application (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) communicating to target systems over uncommon ports.
properties.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated From Process Located In Potentially Suspicious Or Uncommon Location
properties.description: Detects a network connection initiated by programs or processes running from suspicious or uncommon files system locations.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Network Connection to IP Lookup Service APIs
properties.description: Detects external IP address lookups by non-browser processes via services such as "api.ipify.org". This could be indicative of potential post compromise internet test activity.
properties.author: Janantha Marasinghe, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Non-Browser Network Communication With Google API
properties.description: Detects a non-browser process interacting with the Google API which could indicate the use of a covert C2 such as Google Sheet C2 (GC2-sheet)
properties.author: Gavin Knapp

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated By IMEWDBLD.EXE
properties.description: Detects a network connection initiated by IMEWDBLD.EXE. This might indicate potential abuse of the utility as a LOLBIN in order to download arbitrary files or additional payloads.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Potential Remote PowerShell Session Initiated
properties.description:
Detects a process that initiated a network connection over ports 5985 or 5986 from a non-network service account.
This could potentially indicates a remote PowerShell connection.
properties.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

properties.name: Suspicious Outbound SMTP Connections
properties.description:
Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an un-encrypted network protocol other than that of the existing command and control channel.
The data may also be sent to an alternate network location from the main command and control server.
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Communication To Uncommon Destination Ports
properties.description: Detects programs that connect to uncommon destination ports
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Outbound Network Connection To Public IP Via Winlogon
properties.description: Detects a "winlogon.exe" process that initiate network communications with public IP addresses
properties.author: Christopher Peacock @securepeacock, SCYTHE @scythe_io

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated Via Notepad.EXE
properties.description:
Detects a network connection that is initiated by the "notepad.exe" process.
This might be a sign of process injection from a beacon process or something similar.
Notepad rarely initiates a network communication except when printing documents for example.
properties.author: EagleEye Team

properties.name: Suspicious Non-Browser Network Communication With Telegram API
properties.description: Detects an a non-browser process interacting with the Telegram API which could indicate use of a covert C2
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Microsoft Dialer
properties.description:
Detects outbound network connection initiated by Microsoft Dialer.
The Microsoft Dialer, also known as Phone Dialer, is a built-in utility application included in various versions of the Microsoft Windows operating system. Its primary function is to provide users with a graphical interface for managing phone calls via a modem or a phone line connected to the computer.
This is an outdated process in the current conext of it's usage and is a common target for info stealers for process injection, and is used to make C2 connections, common example is "Rhadamanthys"
properties.author: CertainlyP

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious Network Connection To Notion API
properties.description: Detects a non-browser process communicating with the Notion API. This could indicate potential use of a covert C2 channel such as "OffensiveNotion C2"
properties.author: Gavin Knapp

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated To BTunnels Domains
properties.description:
Detects network connections to BTunnels domains initiated by a process on the system.
Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.
properties.author: Kamran Saifullah

properties.name: Microsoft Sync Center Suspicious Network Connections
properties.description: Detects suspicious connections from Microsoft Sync Center to non-private IPs.
properties.author: elhoim

properties.name: Rundll32 Internet Connection
properties.description: Detects a rundll32 that communicates with public IP addresses
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Script Interpreter
properties.description: Detects a script interpreter wscript/cscript opening a network connection to a non-local network. Adversaries may use script to download malicious payloads.
properties.author: frack113, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Network Communication With Crypto Mining Pool
properties.description: Detects initiated network connections to crypto mining pools
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Suspicious Dropbox API Usage
properties.description: Detects an executable that isn't dropbox but communicates with the Dropbox API
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Process Initiated Network Connection To Ngrok Domain
properties.description:
Detects an executable initiating a network connection to "ngrok" domains.
Attackers were seen using this "ngrok" in order to store their second stage payloads and malware.
While communication with such domains can be legitimate, often times is a sign of either data exfiltration by malicious actors or additional download.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated By Regsvr32.EXE
properties.description: Detects a network connection initiated by "Regsvr32.exe"
properties.author: Dmitriy Lifanov, oscd.community

properties.name: Network Communication Initiated To File Sharing Domains From Process Located In Suspicious Folder
properties.description: Detects executables located in potentially suspicious directories initiating network connections towards file sharing domains.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Incoming Connection
properties.description: Detects incoming connections to AnyDesk. This could indicate a potential remote attacker trying to connect to a listening instance of AnyDesk and use it as potential command and control channel.
properties.author: @d4ns4n_ (Wuerth-Phoenix)

properties.name: Network Communication Initiated To Portmap.IO Domain
properties.description: Detects an executable accessing the portmap.io domain, which could be a sign of forbidden C2 traffic or data exfiltration by malicious actors
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: RDP Over Reverse SSH Tunnel
properties.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address and on TCP port 3389
properties.author: Samir Bousseaden

properties.name: Office Application Initiated Network Connection To Non-Local IP
properties.description:
Detects an office application (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)  that initiate a network connection to a non-private IP addresses.
This rule aims to detect traffic similar to one seen exploited in CVE-2021-42292.
This rule will require an initial baseline and tuning that is specific to your organization.
properties.author: Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE '@scythe_io', Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated To DevTunnels Domain
properties.description: Detects network connections to Devtunnels domains initiated by a process on a system. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.
properties.author: Kamran Saifullah

properties.name: Silenttrinity Stager Msbuild Activity
properties.description: Detects a possible remote connections to Silenttrinity c2
properties.author: Kiran kumar s, oscd.community

properties.name: Network Connection Initiated To Visual Studio Code Tunnels Domain
properties.description: Detects network connections to Visual Studio Code tunnel domains initiated by a process on a system. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.
properties.author: Kamran Saifullah

properties.name: Communication To LocaltoNet Tunneling Service Initiated
properties.description:
Detects an executable initiating a network connection to "LocaltoNet" tunneling sub-domains.
LocaltoNet is a reverse proxy that enables localhost services to be exposed to the Internet.
Attackers have been seen to use this service for command-and-control activities to bypass MFA and perimeter controls.
properties.author: Andreas Braathen (mnemonic.io)

properties.name: Unusual File Download from Direct IP Address
properties.description: Detects the download of suspicious file type from URLs with IP
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Potentially Suspicious File Download From ZIP TLD
properties.description: Detects the download of a file with a potentially suspicious extension from a .zip top level domain.
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Creation Of a Suspicious ADS File Outside a Browser Download
properties.description: Detects the creation of a suspicious ADS (Alternate Data Stream) file by software other than browsers
properties.author: frack113

properties.name: Unusual File Download From File Sharing Websites - File Stream
properties.description: Detects the download of suspicious file type from a well-known file and paste sharing domain
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Hidden Executable In NTFS Alternate Data Stream
properties.description: Detects the creation of an ADS (Alternate Data Stream) that contains an executable by looking at a non-empty Imphash
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), @0xrawsec

properties.name: Potential Suspicious Winget Package Installation
properties.description: Detects potential suspicious winget package installation from a suspicious source.
properties.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: Exports Registry Key To an Alternate Data Stream
properties.description: Exports the target Registry key and hides it in the specified alternate data stream.
properties.author: Oddvar Moe, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community

properties.name: Suspicious File Download From File Sharing Websites -  File Stream
properties.description: Detects the download of suspicious file type from a well-known file and paste sharing domain
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

properties.name: HackTool Named File Stream Created
properties.description: Detects the creation of a named file stream with the imphash of a well-known hack tool
properties.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
